Scroll down for English

↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ 

 

組織背景

 

HKCR (Hong Kong Community Radio 香港聯合電台) www.hkcr.live 成立於 2016 年，是以灣仔為基地的社區平台和獨立網上電台。

我們已經製作近 700 集包括現場的電台節目、表演錄影和原創的現場演出，當中包括海外及本地的藝術家。作為一個社區平台，HKCR 包容新加入場景的以及在場景裹的邊緣創作者，為他們提供一個可以發聲的地方。

HKCR 是全球網上電台社區的一分子，一個根基於本地而通往世界各地聽眾羣的窗口。

 

為甚麼香港需要 HKCR

 

香港的土地資源非常貧乏，表演空間等的設施不足，網上電台的空間是本地謹餘可以無差別地支援小型獨立創作者及團體，作表演及其他型式的創作藝術呈演的中樞之一。在主流商業音樂的龐大身影下，這是一個獨立藝術家和愛好者成立和為目標對象最後的空間之一。

自疫情起，我們才認識到一直視理所當然的文化人員流動只是暫時性的，不過，交流不會只因地域的限制而停頓，所以，我們意識到我們需要擴闊我們的地平線的分界，始於這次的組織更加電子化上的擴展，它可以使更多的文化交流，突破彊界與時區限制，擴散於大氣電波間。

你們對我們的支持。它將會令地域間的創意羣體的對話得而延續。

 

 

眾籌的目的

 

經過整整4年的「beta」實驗運作階段，我們正在邁入 1.0 正式版的重大擴展計劃。這個關乎於我們目標正式地成立一個功能完善的網上電台，以應付因為版權管制日益嚴重的網路環境。這個擴展計劃將會使我們的拓展節目的編排去容納除了身處本地以外的不同地區的藝術家也可以運用我們的平台繼續作文化的交流。

這樣模式的網上電台在亞洲地區少之有少，我們處於第一世界的邊陲，我們的文化視野局限於第一世界裹，我們希望以一個文化協作為出發點，聚集幾個相鄰的板塊，以區域連系的模式跟地區的音樂一同成長，以拓展我們能夠看見的音樂的界限，和在主流以外以公平和平等的方法與其他地區的文化互相學習，相互相乘。

由於我們屬於完全獨立的狀態，背後沒有任何的人士或機構的直接資金投入。我們的節目也沒有任何廣告收益。組織的運作完全依靠組員的自費和工餘時間的投入。我們主要的於富德樓的特惠租金也在今年中介滿，我們需要展開計劃，為延續組織的運作及其擴展籌集新一輪的必要資金。

 

捐款回禮

 

我們準備了一系列的捐款回禮，其中包括特別限定週邊等。

$90 元捐款，我們會送上 HKCR 2020 合輯專輯電子先行下載 Download Code。

$350  元捐款，我們會送上限量 HKCR 2020 Resident 的長袖記念Tee 以及上述的禮品。

 

 

籌款會帶來的效果

 

你的慷慨捐助不單只幫助我們應付未來一年的開支，它也會支付我們製作新的網站內容。根據你的捐款額，我們的擴展計劃將會分以下階段：

 

第一階段 1.0（現時已完成）

全新的節目典藏系統，令聽眾更簡單地重播及發掘過往的節目。

全新的網站特選版面系統。

全新的網站節目表

全新的桌上及手機友善版面。

節目主持的獨立頁面

網上聊天室

捐款系統

 

第二階段 2.0（籌款目標：$37,620）

21-22 年的營運開支

全新制作室新 HKCR 以及更多原創的節目內容 

更完善的網站使用者體驗及小改款

 

第三階段 3.0（籌款目標：$28,000）

支援即場收聽及隨身聽的手機程式，用戶可儲存心愛節目及得到節目提醒

全新手機友善的頁面

全新的節目探索系統

全新包括新聞，特輯等的音樂編輯文章及影片內容

根據心情混音集 Mood Mix，一按即時提供不同場景適合的音樂Mixtape 混音帶

會員專屬系統

 

籌集資金的用途

 

我們希望可以籌集的資金用來支付我們現時的每月開支以及擴充需要的資金：
 

新工作室及營運開支

現時的租金以及預算未來新工作室的租金（$2000 元）

高速網路供應商（$398 元） 

線上存放以供重播節目的 Soundcloud 月費 ($117 元)

網站伺服器（$419 元）

網域費用（$21 HKD） 

每月  $3,135 元 或 每年 $37,620 元

 

網站及節目擴充

新網站 1.0 開發（已完成）費用（$12,000 元 )

新網站 2.0 開發（2021年）費用（約 $28,000 元）

 

 

總籌款目標：$37,620 + $12,000 + 28,000 = $77,620 元

 

 

此次捐款沒有最低目標，如果我們沒有達到指定的金額，我們會把所得的用來支付我們之前上述的部分日常開支，以及調整我們的計劃，包括去除實體工作室以減省開支，並積極尋找其他資金的可能性。

我們的最低籌款目標是總數的一半，我們希望自已也負責任承擔營運成本的一半。

如果超越籌款目標，我們希望運用有多餘的資金作網頁開發的成本，以及用作提升電台的錄音設備，或撥入儲備或到下年使用。

 

主要捐助者/年度贊助

 

我們會積極考慮接受主要捐助者及年度贊助，如你或你的機構有興趣請直接和我們聯絡。

 

 

媒體聯絡

媒體如有查詢，請電郵聯絡 hkcrlive@gmail.com

 

鳴謝Sui Lam 林淼對這次計劃的義務平面設計

 

 

 

Background

 

Found in 2016, HKCR (Hong Kong Community Radio)www.hkcr.live is a community platform  and independent radio station base in Wan Chai.

We have produced more almost 700 live radio shows including original produced artist live session and programms from both local and travelling artists. 

As a community platform, HKCR sees inclusivity as the key for an online platform to be welcoming for newcomers and those who are marginalised to create a voice of their own. 

HKCR is a counterpart of the global internet radio community, a getaway to connect the global worldwide audience while keeping the local community informed

 

 

Why is this important

 

With already scarcity of affordable venues, spaces such as online radio is one of the last piece of backbone that supports underground artists to make performance and other forms of creative activities indiscriminately, it is the space that powered by independent artists and for the independent artists, where commercial music is dominant of the cultural front. 

Since the pandemic hits the globe, we realised that the continuity of freedom of movement are only temporary, however, ideas shouldn’t stop because of physical barriers, hence, it’s important that we should expand the horizon broader, from this planned upgrade of our operation, it enables more cultural exchange through air waves without limitation of timezone and borders. 

Your support to our continual operation will help incubate an up and coming generation of artists. It embodies the city notion of multiculturalism, keeping city’s array of creative dialogue on air.

 

What is this fundraising is about

 

4 years into the 'beta' phrase of our station, we are going into 1.0 with an big upgrade to our website. This means we finally have a fully functional online radio stream capacity outside of existing streaming platforms which are heavily policed by copy right control system. It would vastly expand our programming ability to facility a wider range of artists who are physically outside of HK but would like to and to be aired on our station due to current border control.

Such online platform is rare in the Asia front, we wish to be one of the first station to be able to provide a central point for artists in the regional network who can use our platform to build a together relationship within the continent. 

Our station is independently run and currently not backed by any funding bodies such as government and institutions. We don't have any income from our streamings nor we do any advertisements. Our (subsidised) tenancy in Footak building will run out soon during in the middle of the year of 2021 and we seek to establish a funding from our audience in order for the station to expand the programming capacity and help our monthly expenses.

 

What You Get

 

We prepare a range of special perks which will award your generous donation to us. These includes digital compilation to tee and more. 

For $90 HKD donation,We plan to launch a unique digital compilation for each backers and aforementioned gifts.

For $350 HKD donation,We have a special HKCR 2020 Memento Tee and aforementioned gifts.

 

 

 

Your Impact

 

Your contribution not only helps HKCR to continue running in the next year, it will also help with our upgrading the website which, depending on your contribution, will allow more resources for including more features. Our three phases of update roll out is as follows:-
 

Phrase 1.0  (Right now)
New audio and video stream player in our website so listeners can tune in 24/7
New shows achieve system allows listeners to search our library of mixes in genre tags
New highlight reel function for featured shows
New schedule function for clearer display
New resident page with one page view of past episodes 
 

Phrase 2.0  (Donation target: $49,620)
Operation cost for the year of 2021 - 2022
New studio space with more original production
General web optimization for better user experience (small improvements)
 

Phrase 3.0  (Donation target: $28,000)
Mobile App with show favorites and push notification
Custom Mobile Web layout
New Music Discovery Function
Original Editorial, News, Features plus Video Content
Advance search function with suggested mood, name search and genre tag
New Mood Mix system
Membership function

 

What We Need

 

We hope to generate enough money to help pay the expense of web development ($12,000 HKD) plus monthly expenses for the coming year.
 

Studio & Operational Cost:

  1. Shared Studio Rental ($2000 HKD)
  2. Electricity ($180)
  3. Internet ($398 HKD)
  4. Soundcloud for our achieve ($117 HKD)
  5. Server ($419 HKD)
  6. Domain cost ($21 HKD)​

Total - $3,135 HKD/month OR $37,620 HKD/annual

Website Development:

New Website 1.0  Development Cost: $12,000 

New Website 2.0  Development Cost: $28,000 

Total - $40,000 HKD 
 

 

Total: $37,620 + $40,000 = $77,620 HKD / 9,951 USD

 

 

We have a flexible target so if we do not reach our target, we will use what we received to pay for our daily expense such as rental and other running costs. We will also consider adjusting our running cost, including cutting off having a physical studio.

Our minimum target is the half of the total estimated cost, it reflects our modest outlook of campaign and we looking for our audience to support half of our estimated cost for 2021 and we shall be responsible for the rest by default.

If we go over our estimation, it can allow us to invest them back to web development as well as upgrading our recording gear, or simply put into reserve for future use. 

 

Major Donor/Year-Round Sponsorship

 

We will consider accept major donor and year-round sponsorship. Please contact us directly should you/ your organisation is interested.

 

 

Media Contact

Press should contact us via our email hkcrlive@gmail.com if you have any inquiries.

 

Special Thanks

Sui Lam 林淼 for volunteering with graphic design of this campaign

Please contact us directly should you/ your organisation is interested.  Media ContactPress should contact us via our email hkcrlive@gmail.com if you have any inquiries. Special ThanksSui Lam 林淼 for volunteering with graphic design of this campaign

story:
Who Am I?

Here's a "formal" introduction: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donny_Goines but honestly that doesn't define me. I'm just a simple man attempting to do #Positive things in this world. I'm an Artist, Entrepreneur, Musician, Author... But most importantly I'm a just a Human Being.

 

 

What I Need?

Here are the specifics:

%65 - %70 will be used for venue of the event. 
%15 - %20 will be used for frames, staging and decor.
%20 - %10 will be used for shipping, misc. costs, etc. (**Unsure of these costs, but they will lower as I put the event together**)

 

 

When And Where It Be?

I would like to debut this first exhibit in New York City in September, but depending upon the success of this first event would like to create more in the future. 

 

 

Why Am I Doing This?

To me, photography is art. It's something I truly have a passion for and I want to really showcase some of the amazing people, places and things I've seen over the past year. Sharing my work online: https://www.instagram.com/donnygoinesav/ is great, but I would like people to see my vision in a more meaningful and memorable way.

story:
DESAFINADOS – To Be Out Of Tune

To coincide with the 25th anniversary of Los Crudos as a band, we are hosting a series of events that will focus on the creative aspects of punk that came out of our scene as well as the arts that moved and continue to move us. Our working schedule is as follows:

OPENING NIGHT (Day 1): We will open an exhibition that presents a timeline of punk on Chicago’s South Side and in the predominantly Latino neighborhoods of Pilsen and Little Village. The exhibit will highlight ephemera, art, photography, and audio/video that were created in the late eighties through the present and will be on display from Friday, Sep. 30th until Saturday, Oct. 8th.

ART FAIR (Day 2): This will be a day for artists active in the community to table and sell their work or simply show work to the public. This will be an amazing opportunity for local and emerging artists to make their work more visible and for the public to see work they might not otherwise have the opportunity to.

FILM/PANEL (Day 3): We will have a panel discussion with members of the local punk scene, including members of Los Crudos. There will be a video screening of outtakes from the documentary "Mas Alla De Los Gritos - A Latino/Chicano Punk Documentary" and hopefully other archival footage of bands that came out of the local scene.

 

GALLERY HOURS (Day 4): The exhibit will be open for viewing during gallery hours.

GALLERY HOURS (Day 5): The exhibit will be open for viewing during gallery hours.

GALLERY HOURS (Day 6): The exhibit will be open for viewing during gallery hours.

 

LITERARY NIGHT (Day 7): On this night we will focus on literature including both Alice Bag of Los Angeles’s seminal punk band The Bags and Michelle Gonzales ("Todd") from Bay Area band Spitboy reading from their books. Sharing the night with the two authors will be local artist Isaac Gomez.

PUNK ARTIST PANEL (Day 8): We will have some local Chicago artists talking about their work within the punk scene and beyond. Participants will include Lupe Garza a.k.a. Gordo, Ricardo Compean, and more TBA.

QUEER ART PANEL/CLOSING PARTY (Day 9):  We have invited a number of out-of-town artists for this event to talk about their work, including David Zamora Casas (San Antonio), Cristy C. Road (New York), Dorian Wood (Los Angeles), and more TBA. Following the panel, there will be a party to formally end the exhibition.

 

The entire series of events will be free to the public so we are asking for support to make this event possible. We will need to cover travel and accommodations for all the artists who are coming from out of state. We would also like to provide stipends to all the artists and speakers. The gallery space has fees that we need to cover and we will be printing a special exhibition booklet that will be given free of charge to all attendees and will mirror the exhibition so that visitors can take this experience with them.

Any amount you can contribute, even $1.00, is greatly appreciated!! If you cannot donate and would still like to get involved or help out, please get in touch with us through our website http://www.crudosoy.com.

IMPORTANT NOTE RE: SHIPPING FOR PERKS:  

If you order any records, prints or perks over $100, OR if you are not in the continental US, we will confirm your shipping cost via email once you have ordered a perk.  We may need to receive a separate payment for your shipping costs. 

All zines, posters and t-shirts are limited and made to order so please be patience with us getting these special perks to you.

Thanks so much!

story:
(For English, please scroll down.)

Hikâyem

Merhaba, adım Banu.

İstanbulluyum ama son birkaç yıldır hep hayalini kurduğum bir Ege kasabasında, ailemle yaşıyorum. 

Çocukluğumdan beri bir şeyler üretmeyi çok seviyorum. Yıllar içinde çok ama çok sevdiğim birkaç şeyin hiç değişmediğini fark ettim: Çamur, kâğıt ve kumaş.

Bugüne kadar hep hayallerinin peşinden giden ve –ne mutlu bana ki– bunların çoğunu gerçekleştiren biri oldum.

Mimar Sinan Güzel Sanatlar Üniversitesi’nde dört güzel yıl geçirdim ve sanat tarihi eğitimi aldım. Bu eğitime İTÜ’de iki yıl daha devam ettim. Ardından çeşitli kültür sanat programlarında metin yazarlığı yaptım. Televizyonda en çok çocuk programları için metin ve senaryo yazarken mutlu oldum.

Çocuklar için bir şeyler yapmayı seviyorum. 2010 yılından bu yana eşim ve yol arkadaşım Yıldıray ile birlikte çocuk kitaplarından söz ettiğimiz Bir Dolap Kitap adlı blogda yazıyoruz. Açık Radyo’da aynı ismi taşıyan bir program hazırlıyoruz. Çocuklar için genel kültür dergisi Dünyalı’yı hazırladık. Şu an birlikte yine çocuklar için birkaç farklı proje üzerinde çalışıyoruz. Çocuklar için yazdığım yayımlanmış iki, yayımlanacak dört ve yazım sürecinde olan iki kitabım var. 

Bunca işin arasında dinlenmek için sürekli origami yapıyor ya da minyatür kitaplar hazırlıyorum. Şimdi bunlar bir kenarda dursun. Gelelim asıl konumuz olan çamura!

Seramik çamuruna ilk kez 2005 yılında özel bir sanat atölyesinde bulandım. O andan itibaren elim hep çamura bulanmış halde kalsın istedim. KAHEM'de (Kadıköy Halk Eğitimi Merkezi) yaklaşık beş sene seramik eğitimi aldım. Toplam 2438 saat! Bu uzun ve bol tozlu saatlerin sonucunda birbirinden değerli bilgiler edinip, çeşitli sertifikalar aldım. (Temel seramik, sırlamacı-alçı model kalıpçı, dökümcü-alçı model kalıpçı, seramik biçimlendirici, sanatsal mozaik, şabloncu-tornada şekillendirici.)

Hayatıma çok güzel iki oğlan çocuğu girdiği için seramik yapmaya bir süre ara verdim. Ama artık onlarla birlikte çamur yoğurmak istiyorum!

Artık kendi atölyemi açmak ve becerimi başkalarıyla paylaşmak istiyorum.

Ne yazık ki tam bu hazırlıklara başlarken annemin geçirdiği çok ciddi sağlık sorunlarıyla hayatımız sarsıldı. Maddi ve manevi olarak çok zorlu bir süreçten geçiyoruz. Annemin bakım masraflarını karşılayabilmem için atölye kurmak artık daha da önemli bir amaç oldu benim için.

 

My Story

Hi, I’m Banu.

I’m originally from Istanbul. A few years ago I moved to a cute Aegean town I’ve always dreamed of. Since then, I’ve been living there (here!) with my husband, two young sons, and my mother.

Since I was a little girl, I’ve loved making things. Along the years, I’ve realized that three materials have always been my favorites: Clay, paper, and fabric.

I’m someone who has pursued her dreams no matter what (lucky me!) and I’ve even turned some of those dreams into reality.

I studied Art History at the Mimar Sinan Academy of Fine Arts in Istanbul. Then, I continued my education at the Istanbul Technical University for two more years. After that, I worked as a writer, creating content for various TV shows on arts and culture. My happiest days as a TV writer were those I spent writing content and scripts for children’s programs.

I love creating things for kids. Since 2010, I’ve been running -- together with my husband and best friend Yıldıray -- a blog called Bir Dolap Kitap (A Closet of Books) where we review children’s books. We’ve been broadcasting a weekly radio show on childen’s books over at Açık Radyo (Open Radio) in the last five years. We’ve also created a monthly children’s culture, arts and science magazine called Dünyalı (Earthling) and brought to life 27 issues.

In addition, I’m a children’s books author with two books published by prominent publishing houses in Turkey. Six new books I’m writing are contracted to be published in the next two years.

Sometimes, I get tired doing all that. When that happens, I sit down and either make origami or create miniature books to reenergize myself. But let’s leave those for another conversation because today, I’d love to tell you about clay!

The first time my hands got dirty with ceramic clay was in 2005 when I visited a private art studio. From that moment on, I desired my hands to never be without clay. I committed to a serious ceramic training for five long years at KAHEM (Kadıköy Community Education Center). I completed a total of 2438 hours!

Through this long and very dusty training I learned a lot and qualified for various certificates (including “the fundamentals of training,” “glazer-plaster model moulder,” “caster-plaster model moulder,” “ceramic designer,” “artistic mosaic,” and “template maker & turntable designer”).

I took a break from ceramic making after two beautiful little boys became a part of my life. But now, I want to create things with clay together with my boys!

I want to open my own ceramic studio and share my knowledge, skills and experience with other people. And I’m ready for it!

As I was getting prepared to start my business, our lives were shaken to the ground when my mother had a serious stroke. Since then, my family and I have been going through a very challenging time -- emotionally and financially. In order for me to meet the financial cost of providing my mother with the best medical and post-stroke care, opening my ceramic studio has become an even more important goal.

***

Atölyemi farklı kılan ne? 

Cincüce Bobin Hizmetleri’nin temelini eğlence oluşturuyor. Beni eğlendiren, keyiflendiren, mutlu eden işler yapıyorum. Üretimlerimi insanlara göstermek, onlarla paylaşmak, emeğimi kazanca çevirmek ve başkalarını da mutlu etmek istiyorum. Atölyemde üreteceğim işlerde ve vereceğim derslerde amacım bu: Buraya gelen insanlar mutlu olacaklar!

Atölyenin merkezinde seramik olacak. Ama origami, kâğıt tasarımlar, minyatür kitaplar ve kumaş oyuncaklar yapmaya da devam edeceğim. Yeni şeyler denemeyi seviyorum. İnsanların bakınca gülümseyeceği nesneler üretmek istiyorum. Elimde koskoca bir “yapılacak fikirler listesi” var!

Daha önce atölye ve dükkân işletmedim. Ancak ne yapacağımı iyi biliyorum. İyi bir iş planı hazırladım ve olası riskler için yeni çözümler bulabilirim. Ayrıca, işimi doğru şekilde başlatabilmek için, birkaç ay önce KOSGEB tarafından verilen 70 saatlik Uygulamalı Girişimcilik Eğitimi sertifika programını başarıyla tamamladım.

What Will Make My Studio Different?  

Fun and play are the two guiding principles of the Goblin Bobbin Services Ceramics and Handcrafts Studio.  

I create whimsy objects that amuse me and make me happy. I want to share what I create with other people and make them happy as well. In the meantime, I want to make a living creating, sharing and selling my work. My number-one motto when it comes to what I’ll create in my studio and the workshops I’ll give is this: People who come to my studio will be happy!

Ceramics will take place at the heart of the studio. But I’ll also continue creating origami, other paper designs, miniature books, and fabric toys. I love experimenting with new concepts and materials. And I want to create objects that will put a huge smile on people’s faces.  In fact, I have a huuuuge “things to create” list waiting to be ticked off!

I haven’t operated a ceramics studio before. However, I know very well what I want to do and how to do it. I’ve devised a very sound business plan, and I’m equipped to find new solutions for any risks.  In addition, I’ve successfully completed a comprehensive 70-hour business training certificate program offered by KOSGEB (the Institute for the Development of Small and Medium-Sized Businesses) to make sure I start my business the right way.

***

Neye İhtiyacım Var? 

Atölyemin en büyük ihtiyacı seramik üretimi için gerekli donanım (Seramik fırını, torna, kompresör, depolama sistemi, hammaddeler vs.).

  • Seramik fırını

  • Fırın ayağı

  • Refraktör set (Fırın rafları, fırın ayakları vs.)

  • Torna

  • Çalışma tezgâhı ve tabureler

  • Seramik objeler için raf sistem,

  • Şekillendirme araçları

  • Kompresör ve boya tabancası

  • Sarf malzemesi (Çamur, sırt altı boya, sır, oksit vs.)

  • Hammaddeler için depolama sistemi

  • Atölye masrafları (Kira, tadilat, tesisat vs.)

 

Bir de mekân giderleri var. Atölyenin uzun ömürlü olması için dükkân kirasını kafamdan çıkarabilmem lazım. Toplanan parayı  mekân kirası ve işi başlatmak için gerekli temel ekipmanı almak için kullanacağım. Bu paranın bir bölümünü ise beni destekleyen kişiler için yapacağım armağan ürünler için kullanacağım.

Atölyenin çekirdek ihtiyaçlarını tamamlayabileceğim sermayeyi toparlayabilirsem, kuracağım bu işletme için hibe ve kredi fonlarına başvuruda bulunabileceğim. İşte bu noktada devreye siz giriyorsunuz.

***

 

What I Need? 

My biggest need for opening a studio is the technical equipment and materials for producing ceramics. Here is a list that includes some of the items I primarily need:

  • Ceramic kiln  

  • Ceramic kiln base

  • Refractory kiln furnitures (kiln shelves and shelf supports)

  • Whirler

  • Working table and stools

  • Shelf system for ceramic objects

  • Modelling tools

  • Compressor and spray gun

  • Raw materials (Clays, slips, glazes, underglazes, oxides etc.)

  • Storage systems for raw materials

  • Studio expenses (rental, alteration, facility costs etc.)

Then, there are the expenses of running a studio. I shouldn’t worry about rent in the first months to be able to set a production system that will enable the studio to survive and thrive. I will use the money I raise to rent a suitable place for the studio and to purchase the crucial equipment and material to start the business. I’ll use the rest of the money to create the items I’ll be giving to my backers who support me.

If I can gather the capital that will help me pay for the essentials for establishing a ceramic studio, I’ll be able to apply for professional grants and credit funds.

And this is where your support plays an important role!

***

Siz Ne Yapabilirsiniz? 

Bana inanan, yapacağım işleri destekleyecek mesenlere ihtiyacım var. Cincüce Bobin Hizmetleri’nin gerçek bir mekâna kavuşmasına yardım etmek ister misiniz?

Bunun için kampanya destekçim olarak yandaki bağış paketlerinden birini seçebilirsiniz.

Bağış yapmayı düşünmüyorsanız, beni tanıdıklarınıza yönlendirebilir ve kampanyamın daha geniş bir çevrede duyulmasını ve başka destekçiler bulmamı sağlayabilirsiniz.

 

What Can You Do? 

I need patrons who believe in me and who will support my work. Would you like to help Goblin Bobbin Services Ceramics and Handcrafts Studio come to life?

If yes, you can become a campaign supporter and choose one of the donation packages listed on this page.

If you don’t want to back me by making a donation, you can still help me by sharing the link of this campaign with your friends on social media and by email. In that way, you can help me spread the word and find other sponsors.

***

Hedef 

Her şey yolunda giderse 2017 yılında “Cincüce Bobin Hizmetleri” seramik, kâğıt ve el işleri atölyesini açmak istiyorum. Gelecek yıl yolunuzu İzmir-Urla’ya düşürürseniz, katkıda bulunduğunuz mekânı görmenizi çok isterim. Size çay demlerim. Bir yandan da çamurdan bir şeyler yaparız. Çok güzel olmaz mı?

Bu mekânı açarsam ne mi olacak? Güzel işler yapacağım ve sizinle paylaşacağım.

 

The Ultimate Goal 

If everything goes as planned, I want to open the Goblin Bobbin Services Ceramics, Paper  and Handcrafts Studio in 2017. If you happen to visit Urla, Izmir next year, I’d love you to come and see the studio you’ll have helped to create. First, I’ll make some tea for you. While the tea is brewing, we can even create things with clay. Woudn’t that be amazing?

Are you wondering what will happen if I succeed at opening my ceramics studio? I’ll create great work and share them with you!

***

Destekçilerime Armağanlarım 

Hayalim için bana destek olanları tek tek bir kenara not edeceğim. Atölyeyi kurup fırınımı alınca da onlar için birbirinden güzel objeler yapıp, fırında taze taze pişirip göndereceğim. 2017’nin ilk aylarını bu işe ayırdım.  

 

Gift for My Backers 

I’m going to keep a list including each and every person who support my campaign to turn my dream into reality. When I open my studio and purchase my kiln, the first thing I’ll do is create beautiful objects out of clay. Then, I’ll bake and send them to my beloved backers on 2017.

 

$5

Yaşasın! / Yippie!

Desteğiniz için teşekkürler. Adınızı blogumun “Destekçiler” bölümünde ve Facebook sayfamda duyuracağım.

///

Thank you so much for your support! I’ll list your name on the “Backers” page of my website. I’ll also announce your name and the fact that you supported me on my Facebook page.

 

$10

El yapımı teşekkür kartı ve origami turna / 

A handmade thank-you card and an origami crane

Size el yapımı bir teşekkür kartı ve bir origami turna  yollayacağım. Ayrıca adınızı blogumun “Destekçiler” bölümünde ve Facebook sayfamda duyuracağım

///

I’ll send you a handmade thank-you card and an origami crane. I’ll also announce your name and the fact that you supported me on my Facebook page.

 

$20

Modüler origami dekoratif süs / Modular origami ornament

Sizin için modüler origami tekniğiyle dekoratif bir süs yapacağım. Ayrıca adınızı blogumun “Destekçiler” bölümünde ve Facebook sayfamda duyuracağım

///

I’ll create for you a handmade ornament using the modular origami technique. I’ll also announce your name and the fact that you supported me on my Facebook page.

 

$30

Seramik kolye / Ceramic Necklace

Sizin için bir adet özel tasarım seramik kolye yapacağım. Ayrıca adınızı blogumun “Destekçiler” bölümünde ve Facebook sayfamda duyuracağım

///

I’ll design for you a unique ceramic necklace. I’ll also announce your name and the fact that you supported me on my Facebook page.

 

$50

Seramik bardak altlığı / Ceramic Coaster

Sizin için bir adet seramik bardak altlığı yapacağım. Ayrıca adınızı blogumun “Destekçiler” bölümünde ve Facebook sayfamda duyuracağım.

///

I’ll design for you a unique ceramic coaster. In addition, I’ll announce your name and the fact that you supported me on my Facebook page.

 

$75

Seramik duvar objesi + %10 indirim kuponu / Ceramic wall decor + 10% discount coupon

Sizin için bir adet seramik duvar objesi tasarlayacağım. Dükkanımdan %10 indirim kuponu kazanacaksınız. Ayrıca adınızı blogumun “Destekçiler” bölümünde ve Facebook sayfamda duyuracağım.

///

I’ll design for you a unique ceramic wall ornament. I’ll also send you a 10% discount coupon you can use in my studio. In addition, I’ll announce your name and the fact that you supported me on my Facebook page.

 

$100

2 seramik bardak altlığı + Origami süs + %15 indirim kuponu /  2 Ceramic Coasters + Origami ornament + %15 discount coupon 

Sizin için iki adet seramik bardak altlığı ve bir origami süs yapacağım. Dükkânımdan %15 indirim kuponu kazanacaksınız. Ayrıca adınızı blogumun “Destekçiler” bölümünde ve Facebook sayfamda duyuracağım.

///

I’ll design for you two unique ceramic coasters and an origami ornament. I’ll also send you a 15% discount coupon you can use IN my studio. In addition, I’ll announce your name and the fact that you supported me on my Facebook page.

 

$250

Seramik duvar objesi +  4 seramik bardak altlığı  + %20 indirim kuponu / Ceramic wall decor +  4 ceramic coasters +  20% discount coupon

Sizin için bir adet seramik duvar objesi ve dört adet bardak altlığı tasarlayacağım. Dükkanımdan %20 indirim kuponu kazanacaksınız. Ayrıca adınızı blogumun “Destekçiler” bölümünde ve Facebook sayfamda duyuracağım.

///

I’ll design for you a unique ceramic wall decor and 4 unique ceramic coasters. I’ll also send you a 20% discount coupon you can use in my studio. In addition, I’ll announce your name and the fact that you supported me on my Facebook page.

 

$500

4 seramik bardak altlığı + özel tasarım seramik obje  + %30 indirim + 1 gün süreli seramik atölye eğitimi / 

4 ceramic coasters + uniquely designed ceramic art object +  30% discount coupon + 1-day ceramic workshop

Sizin için dört adet seramik bardak altlığı, bir seramik obje yapacağım. Dükkânımdan %30 indirim kuponu kazanacaksınız. Bir gün boyunca atölyede konuğum olacak ve workshop’a katılacaksınız. Ayrıca adınızı blogumun “Destekçiler” bölümünde ve Facebook sayfamda duyuracağım.

///

I’ll design for you 4 unique ceramic coasters and a ceramic wall decor. I’ll send you a 30% discount coupon you can use in my studio. I’ll also give you a full 1-day ceramic art training in my studio. In addition, I’ll announce your name and the fact that you supported me on my Facebook page.

 

$1000

Origami süs + 4 seramik bardak altlığı + seramik kolye + seramik duvar panosu + özel tasarım seramik obje  + %35 indirim + atölyede 1 hafta seramik eğitimi / 

Origami ornament + 4 ceramic coasters + ceramic necklace + ceramic wall panel +  35% discount coupon + 1 week ceramic workshop

Sizin için bir origami süs, 4 seramik bardak altlığı, bir kolye, bir duvar panosu ve bir seramik obje yapacağım. Dükkânımdan %35 indirim kuponu kazanacaksınız. Bir hafta boyunca atölyede öğrencim olacaksınız.  Ayrıca adınızı blogumun “Destekçiler” bölümünde ve Facebook sayfamda duyuracağım.

I’ll also give you a free one-week ceramic training in my studio. In addition, I’ll announce your name and the fact that you supported me on my Facebook page.
story_txt:
(For English, please scroll down.) 
Hikâyem
Merhaba, adım Banu.
İstanbulluyum ama son birkaç yıldır hep hayalini kurduğum bir Ege kasabasında, ailemle yaşıyorum. 
Çocukluğumdan beri bir şeyler üretmeyi çok seviyorum. Yıllar içinde çok ama çok sevdiğim birkaç şeyin hiç değişmediğini fark ettim: Çamur, kâğıt ve kumaş.
Bugüne kadar hep hayallerinin peşinden giden ve –ne mutlu bana ki– bunların çoğunu gerçekleştiren biri oldum.
Mimar Sinan Güzel Sanatlar Üniversitesi’nde dört güzel yıl geçirdim ve sanat tarihi eğitimi aldım. Bu eğitime İTÜ’de iki yıl daha devam ettim. Ardından çeşitli kültür sanat programlarında metin yazarlığı yaptım. Televizyonda en çok çocuk programları için metin ve senaryo yazarken mutlu oldum.
Çocuklar için bir şeyler yapmayı seviyorum. 2010 yılından bu yana eşim ve yol arkadaşım Yıldıray ile birlikte çocuk kitaplarından söz ettiğimiz Bir Dolap Kitap adlı blogda yazıyoruz. Açık Radyo’da aynı ismi taşıyan bir program hazırlıyoruz. Çocuklar için genel kültür dergisi Dünyalı’yı hazırladık. Şu an birlikte yine çocuklar için birkaç farklı proje üzerinde çalışıyoruz. Çocuklar için yazdığım yayımlanmış iki, yayımlanacak dört ve yazım sürecinde olan iki kitabım var. 
Bunca işin arasında dinlenmek için sürekli origami yapıyor ya da minyatür kitaplar hazırlıyorum. Şimdi bunlar bir kenarda dursun. Gelelim asıl konumuz olan çamura!
Seramik çamuruna ilk kez 2005 yılında özel bir sanat atölyesinde bulandım. O andan itibaren elim hep çamura bulanmış halde kalsın istedim. KAHEM'de (Kadıköy Halk Eğitimi Merkezi) yaklaşık beş sene seramik eğitimi aldım. Toplam 2438 saat! Bu uzun ve bol tozlu saatlerin sonucunda birbirinden değerli bilgiler edinip, çeşitli sertifikalar aldım. (Temel seramik, sırlamacı-alçı model kalıpçı, dökümcü-alçı model kalıpçı, seramik biçimlendirici, sanatsal mozaik, şabloncu-tornada şekillendirici.)
Hayatıma çok güzel iki oğlan çocuğu girdiği için seramik yapmaya bir süre ara verdim. Ama artık onlarla birlikte çamur yoğurmak istiyorum!
Artık kendi atölyemi açmak ve becerimi başkalarıyla paylaşmak istiyorum.
Ne yazık ki tam bu hazırlıklara başlarken annemin geçirdiği çok ciddi sağlık sorunlarıyla hayatımız sarsıldı. Maddi ve manevi olarak çok zorlu bir süreçten geçiyoruz. Annemin bakım masraflarını karşılayabilmem için atölye kurmak artık daha da önemli bir amaç oldu benim için.
 

My Story
Hi, I’m Banu.
I’m originally from Istanbul. A few years ago I moved to a cute Aegean town I’ve always dreamed of. Since then, I’ve been living there (here!) with my husband, two young sons, and my mother. 
Since I was a little girl, I’ve loved making things. Along the years, I’ve realized that three materials have always been my favorites: Clay, paper, and fabric.
I’m someone who has pursued her dreams no matter what (lucky me!) and I’ve even turned some of those dreams into reality.
I studied Art History at the Mimar Sinan Academy of Fine Arts in Istanbul. Then, I continued my education at the Istanbul Technical University for two more years. After that, I worked as a writer, creating content for various TV shows on arts and culture. My happiest days as a TV writer were those I spent writing content and scripts for children’s programs.
I love creating things for kids. Since 2010, I’ve been running -- together with my husband and best friend Yıldıray -- a blog called Bir Dolap Kitap (A Closet of Books) where we review children’s books. We’ve been broadcasting a weekly radio show on childen’s books over at Açık Radyo (Open Radio) in the last five years. We’ve also created a monthly children’s culture, arts and science magazine called Dünyalı (Earthling) and brought to life 27 issues. 
In addition, I’m a children’s books author with two books published by prominent publishing houses in Turkey. Six new books I’m writing are contracted to be published in the next two years. 
Sometimes, I get tired doing all that. When that happens, I sit down and either make origami or create miniature books to reenergize myself. But let’s leave those for another conversation because today, I’d love to tell you about clay!
The first time my hands got dirty with ceramic clay was in 2005 when I visited a private art studio. From that moment on, I desired my hands to never be without clay. I committed to a serious ceramic training for five long years at KAHEM (Kadıköy Community Education Center). I completed a total of 2438 hours! 
Through this long and very dusty training I learned a lot and qualified for various certificates (including “the fundamentals of training,” “glazer-plaster model moulder,” “caster-plaster model moulder,” “ceramic designer,” “artistic mosaic,” and “template maker & turntable designer”).
I took a break from ceramic making after two beautiful little boys became a part of my life. But now, I want to create things with clay together with my boys!
I want to open my own ceramic studio and share my knowledge, skills and experience with other people. And I’m ready for it!
As I was getting prepared to start my business, our lives were shaken to the ground when my mother had a serious stroke. Since then, my family and I have been going through a very challenging time -- emotionally and financially. In order for me to meet the financial cost of providing my mother with the best medical and post-stroke care, opening my ceramic studio has become an even more important goal.

***
Atölyemi farklı kılan ne? 
Cincüce Bobin Hizmetleri’nin temelini eğlence oluşturuyor. Beni eğlendiren, keyiflendiren, mutlu eden işler yapıyorum. Üretimlerimi insanlara göstermek, onlarla paylaşmak, emeğimi kazanca çevirmek ve başkalarını da mutlu etmek istiyorum. Atölyemde üreteceğim işlerde ve vereceğim derslerde amacım bu: Buraya gelen insanlar mutlu olacaklar! 
Atölyenin merkezinde seramik olacak. Ama origami, kâğıt tasarımlar, minyatür kitaplar ve kumaş oyuncaklar yapmaya da devam edeceğim. Yeni şeyler denemeyi seviyorum. İnsanların bakınca gülümseyeceği nesneler üretmek istiyorum. Elimde koskoca bir “yapılacak fikirler listesi” var! 
Daha önce atölye ve dükkân işletmedim. Ancak ne yapacağımı iyi biliyorum. İyi bir iş planı hazırladım ve olası riskler için yeni çözümler bulabilirim. Ayrıca, işimi doğru şekilde başlatabilmek için, birkaç ay önce KOSGEB tarafından verilen 70 saatlik Uygulamalı Girişimcilik Eğitimi sertifika programını başarıyla tamamladım.
What Will Make My Studio Different?  
Fun and play are the two guiding principles of the Goblin Bobbin Services Ceramics and Handcrafts Studio.  
I create whimsy objects that amuse me and make me happy. I want to share what I create with other people and make them happy as well. In the meantime, I want to make a living creating, sharing and selling my work. My number-one motto when it comes to what I’ll create in my studio and the workshops I’ll give is this: People who come to my studio will be happy!
Ceramics will take place at the heart of the studio. But I’ll also continue creating origami, other paper designs, miniature books, and fabric toys. I love experimenting with new concepts and materials. And I want to create objects that will put a huge smile on people’s faces.  In fact, I have a huuuuge “things to create” list waiting to be ticked off!
I haven’t operated a ceramics studio before. However, I know very well what I want to do and how to do it. I’ve devised a very sound business plan, and I’m equipped to find new solutions for any risks.  In addition, I’ve successfully completed a comprehensive 70-hour business training certificate program offered by KOSGEB (the Institute for the Development of Small and Medium-Sized Businesses) to make sure I start my business the right way.
***
Neye İhtiyacım Var? 
Atölyemin en büyük ihtiyacı seramik üretimi için gerekli donanım (Seramik fırını, torna, kompresör, depolama sistemi, hammaddeler vs.). 

Seramik fırını
Fırın ayağı
Refraktör set (Fırın rafları, fırın ayakları vs.)
Torna
Çalışma tezgâhı ve tabureler
Seramik objeler için raf sistem,
Şekillendirme araçları
Kompresör ve boya tabancası
Sarf malzemesi (Çamur, sırt altı boya, sır, oksit vs.)
Hammaddeler için depolama sistemi
Atölye masrafları (Kira, tadilat, tesisat vs.)
 Bir de mekân giderleri var. Atölyenin uzun ömürlü olması için dükkân kirasını kafamdan çıkarabilmem lazım. Toplanan parayı  mekân kirası ve işi başlatmak için gerekli temel ekipmanı almak için kullanacağım. Bu paranın bir bölümünü ise beni destekleyen kişiler için yapacağım armağan ürünler için kullanacağım.
Atölyenin çekirdek ihtiyaçlarını tamamlayabileceğim sermayeyi toparlayabilirsem, kuracağım bu işletme için hibe ve kredi fonlarına başvuruda bulunabileceğim. İşte bu noktada devreye siz giriyorsunuz.
***
 
What I Need? 
My biggest need for opening a studio is the technical equipment and materials for producing ceramics. Here is a list that includes some of the items I primarily need:

Ceramic kiln  
Ceramic kiln base 
Refractory kiln furnitures (kiln shelves and shelf supports)
Whirler
Working table and stools
Shelf system for ceramic objects 
Modelling tools 
Compressor and spray gun
Raw materials (Clays, slips, glazes, underglazes, oxides etc.) 
Storage systems for raw materials
Studio expenses (rental, alteration, facility costs etc.) 

Then, there are the expenses of running a studio. I shouldn’t worry about rent in the first months to be able to set a production system that will enable the studio to survive and thrive. I will use the money I raise to rent a suitable place for the studio and to purchase the crucial equipment and material to start the business. I’ll use the rest of the money to create the items I’ll be giving to my backers who support me.
If I can gather the capital that will help me pay for the essentials for establishing a ceramic studio, I’ll be able to apply for professional grants and credit funds. 
And this is where your support plays an important role!
***
Siz Ne Yapabilirsiniz? 
Bana inanan, yapacağım işleri destekleyecek mesenlere ihtiyacım var. Cincüce Bobin Hizmetleri’nin gerçek bir mekâna kavuşmasına yardım etmek ister misiniz? 
Bunun için kampanya destekçim olarak yandaki bağış paketlerinden birini seçebilirsiniz.
Bağış yapmayı düşünmüyorsanız, beni tanıdıklarınıza yönlendirebilir ve kampanyamın daha geniş bir çevrede duyulmasını ve başka destekçiler bulmamı sağlayabilirsiniz.
 
What Can You Do? 
I need patrons who believe in me and who will support my work. Would you like to help Goblin Bobbin Services Ceramics and Handcrafts Studio come to life?
If yes, you can become a campaign supporter and choose one of the donation packages listed on this page.
If you don’t want to back me by making a donation, you can still help me by sharing the link of this campaign with your friends on social media and by email. In that way, you can help me spread the word and find other sponsors.
***
Hedef 
Her şey yolunda giderse 2017 yılında “Cincüce Bobin Hizmetleri” seramik, kâğıt ve el işleri atölyesini açmak istiyorum. Gelecek yıl yolunuzu İzmir-Urla’ya düşürürseniz, katkıda bulunduğunuz mekânı görmenizi çok isterim. Size çay demlerim. Bir yandan da çamurdan bir şeyler yaparız. Çok güzel olmaz mı? 
Bu mekânı açarsam ne mi olacak? Güzel işler yapacağım ve sizinle paylaşacağım.
 
The Ultimate Goal 
If everything goes as planned, I want to open the Goblin Bobbin Services Ceramics, Paper  and Handcrafts Studio in 2017. If you happen to visit Urla, Izmir next year, I’d love you to come and see the studio you’ll have helped to create. First, I’ll make some tea for you. While the tea is brewing, we can even create things with clay. Woudn’t that be amazing?
Are you wondering what will happen if I succeed at opening my ceramics studio? I’ll create great work and share them with you!
***
Destekçilerime Armağanlarım 
Hayalim için bana destek olanları tek tek bir kenara not edeceğim. Atölyeyi kurup fırınımı alınca da onlar için birbirinden güzel objeler yapıp, fırında taze taze pişirip göndereceğim. 2017’nin ilk aylarını bu işe ayırdım.  
 
Gift for My Backers 
I’m going to keep a list including each and every person who support my campaign to turn my dream into reality. When I open my studio and purchase my kiln, the first thing I’ll do is create beautiful objects out of clay. Then, I’ll bake and send them to my beloved backers on 2017.
 
$5 
Yaşasın! / Yippie! 
Desteğiniz için teşekkürler. Adınızı blogumun “Destekçiler” bölümünde ve Facebook sayfamda duyuracağım.///Thank you so much for your support! I’ll list your name on the “Backers” page of my website. I’ll also announce your name and the fact that you supported me on my Facebook page. $10

Sizin için modüler origami tekniğiyle dekoratif bir süs yapacağım. Ayrıca adınızı blogumun “Destekçiler” bölümünde ve Facebook sayfamda duyuracağım
///

story:
Why do we need donations?

Last time, Britt sent letters to individual backers and raised $1,500. 

We used all funds for expenses such as the submission manager, website hosting, and poster/flyer printing, as well as the printing of the actual book. Because Riverside Storybook is committed to quality, we want to always print in full color. That starts to cost a lot, especially since we want to include more work in the volume this year.

Eventually, we want to print things like business cards, stickers, t-shirts, and professional advertisements. All of that costs money. You can help us.

For volume 2, we're aiming for $2,000. Help us enrich Spokane by encouraging the next generation of artists. Donate now!

You will receive your name in the book in a special "thank you" section if you donate, flat out. If you donate more than $10, you'll receive a free copy as well. Please do not check "anonymous" if you want your name in the book. We can not credit you if we don't know who you are!

story: GRACIAS!!!!
story_txt: GRACIAS!!!!

story:
ABOUT ME:

First, I seek to change my life.  Having been an artist and writer for 30+ years, I’ve never been able to be truly independent, creating works that are meaningful to me and give back to the world.  I don’t seek to make a fortune, just to survive - and thrive - as a creative force.   

From my original “Fish Eye” oil paintings, I will produce high quality art prints, each matted and signed.  On the back of each artwork I’ll place a short paragraph about the creature depicted, and the struggle it faces.

I will invite other artists to contribute to this project, adding their unique visions of ocean creatures to mine.  If I exceed my campaign goal - I would like to distribute other Fish Eye items such as mobiles, tiles, shirts, mugs, etc.  Marketing will be done online, and through good old-fashioned legwork like selling to shops and at art shows.   

You don’t have to be an environmentalist to appreciate Fish Eyes.  This is not a political issue, we can't expect government to do anything about this.  But we can support individual efforts, no matter how small.   Just ask yourself:  Do you want to live in a world where marine animals and coral reefs can only be observed in aquariums?  Where seafood is so polluted and scarce, it disappears from human diets?   Where sport fishing and diving are ruined for our children? 

Education and a globally shared vision can help reverse the process.  Join me in creating my worthwhile and impactful “Fish Eyes” art project.  I’m sure if these amazing creatures could talk, they would join me in saying a big “thank you”.

PROJECT NEEDS:

Money raised will be used to acquire a high quality art printer, supply of art paper and canvas, ink, and mailing supplies.   I will produce a starter inventory of 100+ art prints of various sizes, along with mats and mailers.  I will create web pages and shops on sites such as Etsy, Artfire, Artnet, Shopify and more.  I will take prints and other Fish Eye items to art shows and shops to sell directly or on consignment.

    REWARDS:

    Believe me, I know every dollar counts – that’s surely the case with me, a struggling artist.   So I sincerely appreciate any amount you can contribute.   

    As you’ll see in the perks column on the right, everyone who supports this project receives a unique gift.  A special prize will be rewarded for a single contributor of $1,000 - a framed original oil painting of an octopus eye.  During this campaign I will be showing the progress of this exciting artwork, which I think will be my best one yet!   I'm also  hoping that I can get a few people to go all-in and order a personal painting of any sea creature's eye - your choice.

    Even if you can’t contribute financially, look me up on Facebook, and let’s share our love for the ocean and its creatures.  I know of many organizations who need volunteers, and just networking and communicating helps keeps this important conservation issue alive.

    RISKS AND CHALLENGES:

    • If I raise at least $500 - I will still send everyone at least one signed paper print, and will probably extend the campaign.   
    • If you want the original painting offered ($2000 level) – you may have to be a bit patient!  I hope many people will ask for this, but of course each one takes a couple of weeks to paint.
story_txt:
ABOUT ME:
First, I seek to change my life.  Having been an artist and writer for 30+ years, I’ve never been able to be truly independent, creating works that are meaningful to me and give back to the world.  I don’t seek to make a fortune, just to survive - and thrive - as a creative force.   
From my original “Fish Eye” oil paintings, I will produce high quality art prints, each matted and signed.  On the back of each artwork I’ll place a short paragraph about the creature depicted, and the struggle it faces.
I will invite other artists to contribute to this project, adding their unique visions of ocean creatures to mine.  If I exceed my campaign goal - I would like to distribute other Fish Eye items such as mobiles, tiles, shirts, mugs, etc.  Marketing will be done online, and through good old-fashioned legwork like selling to shops and at art shows.   
You don’t have to be an environmentalist to appreciate Fish Eyes.  This is not a political issue, we can't expect government to do anything about this.  But we can support individual efforts, no matter how small.   Just ask yourself:  Do you want to live in a world where marine animals and coral reefs can only be observed in aquariums?  Where seafood is so polluted and scarce, it disappears from human diets?   Where sport fishing and diving are ruined for our children? 
Education and a globally shared vision can help reverse the process.  Join me in creating my worthwhile and impactful “Fish Eyes” art project.  I’m sure if these amazing creatures could talk, they would join me in saying a big “thank you”.
PROJECT NEEDS:
Money raised will be used to acquire a high quality art printer, supply of art paper and canvas, ink, and mailing supplies.   I will produce a starter inventory of 100+ art prints of various sizes, along with mats and mailers.  I will create web pages and shops on sites such as Etsy, Artfire, Artnet, Shopify and more.  I will take prints and other Fish Eye items to art shows and shops to sell directly or on consignment.
REWARDS:
Believe me, I know every dollar counts – that’s surely the case with me, a struggling artist.   So I sincerely appreciate any amount you can contribute.   
As you’ll see in the perks column on the right, everyone who supports this project receives a unique gift.  A special prize will be rewarded for a single contributor of $1,000 - a framed original oil painting of an octopus eye.  During this campaign I will be showing the progress of this exciting artwork, which I think will be my best one yet!   I'm also  hoping that I can get a few people to go all-in and order a personal painting of any sea creature's eye - your choice.
Even if you can’t contribute financially, look me up on Facebook, and let’s share our love for the ocean and its creatures.  I know of many organizations who need volunteers, and just networking and communicating helps keeps this important conservation issue alive.
RISKS AND CHALLENGES:

If I raise at least $500 - I will still send everyone at least one signed paper print, and will probably extend the campaign.   
If you want the original painting offered ($2000 level) – you may have to be a bit patient!  I hope many people will ask for this, but of course each one takes a couple of weeks to paint.

story:
Bref résumé

 À l'issu de nos études au Baccalauréat en Arts Visuels et Médiatiques, nous organisons une exposition qui sera présentée en mai 2017. Pour plusieurs, il s'agit d'une première expérience d'organisation et de présentation publique de nos démarches. 

Nous espérons récolter un montant qui permettra de défrayer les coûts reliés à l'organisation de l'évènement, notamment la location d'un lieu d'exposition. 

Tous les dons sont grandement appréciés! N'hésitez pas à partager!

Un immense merci à tous ceux qui ont déjà contribué à la première vague de financement, nous vous sommes très reconnaissant!

story:
Fractured- all female live art performance and skill sharing workshops and forum discussions.

Kinsukuroi is the Japanese art of applying gold or silver paint within the cracks of broken ceramics that have been glued back together. It is believed that the object becomes more beautiful after it has been broken. Taking this idea as a metaphorical concept Fractured explores notions of the broken, the beautiful and the journey from one to the other. Fractured is a fully live, 1 hour long piece of performance art that has an entire  studio album created for it.

Through our creative offering we hope to inspire and empower other humans (females especially!) to bring their art to this industry with confidence and a whole hearted understanding of just how vitally important these artworks are for our entire community.

After our initial crowd funding campaign raised 22% of our overall goal we are now asking for further support to fully realise this dream. We are asking for the financial support of just $4000 from our communities to breath life into this vision. So far in our individual creative journeys we have always funded our projects ourselves. We are artists, mothers (7 children between us all!) and feminists and with financial support we can keep this collaboration moving forward and deliver performance art that is truly next level, also addressing the glaringly obvious gender inequality that exists within this industry.

Statistics show that there hasn't been much of a shift in this issue in the last 20 years or so and we feel there is much to be gained from this creation and furthermore from activating skill sharing workshops for women to learn and collaborate.

Every single dollar you choose to donate will be received with such gratitude and will be poured directly into this vision. From the purchasing of much needed equipment to sublimation printing of artwork to fabric every single dollar will help us get there!

Fractured will debut early February 2017 with a performance evening that will showcase our collaboration and that of other female artists within the industry. Continuing on with a full Summer season of festival performances, workshops, forums and gigs with a view to tour our collaboration overseas in the second half of 2017.

We thank you in advance for your support and look forward to sharing this amazing and important creative immersion with you all as it unfolds.

story:
Hello!

I've never done anything like this before but it's become clear that I have nothing to lose by putting myself out there in order to seek the support that I need as I pursue my new educational and creative direction.

You might know me as the one of the owners of Wolf and Bear's food carts which Jeremy Garb and I began together in 2009. You might know me as a fellow student at Portland State University (School of Social Work, Painting classes, Conflict Resolution, & Spanish), or you might not know me at all and have come across this campaign some other way :)

The reasons that I am seeking support:

-significant increases in the cost of living in Portland (generally)

-significant increase in personal expenditures due to big changes in life circumstances which include but are not limited to: a move, the cost of tuition and textbooks, airfare and accommodations abroad that I booked for this trip, and art supplies (canvas and other supports/panels, drawing materials, paint and other mediums)

-I am passionate about art and creative exchange. It is a crucial component of my personal ability to sustain and develop happiness, and to feed my excitement for life. I want to share this passion with you and I am committed to giving back by way of my participation in the community, as well as by way of my support of other artists and creative explorers.

What you will get in return for contributions:

The campaign perks will depend on the amount of your contribution to the campaign. The options include:

profound and genuine gratitude, a handprinted postcard sent to you from Berlin, an original print from hand carved woodblock or linocut, small or large sized paintings, or the option to request a small or medium sized custom painting inspired by the subject or theme of your choice.

story:
Hi my name is Jess Hirsch. I am an artist and sculptor living in Minneapolis. After studying traditional Scandinavian woodcraft (Sloyd) for the past year, I am launching a workspace to teach women what I have learned, share space and tools, and employ women and non-binary craftspeople at a great wage.  Its called, "Women's Woodshop."

My campaign is two fold: 

1)  Fundraise the remaining 25% of the Minnesota State Arts Board Folk and Traditional Art Grant which ends April 1. 

2) Open Women’s Woodshop with great equipment for students and instructors.

 

Your contributions will go directly towards the safety and livelihood of women. 

I will use the funds to:

~Buy Saw Stop Table Saw Known as the hot dog saw, the blade drops once it senses condensation, saving fingers!  (This will also require installing 220 electrical outlets in the store)

~Buy Dust Collection System Since saw dust is listed as a carcinogenic.

~Help with Rent so I can pay instructors a great wage.

~The funds will contribute to my yearlong apprenticeship with Jim Sannerud, a master bowl turner. With the generous support of the Minnesota State Arts Board I was able to purchase equipment, take weekly lessons and rent a studio. The grant covered 75% of $25,000, now I am hoping to fund the remaining 25% here.  

When I first graduated from college, I had no equipment and my sculpture suffered. After 13 years of woodworking I have accrued many of the tools a shop needs and want to share equipment with others. 

Sure, there are plenty of shared studio spaces where you can join with an affordable membership, but as a lady, these co-ed spaces can be intimidating. Unfortunately women are treated differently in the shop than dudes. Its no one’s fault, men are trying to be helpful, but I have had my fair share of mansplaining and even had tools taken from my hands. Thats why I wanted to start Women’s Woodshop. Its a place where women are supported and given space to learn in an encouraging environment. The goal is not separation, but rather to give women the foundation to enter this male-dominated field. Women's Woodshop also offer co-ed classes to practice a space where men and women can learn alongside each other.

Not to mention, the ladies want it! I have been teaching Ladies Only Spoon Carving for the past year and my classes always fill. Its proves there is a need. 

All I need now is a little help fundraising to cover the grant that got me started and to buy some major safety equipment. Once these key pieces are in place, the shop will be buzzing with feminine energy and empowerment.

I have an MFA from the University of Minnesota in Sculpture, have been spoon carving for seven years, turning for two, and teaching after school programs for four years. I know I can teach, run a shop, and keep people stoked on woodworking. However, I am not going to do this alone. Women's Woodshop will be a place where women are in leadership roles and I have 4 amazing instructors already in the ropes to teach rad classes like: timber frame joinery, Japanese tea trays, and spindle turning. I am meeting with new instructors every week to brainstorm great introductory classes for women. With a fleet of skilled craftspeople, Women’s Woodshop is going to thrive. 

If you can’t help financially, but have some tools to donate, I would be happy to take them. Get in touch. Also sharing the word always helps too. Thanks so much!

story:
The above video was from our last show at SITE Gallery Houston in 2017. It gives you a good understanding of our organization and what we put into just one of our projects.

Who We Are:

We are a team of THREE art professionals who have organized many art-related projects in the past. We are now organizing a festival of grand proportions for the ENTIRE CITY!

  • Volker Eisele: the innovator and enthusiastic ring-leader.
  • Antarctica Black: the behind the scenes multi-tasking maestro.
  • Tommy Gregory: the idea-man and bustling curator.

Sculpture Month Houston is in its third year and we continue to survey the sculptural medium and bring it to the greater Houston area. In our first exhibition, "From Space to Field," in 2016, we showcased the emergence of a gifted generation of sculptors. The diversity of artworks served as a fitting analogy for the diversity of the city of Houston. That inaugural festival included 43 venues around the city. In our interim 2017 exhibition, “Tensile Strength”, we held a stand-alone show at the Silos at Sawyer Yards. There, inside SITE Gallery Houston, we invited artists from across Texas and over its borders to enhance a multi-sensory experience for our audience. This new approach brought us new insight and direction for our 2018 festival, "Peak Shift".

Each year we have sought to raise the bar, exhibiting ever-more complex, sophisticated and innovative art. In refining our format over the past two years of exhibitions at SITE, artists are now able to create ever-grander installations by working in one, two, or even three contiguous silos. This arrangement challenges artists to think on a larger scale and to further explore the possibilities of this singular architecture. This year we are excited to announce that internationally-lauded Jessica Stockholder will be a participant.  

Below is a video from one of artists from our first rendition of SMH at SITE Gallery Houston at the silos: Jo Ann Fleischhauer.

What We Need & What You Get:

Our artists need funding to bring the most innovative, enriching and thought-provoking pieces to life in a monumental space. An example of venues we are incorporating into our 2018 programming are as follows:

  • SITE Gallery Houston, which is housed in the re-purposed physical structure of the old Success Rice Silos.
  • The defunct control tower designed by IM Pei at the Bush Intercontinental Airport.
  • The 1940 Air Terminal Museum along with their vintage airplane hangar at Hobby Airport.

Besides the perks listed on the side (which we will discuss in more detail in a minute), you will get a chance to experience cutting-edge installations in incredibly unique venues. You will give artists a chance to challenge themselves and invoke work they never deemed possible. You will get to be a part of something huge in Houston.

This Year's Events:

  • October 11, 2018 (11am-12:30pm) - The Commencement Celebration @ The Police Officers' Memorial at Buffalo Bayou (created by Jesus Moroles). The honor guard of the Police Department will meet and greet with the art community at the largest sculptural monument in Houston. 
  • October 12, 2018 (6pm-9pm) - The VIP Preview @ SITE Gallery Houston (By invitation only, or gifted through a perk!).
  • October 13, 2018 (6pm-9pm) - The Public Kick-Off Reception @SITE Gallery Houston (FREE!)
  • There will be several performances by some of the installation artists on both of those nights.
  • Every Saturday at 2pm during the length of the festival, tours will be offered to the public for free at SITE Gallery given by the curators and exhibiting artists.
  • More events to follow - be sure to check our website (sculpturemonthhouston.org) during the festival: October 11 - December 1, 2018.

In addition to the SMH curated exhibitions, we are welcoming other art venues from throughout the city, including commercial galleries, nonprofit art spaces, the Houston Airport System, museums, and City Hall, to present sculpture exhibits specifically for the celebration of the sculptural medium under the umbrella of SMH. We hope to have a finalized list of venues for 2018 by the end of July.

Why We Do What We Do:

Installation art has become a popular and internationally recognized medium where contemporary issues are explored in an immersive way. Many artists have chosen the installation medium because of the inherent ability to go beyond conservative conventions and traditions.
 
Sculpture Month Houston’s series of site-specific installations tie into this current body of ideas that is percolating throughout the art world in places like Documenta and the Venice Biennale. We provide artists with the access to weigh in on this with their creative responses in order to enrich and shape the visual dialogue. SMH is participating in this dialogue by providing artists with an opportunity to be challenged to create site-specific installations in unique architectural venues.

Other Ways You Can Help:

  • Join our volunteers and help with tour groups, installing art work, or gallery assistance. (email us at sculpturemonthhouston@gmail.com to be put on the volunteer list!)
  • Get the word out and make some noise!! (Tell all your friends!)
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Come to the Public Kick-Off!

Perks:

We have listed different perks depending on how much you are able to give. For example, $50 gets you a high-five, while $150 gets you two passes to our VIP Preview event on October 12th! This wide range offers you some fun surprises while you are offering up money to go towards our artists: you can even make a note in your donation if you want it to go towards a specific artist! We thank you ahead of time for your generous gifts and can't wait for you to see what we come up with for our 2018 exhibitions!

THANK YOU!

Participating artists at SITE Gallery:

Hillerbrand + Magsamen (Houston)

Liss LaFleur (Houston)

Frances Bagley (Dallas)

Alicia Eggert & Charlie Hoey (Denton)

Hills Snyder (San Antonio)

James Canales (San Antonio)

Jeff Williams (Austin)

Kamila Szczesna (Galveston)

Ann Wood (Galveston)

Leticia Bajuyo (Corpus Christi)

Jessica Stockholder (Chicago)

James Talambas (Fort Worth)

Participating venues for our 2018 festival:

story:
Pe scurt:

Noi suntem Mihai si Renard!

De la MICA nostră unire, am creat caricaturi ȋn diverse locații și ocazii.

Nunti/Botezuri/Parastase/Lansări/Prăbusiri/Baluri/Spitale/Catedrale

Acum, cu ocazia centenarului, ne-am decis să strângem mai multi artiști români, cu care să colaborăm, ȋn vederea realizării unor albume inedite, de caricaturi, "Figuri de stil" și "Deformări profesionale".

 Prin acest proiect dorim, ca și artiști caricaturiști, să lăsăm ceva României, să reamintim valorile naționale, și poate, să restabilim caricatura ca și ARTA. Si toate acestea ȋntr-un mod unic și amuzant, ușor de digerat.

Contribuind la acest proiect, veți putea ajuta la crearea unei punți de legatură ȋntre arta digitală și cea de sevalet, vor fi facuti "de râs" sub ochii dumneavostră  200 de romani mari.

Ce primiți?

  • Albume cartonate
  • Caricatura voastră​ pe CANVAS!
  • Sacoșă personalizată și TRICOU!
  • Insigne si PDF
  • Surprize ascunse!
  • Şi chiar un ȋntreg eveniment 200+ caricaturi!

Ce ne trebuie?

  • 20000 $ pentru finanțarea ambelor albume, aducerea lor ȋn plim plan pe piață, ȋn spatii neconvenționale, ȋn școli (ca expoziții și informații generale și specifice), și pe produse promoționale (calendare, cărti poștale, tricouri, etc...), și, poate cel mai important, introducerea ȋn săli de expoziție! 

Albumul "Figuri de stil"

  • Cu ocazia centenarului marii UNIRI, ne-am hotărat, să unim într-un album, cei mai buni caricaturiști români, ȋntr-o formă stilistică literar, "Figuri de stil"
  • "Nu ne intelegeți greșit, vom desena ȋn continuare, ȋnsă prin unirea disciplinelor, sperăm să putem (re)afirma caricatura, ca mijloc plastic, social și cultural, pe scena românească."
  •  "FIGURI DE STIL", sau mai bine "figuri de stylus", fiind realizat ȋn mediul digital, se dorește o punte de legatură ȋntre arta modernă, care duce spre digitalizare, și caricatura de "șevalet".
  • Din lipsa unor criterii coerente de clasificare și prin faptul că alegerea s-a bazat exclusiv pe bunul plac al telespectatorilor care au participat la vot, s-a ajuns la o listă problematică, care a demarat sute de reacții și luări de poziție.
  • Lista completa: https://ro.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mari_rom%C3%A2ni

Albumul "Deformări profesionale"

  • Cel de-al doilea album oferă o imagine mai clară pe care România a reușit să o facă ȋn exterior, prin acești "ministri de externe", personalități care au avut un impact major asupra științei și culturii universale.

  • Cu un discurs mai liniar ȋn cea ce privește diferențele dintre profesii și aportul adus lor, dar net superior prin calitate și direcție, "Deformări profesionale" ILUSTREAZĂ modul ȋn care atât artiștii cât și cei prezentați, au fost afectați de profesia lor, schimbandu-li-se percepția asupra vieții.

  • Dorim să facem cunoscute invențiile, operele, și impactul pe care aceștia le-au avut asupra lumii, ȋntr-un mod cât mai profesional, și "puțin deformat".

  • Lista completa: http://www.eualegromania.ro/articole/personalit...

Impact

  • Proiectul "despică firul ȋn patru", scotând ȋn evidență diferențele dintre opinia publică și părerile avizate. 
  • Pe parcursul campaniei vom publica și reacțiile profesioniștilor, din domeniile implicate: Litere, Cinematografie și Media, Videografie, Publicitate și P.R., Crowdfunding, Arte Vizuale, Comedie, Edituri și Tipografii.
  • Ȋ​n plus, sperăm să ilustrăm clar cum domeniile se intrepătrund, și care este relația dintre ele, prin asemănări și deosebiri deopotrivă.​
  • "Figuri de STILus" si "DeFORMAri profesionale" doresc să imbine caricatura "de gag", de "șevalet" și stylus digital, acestea ȋmprumutând reciproc elemente, pentru a crea un efect plastic, dar și comic ȋn sălile de expoziție, și pentru a putea fi scoase ȋn afara albumului.

Experiența

  • Experiența notabilă din această diecție este colaborarea cu "DeScris" și "Creștem Idei", care a dus la realizarea albumului "Clujul meu și Clujul tău".  http://crestemidei.ro/ClujulmeusiClujultau#
  • Ȋn acest album, Mihai ilustrează felul ȋn care se proiectează pe sine, și cum era perceput ...in 2013.

 

  • Ca și experiență profesională, toți cei implicați au realizate mai bine de 1000 de caricaturi, atât ȋn mediul digital cât și tradițional, plus participări cu rezultate excepționale la concursuri online și offline, din care menționam "Caricaturama 3000".

 

Deci cum? Cine suntem?

Veronica Gafton. 3D/2D animator, graphic designer, pictor, și fotograf. De la personajele animate nu a fost decât un pas spre caricaturã. 

Caricaturama ShowDown 3000 - (2014) First Place - Adam Sandler, Second Place - Keira Knightley, (2015) Third Place - King Michael of Romania, Second Place - Emilia Clarke, Third Place - Robert  Plant, (2016) First Place - Travis Fimmel, Third Place - Gary Moore. 

http://vera-gafton.wixsite.com/vera-gafton

Renard Tamas. Fac portrete și caricaturi de 10 ani, și ȋmpreună cu Mihai din 2012!

De 5 ani, lucrez ca game designer, pe partea de grafică, designul de caracter, fundal, UI, concept art și animație, făcând parte din "rutina" mea zilnică.

Dețin cunoștinte solide PS & AI.

http://www.visualart.me/snareminds

Mihai Nistor. Fac caricaturi de 15 ani, am absolvit UNArte Bucuresti, și din 2000 până ȋn 2010, am realizat aproximativ 10 000 de portrete și caricaturi. Am calatorit și lucrat pe vapoare de croaziera pana in 2009, cand m-am intors și am colaborat cu maestrul Popas. Ȋn 2012 am ȋnființat "Na haz!"(Urmează râsul) alături de Renard, și din 2016 particip la marile convenții de tatuaje din țară, ca și "caricturist oficial".

http://nahaz.ro/evenimente/

Sergiu Grapă. Fac caricatură de 20 de ani, fiind absolvent al Universitatii de Arte George Enescu, Iași. 

Premii: 2010 Premiul I pentru Grafică satirică, Muzeul Satului, Gura Humorului | 2009 Premiul I pentru Portret, Casa Culturii Urziceni | 1996 Premiul I pentru Grafică, Teatrul Național Craiova | 1995 Premiul RAO, Casa Studențească Iași | 1995 Premiul I pentru Grafică, Galeria de Artă, Giurgiu

http://uapriasi.ro/grapa-sergiu-valentin/

Cătălin Zaharia. Am urmat școala de artă din Brasov, apoi liceul de artă, terminând la secția grafică. Incă de pe bancile liceului am lucrat pentru un cotidian local, foarte actual la vremea aceea, Bună Ziua Brașov, mai apoi am continuat studiile la Universitatea de Arte George Enescu din Iași, unde ȋn paralel lucram și la Monitorul de Iași, un ziar local cu o echipă de profesioniști de unde am ȋnvățat multe lucruri despre gazetărie și implicit despre grafică de presa și caricatură. Ȋn anul 2006 am terminat și masteratul tot la aceeasi facultate, specialitatea arte plastice, din dorința de a-mi aprofunda cunostințele legate de artă și nu numai. Ȋn prezent sunt colaborator la mai multe publicatii locale și naționale, printre ele numărându-se cotidianul local Brașovul Tău, rețeaua Adevarul, printre care se numară multicunoscuta revistă de bussines Forbes, Money Express, etc...

http://zahariacatalinmihai.blogspot.com/

Riscuri si Provocari

  • Toti cei implicați au o experiență vastă cu ce insemnă "deadline", lucrul direct cu clientul, și provocările financiare. Ne asumăm răspunsul la toate contribuțiile primite și recompensarea acestora și lansarea albumelor la timp, aceasta ȋnsemnând să iesim un pic mai mult ȋn afara zonei noastre de confort, și să ne implicam activ atât la răspandire cât și la implementarea proiectului.
  • Planul nostru este să lansăm albumul "Figuri de stil" la 1 decembrie, având ȋn vedere terminarea și celui de-a doilea, "Deformări profesionale", până in 20ish decembrie.
  • "Caricatura pentru caricatură", este cea care nu naște dispute.

Alte moduri prin care ne puteti ajuta!

  • Pe cei ce doresc să ne susțină proiectul intr-un mod non-financiar, ȋi rugam să "ȋmprăștie zvonul", "Vestea cea bună", printr-un share ȋn retelele lor!
  • Pentru asta, folosiți "instrumentele de ȋmprăstiat" INDIEGOGO!

Urmează râsul!

 

En: We, romanian cartoonists, got united under this project, to re-establish caricature as a form of ART, all this in a unique and fun way. We want to leave something of our work to Romania and not only, as artists, who express themselves through caricature.

By sustaining this project, you help create a bridge between digital and traditional art.

  • The first album, "Figure of speech/style/stylus", combine easel and stylus elements, to create fun and fine art.

We'll lay out those 100 romanians, who made an positive image for Romania, and another 100 who're well known, will be made "fools", drawn, right under your very sight.

Our albums aim is to illustrate the differences between "opinion" and "experience based", how literature and visual art intertwined themselves, how are them related, through similarities and differences both.

  • "Professional untraining/distortion" - The second one illustrates how we, as artists, and the 100, get affected by our lines of work, changing the way we see life and we express ourselves.

Through the duration of the project, we'll publish the reactions of "professionals" form all the fields involved (to see how they got their point/perspective changed): Literature, Cinema and Media, Photography, Advertising and P.R., Crowdfunding, Visual Arts, Comedy, Publishing and Printing Houses.

Follow the laughter!

story:
An Alter For Intention

The Wishing Wings are an event-specific installation meant to inspire people to speak their wishes into existence.

The base of the Wings is typically shaped using a combination of chicken wire and scrap wood, with responsibly-sourced local bark and branches used to form the exterior. The Wings are then adorned with crystal garlands, flowers, and found #prettyshinythings.

Community members are invited to write/draw their wishes on a heart, and attach the hearts to the Wings - allowing others to witness and hold space for their intentions. At the closing of each display, the Wings are saged and each heart is carefully removed by Wing guardians - who then transport the wishes for burning. 

We are happy to announce that the Wishing Wings have been invited to be shared at art festivals, concerts, and intentional gatherings in Ontario and North America this Summer of 2019.

Burning?

Ceremonial fire has the power to cleanse, transform, and purify. The Wishing Wings team believes in fire, in rebirth, and its ability to help make wishes come true.

Upcoming Burns:

  • Temple at Hyperborea (Ontario's Regional Burn) May 2019 
  • Temple of Direction and burn at Burning Man 2019

Past Burns:

  • Temple Galaxia at Burning Man 2018

Invest In Wishes!

In order to continue bringing the power of positive manifestation to events across North America (and beyond!), we need your support! 

Thanks to your contribution we will obtain:

  • Responsibly sourced materials
  • Upgraded lighting
  • Crystals
  • Non-toxic varnish
  • CNC Hearts for Wishes
  • Custom signage (created by local Toronto calligrapher)
  • AND the means to have our Wings from Toronto to other gatherings throughout the summer!

A Wish Is A Dream Your Heart Makes

The Wishing Wings are more than an interactive sculpture, they are a catalyst for evolution.

Your investment in the Wishing Wings Project will assure that we have the tools needed to create a platform for people to dig deep and turn their Wishes into reality.

Challenge Accepted!

Setting intentions is one of the most impactful things we can do. By speaking our wishes we are turning our internal ruminations into external opportunities.

Thanks to your contribution The Wishing Wings Project will stand for creating the space to manifest your dreams!
