Challenge Accepted!
Setting intentions is one of the most impactful things we can do. By speaking our wishes we are turning our internal ruminations into external opportunities.
Thanks to your contribution The Wishing Wings Project will stand for creating the space to manifest your dreams!

story:
Vision

     The next chapter of life is beginning and I’m excited to share our plans.  After several years of research we moved to Morrison, CO in September 2017.  Morrison is located in the foothills just west of Denver, home to the infamous concert venue Red Rocks Amphitheater.  It has taken a bit longer than I had hoped to get the next project off the ground and running, but I’m pleased to say things are now moving along swiftly.  I've been making pots since shortly after we moved, yet I've been firing with others until the kiln shed project is complete.  The natural beauty of the area is inspiring, and I'm excited for the new work to come that's been circling in my head for many months.  The variety of kilns in the project will allow me to explore a variety of surface finishes for this new body of artwork.  I appreciate any help you can provide in helping me continue my career working in clay.

     Teaching at the college level for 15 years, teaching in China, building a successful clay program at the Lighthouse Art Center, creating community around my previous wood kiln, and teaching several workshops every year has given me the information I need to make my next studio even better.  My vision is to host 3-4 guests for a “session” where we can share ideas, test theories, make art, fire kilns, discuss rationale behind decision making, and learn how to decipher the actual effects of our actions.  I appreciate the energy in workshops with large groups like Ashfest with 25 participants, however I enjoy the progression and intimacy of a smaller group.  My interest is in developing a curriculum for each groups' specific set of goals, and diving deep into understanding how to attain resolution.

     Traveling for workshops led me to meet many wonderful people and beautiful places. In the past 20 years I’ve conducted workshops across the country and abroad.  The majority of these have been 2 day demonstrations centered around making/talking about pots. A few times per year I’ve conducted firing workshops at university's and art centers like Peters Valley or University of Kentucky ranging from 4 days to 2 weeks focused on the heating/firing techniques in wood burning kilns.  On average I also conduct 1 kiln building/firing workshop per year.  Each kiln has taught the workshop participants and I many things about life, clay, group effort, and the abundant variety of kiln design.  So many of you have asked to come fire and learn with me at our former property in Jupiter, FL, though we just did not have the space.  

     This dream of inviting a small group for a “session” is now becoming a reality.  The opportunity to come work with me in clay, assist with kiln building, stoke the kiln, etc. is just around the corner.  The weather in Morrison is ideal with summertime highs in the low 80’s, dipping into the 50’s at night.  The winter weather is up and down, with daytime highs averaging in the 40’s dipping to 20 at night.  If you are looking for alternate activities during your session while the kiln is cooling, the skiing, hiking, biking, fishing, rafting, and rock climbing opportunities are abundant and close by.  We also value the variety of events, dining, arts and culture a large city has to offer, so Denver is ideal being only a 35 minute drive.  Denver is also centrally located, so travel by vehicle or air is very convenient and never more than a 3 hour flight from anywhere in the country.

Project

     I’ve spent countless hours cleaning up our property to make space for the new kiln shed.  The research I conducted along with assistance from the county, public health, zoning, fire marshal, etc. helped me carefully select the appropriate structure for the kiln project.  I decided to go with a fully enclosed (vented) steel building with roll up doors on all sides.  I need the flexibility to use the kilns through the winter, so a steel building was an obvious choice.  The enclosed kiln shed will provide a safe, secure, warm, comfortable environment for everyone throughout the year.  The footprint is 30’ x 40’ with a single slant roof height of 14’ - 12’ 6”.  

     This provides enough space for a few “small” kilns.  I’ve always preferred small kilns for their ease of firing, quick feedback for testing, and fast turnaround.  The kiln selection will provide opportunities to a variety of surface finishes, and abundant learning opportunities.  The kiln shed will house a natural gas/wood cross draft soda kiln, a small catenary tube wood kiln, and a revised version of the commonly called “Lambo gama” anagama (most recognized for its’ “smoke reduction” design incorporating the “afterburner” chamber).

Opportunity

     The kiln shed will also function as a “sampler” for someone interested in building a kiln at their respective school, art center, home studio, etc.  As a guest you have the opportunity to fire any kiln to see if it might be the right fit for your future project.  This experience enables you to “test drive” one of the kilns prior to making your decision so you end up with the right kiln for your needs.  I will have the according material list for you to build it yourself, or you can choose to have me come build your kiln with you. 

     Hopefully this can help avoid the situation so many end up where you have a great kiln, just not the right kiln for you.  It could be too big, too small, require too many people, require fuel that is difficult to attain, poor efficiency, bad design, improper insulation, awkward proportions, etc.  Avoid many of these problems by attending a session to try a kiln, before deciding on a kiln design.

The Project

     The scope of the project included quite a bit of land grading to make space for the kiln building, as well as clearing out an old garden, removing large posts, boulders, debris, relocating a treehouse, etc.  Given the amount of “bobcat” type of work involved prepping for the kiln shed, grading the driveway, creating space for vehicles, firebrick delivery unloading, and other various tasks, we purchased a used skid steer loader to save $$$ in the long run.  I’ve been able to do most of the work myself, and save my body physically in the process.  This tool also facilitates a variety of tasks, and has proven invaluable with delivery of materials for the project.

     Building anything has its challenges, and I am asking for your assistance with the next phase of the project.  We have purchased equipment, brought the kiln building from idea to a completely finished structure having received the final inspection from county June 12, 2018. After many months of searching, I purchased and received more than enough super duty, high alumina fire brick, and additional refractories for all of the kilns.  A new dedicated natural gas line has been run, and permit inspection performed successfully.  The studio area has been reorganized to comfortably accommodate our guests.

Help

      There are a few opportunities where I could use some help to complete the kiln shed project.  As a “Donor”, you are invited as one of our first VIP guests for a “session”.  You can select the session you wish to attend as the focus will vary with each session.  You can contact me at any time to discuss which session might be most fulfilling for you.  All you need to do is get here, we will take care of the rest for you.  “Sponsors” help collectively to provide the resources to push the project along more swiftly.  Sponsor rewards are described below accordingly, and your generous contributions will be put to use finishing the kiln shed project immediately.

     Your help will enable this project to move to completion sooner than later making the experience more fulfilling for everyone.  Many times small groups are able to work through ideas faster than large groups, exchanging ideas and forming solutions with more intimate discussion.  Small groups enable more testing opportunities due to fast turnaround, which leads to quicker resolution when developing concepts.  Small groups require smooth transitions when working together, and each person is invaluable to the success of the common goal.  This leads to enhanced learning and understanding, more personal connection to the process, and increased confidence when applying techniques in various future situations. 

Rewards

Donor Level

“The Whole Enchilada”  Anagama Kiln Donor  $10,000:  The anagama is a special kiln to me for so many reasons, and the proportions are critical for good results.  It creates a tight group of artists who all work together seamlessly for a common goal.  The teardrop shape produces even heat saturation, and dramatic effects unlike any other kiln shape.  There is something surreal about every aspect of the anagama from its’ origin dug into a hillside, to the complex thought processes of loading, and the intimate listening to the kiln to learn what the kiln needs.

“Burrito Grande”  Tube Kiln Donor  $7,500:  The tube kiln is an extremely versatile design for a large variety of situations.  It can be heated quickly and is very easy to load since it does not contain the complex curves of the anagama.  This is a “go to wood kiln” design in most any situation and can be easily adjusted in size.

“Chimichanga”   Soda Kiln Donor  $5,000:  The catenary cross draft kiln design has been proven again and again by so many artists throughout its’ lifetime.  Since Grad School at IU in 2000, I’ve had a version of a catenary cross draft kiln available.  Small, versatile, and a proven arch make this design a must have.

“Caliente”  Chimney Donor  $2,500 each x 2:  The kiln shed is engineered for 2 chimneys to exit the roof.  I need to weld steel frames on the corners of these chimneys, add spark arrestors, and flash them through the roof to be “water tight”.

Sponsor Level

“La Comida”  Gas Burner Sponsor  $500 each x 8:  The kilns will incorporate a natural gas burner system to aid with efficient heating and the post combustion chambers for the smokeless design.  I have already run new underground gas lines to the kiln shed permit approved and inspected by county, but I need to pipe them to the kilns and purchase burners.  In turn you are “sponsoring” a students material fees to attend a session as my assistant.  I will select one student sponsor assistant via application for each “session”.  Applicants must be currently enrolled in a BFA program, or have completed a BFA degree.  This sponsorship will enable me to continue working closely with artists developing their voice in clay and assist them in their journey.

Kiln Design Consultation Sponsor 4 hours, $250 each, 4 available:    Are you planning to build a kiln?  Have you emailed me about helping you design a kiln?  Are you wondering how much it will cost to build a kiln?  Do you have questions about who to contact to see if you are permitted to have a kiln?  I’ve spent countless hours researching zoning, planning, designing kiln sheds, calculating proportions, and drawing kiln designs to assess material quantities.  If you need help with your new kiln project, or have questions about how your kiln is working, I can help you.

Refractory Sponsor Omnitemp Dual Pyrometer Raffle $50 entry:  I’m raffling one Omnitemp Digital Logging Pyrometer ($400 value) to help with additional refractory material costs such as high temp refractory cast-able, insulating brick, insulating fiber, mortar, etc.  Each $50 contribution gives you one entry into the raffle.

Kiln Shelf Sponsor Serving Platter Raffle $50 entry:  I need to purchase kiln shelves likely costing around $1,500, depending on where, when, and from whom I find them.  Your $50 entry will go towards the "kiln shelf fund", and give you the opportunity to win one of my large serving platters ($550 value), shipping included for free.  Each $50 contribution gives you one entry into the raffle.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, but still want to help:

  • Please share this campaign with your social media, it's pretty easy and very helpful.
  • Talk about my project with your friends and colleagues, they might be interested.
  • Contact me directly if you would like to help in another way, or to discuss a workshop session.
  • Visit my Etsy shop, or schedule a studio visit to buy my handmade pottery.
  • Click the "Back It" button to donate any $ amount towards my campaign.

     I’ve taken on several large projects throughout my life and career yet this is something different.  The quote below has been powerful through the past year during the struggle of rebuilding a creative environment.

Anatole France

"To accomplish great things, we must not only act, but also dream; not only plan, but also believe."

Thank you for your support!

story:
We invite you to contribute to Tints of Resilience art exhibition.

 

Tints of Resilience is a collective exhibition bringing together the works of eleven international artists in a rich tapestry of visual artworks, photography, poetry and film. The exhibition explores the potential of art in developing resilience in zones of conflict.

 

How it all started

To adapt to the status quo or to advocate and work for change? A question I often asked myself while growing up. I was born at the end of the civil war in Lebanon, in a region witnessing constant political turmoil and economic instability. I always wondered what choices could be made in such circumstances? How do people around the world suffering from diif cope and develop?

The answer is never simple. Yet I realized with time that it somehow lies within each one of us. It lies in our assimilating of experiences and knowledge. The choice for me was to use what I know and love best: Art.

A beautiful encounter with Syrian artist Diala Brisly in 2016 triggered a project proposal and two years later an entire exhibition.

 

What is it all about

In times of war, life is interrupted and individuals find themselves forcibly alienated from their lands, traditions, and communities. Tints of Resilience is a collective exhibition that places art at the heart of adversity, examining its ability to reconnect and maintain the bonds with home, people, and tradition.

Eleven artists, currently or previously living in the Middle East, share their experiences in art-making and using art to cope with war, asylum, injury and search for identity. They present both individual explorations and artistic collaborations with refugee children, social workers, and art therapists.

Visitors to the exhibition are invited to join the artists in vibrant aesthetic moments where art-making provides the opportunity to address conflict and alienation through the unfolding of multiple narratives, where art can make meaning through empowerment.

 

The exhibition proposes a rich public programme including a live Arabic calligraphy mural performance by young calligrapher Ghaleb Hawila and a seminar talk with both art therapist Myra Saad and artist Diala Brisly on the pivotal role of art making and art therapy in developing resilience for youth and adults in zones of conflict. The talk will follow Diala on her journey from war to asylum, to artistic production in Europe. 

The exhibit will also be raising donations for Alphabet For Alternative Education, a non-governmental organization based in Lebanon and providing access to education to refugee children who have lost access to schooling since 2011.

 

Why your contribution is important

We have already secured about 60% of the total funding needed for the exhibition through sponsorship, art fund awards, and personal funds. We are crowdfunding for the final 5K GBP! Your contribution is vital for us to succeed!

Tints of Resilience is a culmination of two years of work and witnesses a wide collaboration of participants united around the following objectives:

  • Establishing a conversational space between youth and experienced artists and children through art, each sharing and negotiating his/her space of resilience.
  • Recognizing art as a valuable resource in developing resilience for children in difficulties.
  • Raising donations for Alphabet For Alternative Education and NGO that provides access to education for children in refugee settlements in Bekaa, North Lebanon.
  • Opening a space for discussion around academic research and findings on the role of art and art therapy in developing resilience.

The funds will help us cover the exhibition installation, shipping and mounting of artworks, and printing exhibition publications. They will also help cover the exhibition public events including two art workshops with children and adults by artist Diala Brisly and a seminar talk on art & art therapy.

Profits from the sale of artworks will go directly to Alphabet for Alternative Education.

The Impact

Tints of Resilience not only aims to transmit the voices of children in difficulties and Middle Eastern communities to international audiences but also offers an open space for sharing, where the visitor is invited to contemplate his/her ways in dealing with adversity. The space of the gallery expands bringing to the audience multiple narratives on resilience.

“In our vibrant times, a cultural space ought to be always revisited, ready for re-modeling and expansion, meeting the demands of a curious global audience” Rania Mneimneh.

 

We look forward to meeting you here and at the gallery. The exhibition will take place from August 16 to September 6 2018.

story:
**Note that the High Priestess tote bag and PEACE massage primer perks can be delivered prior to 12/15/18 pending availability.**

FREE the WEED

The Oracle of the Green Rose holds a significant value during this momentous time in history as we liberate the cannabis plant from prohibition and bring awareness around the historical figures that made it possible. Many still struggle today to secure safe access to cannabis medicine for themselves and for their families. We honor those individuals with this literary work of art.

With this beautifully illustrated deck, you’ll be spreading the message of this spirit plant and sharing the wisdom of this plant’s medicine with the world.

Liberté pour La Rose Verte! Free the Green Rose!

Oracle of the Green Rose is a passion project created by Courtney Aura Freeman, founder of White Buffalo Spirit, Inc.  WhiteBuffaloSpirit.org is a much-loved source for cannabis ancillary products including the proprietary and therapeutic PEACE CBD Massage primer launched by White Buffalo earlier this year. 

Courtney is a cannabis industry entrepreneur in Los Angeles, California who supports the cannabis legalization movement in an effort to bring education around cannabis medicine and healing modalities.

Courtney manages manufacturing logistics and product development for cannabis products.  She was part of the first wave of cannabis businesses to bring lab-tested, 2018 compliant cannabis product to market in California.  With 15 years of both digital and print marketing experience, Courtney has the expertise to deliver this project with success. Visit her LinkedIn for more info: https://www.linkedin.com/in/courtneyaurafreeman/.

This deck and the accompanying book are intended to be shared on-the-go with friends and family in any setting.  Pull a card for your lover at the beach or go on a walk solo and give yourself a mood boost on a tough day with a message meant just for you.

- Two card illustrations are ready.  The remainder of the cards must be illustrated, printed and then fulfilled for shipment to finalize the project. We'll be releasing new cards during the course of this campaign, so check back here frequently for updates or visit @WhiteBuffaloSpirit on instagram. 

She *Sparked* ... An IDEA

After studying the Tarot with two esteemed masters of this ancient mystery school, Courtney had an epiphany.  Cannabis is unique in the plant kingdom in its ability to heal emotional trauma. Why not merge the power of this uplifting, spirit plant with the mystical and guiding principles of the Tarot?! And thus, that was the genesis of the Oracle of the Green Rose.

About the Artists

Collaborating with the talented fine artist Amber June Cross, the White Buffalo Spirit team is introducing the first ever cannabis oracle deck as a magical gift to weed enthusiasts everywhere. 

The accompanying book in this exquisitely presented gift set, written by Ms. Freeman, shares a light-hearted story expressing both the historical context of each card's imagery and a thought-provoking message intended for the person receiving the reading, known as the querent.

A Few Details For The CannaNERDS

This deck holds 22 cards honoring the Major Arcana or archetypes outlined in the famous Rider-Waite Tarot deck.  Each of these cards touches on aspects of universal truths, symbolism, spiritual entities such as Santa Maria (the spirit of the cannabis plant) and the real-life (3rd dimension reality) pioneers who deserve a hearty thanks.

For example, The Magician card, numbered "one" in the deck, depicts Hua Tuo, an ancient physician and surgeon who created the first pain reliever by mixing ground cannabis flower with wine. (Super fun fact!!!).

Of the remaining 22 cards,

- 12 cards are dedicated to the heirloom or landrace cannabis strains, which hold the rich heritage of today's weed varietals. Durban poison will be the first landrace illustration that we share and the campaign will be updated when the art is ready for viewing. This is a work in progress!

- 4 Ace cards express the true energy of the four directions or four elements --air, fire, water, and earth. We've got a unique approach here specific to cannabis culture. 

- 6 Modern All-Stars - Our top funders can help choose which modern day weed strains that we showcase.

Join Us In Making Herstory - Female Founder

The Oracle of the Green Rose is a gender neutral work of art and in conjunction with the laws of the universe, seeks balance of male and female energies. That said, we thought you might want to give just a little bit more care to this project to help a sista out. Women hold more leadership roles in cannabis than in any other industry and we hope to inspire young women to even greater heights!

Help Us Make Our Goal, Please : )

First, we are going to make our goal. Our objective is to introduce the Oracle of the Green Rose to the world. If you're reading this, we're already a success. Thank you for your interest!  Any funds contributed will be devoted to bringing this project to life.

If we can hit our financial goal with this fundraiser, we'll take things to new heights and make history with this ground-breaking project by:

- Securing the first order of printed decks - $15K

- Sending out perks - $7500

- Paying our artists a modest rate for their time - $5K

- Produce an amazing party with an art exhibit displaying all the cards and the messages from the book with our Indiegogo funders as our guests of honor (Courtney is an event producer) .  Attendees will meet the artists first hand and enjoy a gallery size view of the cards. Note that this event will be held in Los Angeles and tickets will be made available to funders at no charge. - $3000 for the gallery venue plus $2000 for expenses

- Start marketing at book store and gift shows for global distribution - $3k

- Pay our developer to create the web-based app - $3K. This is a digital version of the cards with optional add-on accessories for the "video game" version.


Challenges

Our biggest hurdle is meeting our 7 month project timeline. Each card is individually designed and the associated message is created. This takes time and effort, and we've given ourselves a tough deadline to get this project live while we also meeting our other worldly responsibilities.

Other Ways That You Can Help

We understand that you can't always afford to fund every passion project. But this one is definitely worth your while.  If you can spare even $5, that energy exchange is going to carry our hearts a bit farther toward meeting our lofty goals and make us feel loved.  

If you simply can't make a monetary donation, we ask that you send this campaign with a personal, motivating note to any and everyone that you know who would even be mildly interested in this project as we take the world by storm. Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Share with Members of the Press?

Press coverage can go a long way toward the success of an Indiegogo campaign. Due to the costs of printing and labor, we have not budgeted for a PR team at this time, which could cost upwards of $5,000 per month. If you have connections to members of the press or if you yourself are a member of the press, please do the honor of sharing our project or providing press coverage through your own channels. We think people will be interested in what we're doing, and we hope you think so too.

Act Before It's Too Late

This campaign ends November 23rd at 11:59pm.  We'll send you reminders if possible, but pretty please, make a donation now, share with friends, mark your calendar for pay day... but whatever you do, don't forget to fund ;)

Sending out a special thank you to early funders Kristen Arigoni, Christina Radocha, and Aaren Cordova.

Disclaimer: No cannabis for sale. No physical cannabis in this project.  This is a playing card deck, a work of art, a gift of syncronicity.

We appreciate your support and that you believe in our vision.

Amber, the White Buffalo Team, and Courtney

story:
Revisions of the Moon Summary

Revisions of the Moon is a poetry book touching on the topics of love, loss, identity, death, trauma, grief, and growth. The book is organized into six chapters, which represent six of the moon phases. The sections emphasize the six phases including chaos, beginnings, challenge, clarity, communication, and growth. Our lives, like the moon phases, are always changing, and we go through similar cycles as we constantly strive for progress.

As you read through each chapter, you are guided to learn that after chaos and confusion comes light and clarity. There is always time to reflect and create change. As we go through life, we experience revisions of identity, revisions of memory, revisions of love, and revisions of growth.
 


Author Bio

Tati Petkovic is an artist who has creates art, photography, interactive installations and designs books and writes poetry. She is a Leo Sun, Libra Rising and Cancer Moon. Her astrological perspective influences her poetry and her design work.

In 2014, Tati obtained her Bachelor’s Degree in Graphic Design from OCAD University, and in 2018, her Master’s Degree in Digital Media from Ryerson University. She is the Creative Director of Tatjana Petkovic Design and Moon Sign Supplies, as well as, a Sessional Instructor at OCAD University.

After facing the death of her father at age eleven, Tati has learned not to take life for granted and to pursue what she truly loves. She is always determined to trust and appreciate the process. She hopes to make others feel less alone in their heartbreaks and personal journeys of self.

Follow @tatipetkovic on instagram to keep up to date with updates.
 

Goal 

This is the first printing of Revisions of the Moon, and I hope to reach my initial goal of $5000. My extended goal is $10000, and this would help me send the book to publishers to get it picked up by a poetry publishing house.

All books are signed over the price of $50 backed from the campaign, but I can also sign it in person during the launch event or a Toronto pick-up!

This would cover the cost of printing (in colour!), shipping, packaging, Indiegogo fees, credit card fees, and 10% of the profit will go towards Mental Health organization, Family Service Toronto to help with counselling services.

 


Risks & Challenges

My biggest challenge is that I am self-publishing, so I will be handling all the books myself. I am test-printing with printers, doing the packaging, and in some form, delivering them to you. This means the timeline is a few months into 2020, only because I want to be sure I give you the best version of this book as possible for it's first edition. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to support the project but can't financially back the project, there are other ways you can help me reach my goal. These include:

  • Share the project on social media
  • Share my poetry found on my instagram on social media
  • Send the project to specific people who you think would be interested in it
     


Thank you for your support!

story:
Johnathan Campbell

As a teenager living on the family farm north of Bismarck I was introduced to the basics of photography and darkroom printing by my mother. I carried that interest to the University of North Dakota where I earned a B.A. in Visual Art in 1995. 

After graduation I put the camera down so I could concentrate my artist skills on being the fossil preparator at the North Dakota Heritage Center restoring fossils such as the mosausaur skeleton displayed in the Geologic Times Gallery.

In 2014, after a 20 year hiatus, I picked up the camera again, and begun re-exploring the manipulation of light. My current primary area of expression is long exposure photography, with an emphasis on creative light painting. 

I have been a full gallery artist with the Bismarck Downtown Artist Cooperative since 2015 in my pursuit of being a professional visual artist.

I Need Your Help

The McCanna House Artist-In Residence has the potential to be a life altering experience, but to take full advantage of my stay I need your assistance. 

Donations to my residency will be used towards the following:

  • Food, starving artist is not something I am striving for. I will have enough money saved up to make due with basic groceries, but good nutrition makes for better creativity.
  • Exploration of the region in pursuit of natural and man-made inspirations for the creation of photographic art. Without your help my wanderings will be limited to the immediate McCanna area.
  • It is my hope to spend time experimenting with long exposure film photography during my stay at the McCanna House. Using film instead of digital forces the artist to slow down and concentrate on each shot being taken as you are mindful that each click of the camera is costing you money. With your help to cover the cost of film and developing I will have more creative options to explore during my stay. One roll of color medium format film costs around $20 with processing

Benefits of Donating

Besides the satisfaction of knowing you are helping an artist enrich the world with their art each donation will receive the following:

  • $20 donation will receive a signed 8x10 print.
  • $30 donation will receive a signed 2020 calendar with photographs taken during the residency.
  • $50 donation will receive the 2020 calendar and a signed 11x14 print.
  • $100 donation will receive a 11x14 print on canvas
  • $250 donation will receive a signed 16x20 print on canvas framed and ready to hang.

All donors will be invited to a private reception and talk detailing how I spent my time and exploring the art I created during my artist-in-residence. The talk will take place at the Bismarck Downtown Artist Cooperative in late October or early November.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate you can still help by sharing this on Facebook.

story:
Dragons are here!

  • Hi, I'm Steve Hartley. I'm a caricature artist by day but THIS is the stuff I draw at home.
  • I have always wanted to share my art and love of dragons. This long quarantine gave me the opportunity to complete this first part of my dream.
  • I would be honored if my book was enjoyed by you and your family. 

What I Need & What You Get

With your help, I want to print a large format artbook 

The artbook is full-color, 17 x 11in, hardcover with case binding. I have some ideas about extra perks if certain goals are reached during the campaign, like a real sketch inside the cover of each book.

  •  $4,500 is my goal to complete this project. This will cover the printing and ancillaries to finish. Once the books arrive, I will begin shipping them to you.
  • As I mentioned above, the 'stretch goal' will be a sketch in every book when I reach $8,500.

The Impact

I started this project in 1989. Since then, I have expanded my knowledge and experience to all sorts of mediums.

  • This is art that can be shared with your children or just provide some escape into fantasy. 
  • I designed it to bring out the imagination in everyone, young and old.

Risks & Challenges

Of course it is risky to start a campaign and sometimes I judge myself too harshly. 

  • But after all I have seen and been through, I cannot let fear keep me from my dreams. 
  • If not now, when? 

Other Ways You Can Help

I would appreciate your support and help getting the word out. Thank You

story:
Laser-Cut, Art-Engraved, Filigree Leather Shoes!

Help us raise $9,000 to purchase a shoemaking shop from a retiring Italian Shoemaker!

We are Astral Chrysalis Designs and for the past near-decade, we have mastered our craft. We specialize in making hats, skirts, cuffs, ties and more. We aspire to be shoemakers and this has always been our long-term goal.  At Maker Faire 2012 we met a shoemaker who studied shoemaking in England. For one weekend she visited us at our art studio showing us how to make a shoe from start to finish by hand (see the campaign pictures)!

We need to make an offer on this workshop by November 27th!

You can check out our shop at: astralchrysalis.etsy.com

Handcrafted Leather Shoemaking is a Dying Art

Many of you have heard Azalyne and I not so jokingly say "we want to give John Fluevog (famous polish shoemaker) a run for his money!" Don't get us wrong, we love, admire, and purchase from John Fluevog. However, he's got nothing on the visions in our heads. Many fans of our art have come into our booth over the years have asked if we ever plan on making shoes. Especially when they see the one pair we did make featured as business card holders in our booth.

Fashion boots and shoemaking in the USA is a dying art. We're not talking about your run-of-the-mill Rennaissance fair moccasins. We are talking tried and true soled shoes. Serendipitously, and sadly another shoemaking business has gone under.

We discovered that they are selling nearly 15 shoemaking and repair machines for a whopping $9,000, which is a fraction of what they are worth. The catch? They close their doors at the end of the month and we need the cash in hand to make this purchase as soon as possible! By contributing to our campaign, you would be helping us attain a lifelong dream. Just imagine our style, hats filigree, lace, and all beautifully combined into the swankiest pair of comfortable boots you've ever seen. Our attention to detail would be incorporated into every design, bringing shoes to the next level!

Help us reach our 9k goal, and help Astral Chrysalis birth into its next incarnation as a handcraft company producing high-end leather shoes, made by yours truly.

~ Azalyne & Aurelius


Notes on Perks:

  • If you would like your gift certificate mailed to a person for the Holidays, please give us their name and address.
  • All Gift Certificates will be sent out on 12/1/2019
  • All Gift Certificates are good for 1 year in our Etsy shop.
  • Regarding the $1000 Perk, this donation gets you a handcrafted pair of custom boots if we reach our goal. If we do not reach our goal, you will be instead given a $200 gift certificate issued on 12/1/2019
  • In the case that we don't reach our goal, or end up being outbid by another buyer, all funds raised will go towards our leathercraft shop and a clicker press to increase the speed of production for our already existing designs.

Laser-Cut, Art-Engraved, Filigree Leather Shoes!Help us raise $9,000 to purchase a shoemaking shop from a retiring Italian Shoemaker!We are Astral Chrysalis Designs and for the past near-decade, we have mastered our craft. We specialize in making hats, skirts, cuffs, ties and more. We aspire to be shoemakers and this has always been our long-term goal.  At Maker Faire 2012 we met a shoemaker who studied shoemaking in England. For one weekend she visited us at our art studio showing us how to make a shoe from start to finish by hand (see the campaign pictures)!We need to make an offer on this workshop by November 27th!You can check out our shop at: astralchrysalis.etsy.comHandcrafted Leather Shoemaking is a Dying ArtMany of you have heard Azalyne and I not so jokingly say "we want to give John Fluevog (famous polish shoemaker) a run for his money!" Don't get us wrong, we love, admire, and purchase from John Fluevog. However, he's got nothing on the visions in our heads. Many fans of our art have come into our booth over the years have asked if we ever plan on making shoes. Especially when they see the one pair we did make featured as business card holders in our booth.Fashion boots and shoemaking in the USA is a dying art. We're not talking about your run-of-the-mill Rennaissance fair moccasins. We are talking tried and true soled shoes. Serendipitously, and sadly another shoemaking business has gone under.We discovered that they are selling nearly 15 shoemaking and repair machines for a whopping $9,000, which is a fraction of what they are worth. The catch? They close their doors at the end of the month and we need the cash in hand to make this purchase as soon as possible! By contributing to our campaign, you would be helping us attain a lifelong dream. Just imagine our style, hats filigree, lace, and all beautifully combined into the swankiest pair of comfortable boots you've ever seen. Our attention to detail would be incorporated into every design, bringing shoes to the next level!Help us reach our 9k goal, and help Astral Chrysalis birth into its next incarnation as a handcraft company producing high-end leather shoes, made by yours truly.~ Azalyne & AureliusNotes on Perks:
If you would like your gift certificate mailed to a person for the Holidays, please give us their name and address.
All Gift Certificates will be sent out on 12/1/2019
All Gift Certificates are good for 1 year in our Etsy shop.
Regarding the $1000 Perk, this donation gets you a handcrafted pair of custom boots if we reach our goal. If we do not reach our goal, you will be instead given a $200 gift certificate issued on 12/1/2019
In the case that we don't reach our goal, or end up being outbid by another buyer, all funds raised will go towards our leathercraft shop and a clicker press to increase the speed of production for our already existing designs.

story:
Why I'm Doing This

Since I was a child, I knew I wanted to create children's books. Also, since I was very young, Psalm 23 ("The Lord is my shepherd...") has always brought me a sense of protection and helped me internalize the knowing that the Divine has and always will be with me. It's so important for me to get this work into the homes of more families and children. You, as my contributors, will bless me with the ability to make this happen with the costs of printing hard-cover, high-quality books.

Together, let's bring this psalm into as many homes as possible. Whether you are Jewish, Christian, or just spiritual, this psalm is universally powerful to bring inner peace and wholeness.

The visual story I have illustrated of the young girl with her little lamb and dog-sidekick was inspired by having sheep and getting to take care of lambs in our pastures as I was growing up. (This is a photo of me in my favorite rainbow polka-dotted jacket with one of the lambs.)  As a child, I felt at one with nature and spent a lot of time in it alone -- as I never really felt alone with all the wonderful animal and plant kingdom. I met God first in nature and the wonders of the glorious creation in the miracles of the tiny dew droplets to the vastness of the sky. 

I want to bring a sense of peace and inner sovereignty to children, as expressed by the girl in my paintings in this book. Even when life feels like an unknown wilderness... we can trust that we are under the wings of the Divine presence and protection. This psalm does just that for us.

 

What's Needed + What You Get

  • The budget of $9,670 includes printing, publication, marketing, submittals for literary awards, and distribution. Printing production will start as soon as the money is raised and it's expected to be available shortly after that. It will be a dream come true to have this book be in thousands of homes.

  • Different levels of contribution offer different perks from an e-book, to a hard-cover copy, a choice of printed wall art, and beyond. 
    HERE ARE THE VARIOUS PERKS (but you can donate any amount, and let me know if you want the perk that is closely associated with it): 

    >> GRATITUDE - $18
    Your contribution makes a difference! I will send you a downloadable ebook version of the book.

    >> BLESSINGS - $36
    Your contribution makes a difference! You will be mailed a copy of the book.

    >> GRACE - $60
    Your contribution makes a difference! You will be mailed a signed hardcover book.

    >> ANGEL - $100
    You’re an Angel and your contribution makes a difference! You will receive a signed hardcover of the book + an 8”x10” art print from the book.

    >> GODSEND - $250
    Your contribution makes a difference! You will receive TWO signed hardcover books + an 8”x10” art print from the book.

    >> MANNA FROM HEAVEN - $1,000
    Your contribution makes a big difference! You will receive two signed hardcover copies of the book + a small customized commissioned art. I will be in touch with you about your vision + specifics. You are also invited to add a dedication to someone or in memory of someone that will be published in the book (up to a maximum of 30 words).

  • If I don't reach my entire goal, I will consider marketing just an e-book and print a smaller run for contributors. But let's not go there... I'm bright-eyed and bushy-tailed about getting some amazing support from amazing people!

Let's Make an Impact

I intend for this project to be meaningful so we can raise a generation of children who feel a knowing of the Divine presence within them. If you can imagine a childhood book that has stayed with you over the years or decades because of the ideas expressed and the positive and reassuring visuals presented, this is what I want to contribute to the world.

Risks & Challenges

I realize I am taking a risk in this big ask as it's not easy to ask you to open your heart and wallet. I realize this book goes WAY beyond me... as did the Psalm (in very powerful ways) that King David wrote several thousand years ago. I stand in that knowing and thinking of the children that will be read this book before bed every night, or when they are struggling. With your help, the mission goes way beyond me collecting some publishing funds and marketing of this book.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can, please make a small (or even better, LARGE!) contribution. I understand not everyone can, but doesn't mean you can't help. 

  • Please help me get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. 
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools! Copy the link, repost, email, social media it...

I'm so appreciative!

Book Love (Reviews)

“The psalms are timeless, ancient human voices speaking to us out of the distant past.  The challenge facing any teacher, any translator, any illustrator of the psalms is to capture and convey the deeply human emotions of the ancient words without 'modernizing,' and thereby watering down, the text.  In this stunning book, Lucinda Rae has succeeded at bringing the old words to life, in all their depth, antiquity and mystery, and making them accessible to both adults and children.  Lucinda, thank you.”

- Rabbi Stephen E. Cohen, Congregation B’nai B’rith, Santa Barbara CA

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

“Lucinda Rae’s spirited illustrations of this sacred song of protection seen through the eyes of a child, simply awaken the divine message transmitted in each verse. The message of the universal connection we all have with our Creator, our Shepherd, can be felt, known and seen through our love.  The authentic Hebrew gives a deep living vibration to this timeless song!”

- P. Paulsen, Spiritual Director, Sunburst Sanctuary

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

“This beautiful book is the perfect vehicle to teach our little ones both about God and His qualities and also about the ideal relationship for us to build with Him. The words of the psalm are not only comforting but instructive and Lucinda’s stunning illustrations are captivating for children and adults too.  I am thrilled to introduce my own little ones to the 23rd Psalm with this gorgeous book at bedtime, and I am also grateful to have such a vehicle for myself at the end of the day, to lead us all into quiet, peaceful and blessed sleep.”

- Brandy Mussman, M.A., CA

story:
The early-bird campaign has ended
but you can still pre-order Cycles 2021 here!

www.cyclesjournal.com

Updates:

  • The journal has been sent to print! :) Yay!
  • RE: the indiegogo message at checkout says crowdfunding is not shopping for their safety, but you WILL receive the physical perk you select
  • Discounts end on 9/30

Cycles Journal is an illustrated lunar and menstrual tracking calendar for those seeking to prioritize self-care, slow down — and deeply listen. You’ll be guided on a journey to uncover patterns within & reconnect to your natural flows through journaling, lunar insight, sacred tips, and more. Reclaiming the power of your cycle helps you regain control within your life — so that you can heal + transform your relationship with yourself, others & the world. 

Societal stigma tries to convince us we can't work magic and bleed at the same time (it's quite the opposite!) or that we don't deserve to rest when we need to. We’re standing up against that notion. 

It’s time to use our menstrual cycles to plan & prepare for our  lives — to experience less burn-out and more flowing magnetism.

It’s time for us to reclaim ourselves and our powerful flows. It’s time to mend the parts of our nature we may feel disconnected from or at internal war with.

We are empowering ourselves as unique parts of a blossoming whole. We are decolonizing and unraveling forced, limiting linear timelines. We are rebuilding our own beautiful, flowing cyclical way of life. And it starts by understanding our own waves. 

 

NOTE:

At checkout, Indiegogo says "crowdfunding is not shopping but a donation and does not guarantee a 'perk' " - but if you select a perk you WILL receive that physical item in the mail within the estimated delivery time! This campaign is a pre-order campaign.

 

We're sending this to the printer and distributing no matter what - we take the cost difference risk, which is why we're fundraising via pre-orders offset costs via this campaign.

Mo(o)nthly Overview Calendar
to track symptoms & patterns

— Follow your menstrual cycle alongside the moon’s cycle —
— Notice your own patterns from one cycle to the next —
— Lunar months instead of calendar months for easy comparison
​& to serve as an anchor for irregular or non-existent periods —
— Space for your own unique symptoms —
— Astrological symbols for consideration —

Daily Journaling Space
to write & release

• Dated pages from the end of Dec. 2020 - Dec 2021 •
• Space to expand in more detail on your symptoms • 
• Intention-setting space per quarter moon •
• Illustration of the moon’s phase per day •
• Consider weather & astrology’s impact •
• Track fertility with your temperature  •
• Reminders to track & tune in •

Cycle Reflections
to help you deepen your observations,
find patterns, and prepare for your next cycle

• Record your patterns, caution days, bliss days & irregularities •​
• Reminders for self-exams & date nights with yourself •​
• Find where your cycle aligns with the lunar cycle •​
• Reminders to plan & prepare for your next cycle •​
• Integrate your cycle into your life & work  •​
• Keep track of your favorite rituals •​
• Extra space for inspiration •

Community Features
sharing wisdom, rituals, prose & more

(spread from last year's journal by Abigail Vetesse)

• Inspiring you through many modes of healing •
• Sprinkled throughout & each mo(o)nth •
• Connecting you to nature & potential •
• Illustrations to spark magic •

 

(please note that all spreads are mock-ups & are subject to minor changes as we finalize the structure & internal pages, colors, etc. the final product will be similar if not identical)

 

Materials & Specs

6"x9” Hardcover Journal with Lay-Flat Binding

320 pages: Full color printing — Aprox 1.5 lbs

Premium 120g paper: FSC Certified, Uncoated & easy to write on without any bleed or resistance of ink pens or pencils

High-quality features: Rounded corners — Scratch-resistant cover — Illustrated end-leaves

Extra Included Features: Accordion pocket — 2 Ribbon Bookmarks — Elastic band enclosure

Printed in limited quantity — Ethical small batch printer in Europe — Eco-friendly packaging


http://cyclesjournal.com/pay-it-forward

Project & Campaign Timeline

Our plan is to send the journal to print in September, receive them by early-mid October, prioritize getting them to retailers first for holiday season, and then to individuals.

Since you can’t use them until late December, there’s no worries and it will most definitely be in your hands at least a month before then (aka November) for overviewing & gifting!

There’s always the chance for sooner depending on production and such, but with corona still looming we’ve got some delays factored into our plan to leave plenty of leeway for time and to keep expectations in that range.

 

February-April: research, collaborations, drawing, creating, designing, planning

May-July: journal creation, product creation

August: campaign begins; finalizing journal creation, editing, proofing, preparing, ordering supplies

September: campaign ends, journals finalized & print proof, sent to print

October/November: journals received, fulfillment begins first to stores/bulk orders, then individuals

November/December: distributed & in your hands well before holiday season & its start at the end of December

Where is all this money going?

As a self-published independent project, we are entirely self-funded. We host a fundraiser yearly to provide you with some amazing discounts & deals for helping us afford printing costs. Your support via pre-orders and sponsorships help make this journal possible!

We believe in transparency, so you can see where all the money is being directed. Any extra money helps us get more journals printed so that we can keep spreading the magic! Plus, the creator hopes to get paid for all her hard work once all costs are covered so she can keep feeding herself and keep on creating this for you!

All fees are covering printing & shipment to my home studio, covering platform & transaction fees, paying the postal service to ship these orders out to all of you & packaging supplies for shipments. I chose not to include other expenses such as marketing, paying our team helpers who make this possible, paying out collaborators, federal & state taxes, and other costs - this will be covered through sponsorships, and a hope for stretch goals beyond our base goal!

Why Support Us?

(photographed above is our 2020 journal)

We’re a small, self-publishing, grassroots business founded by an independent artist and activist. This journal has been created from the heart & soul of a group on the same path as you.

We only print in small-batches with recycled materials & never in mass-producing unethical factories. 

We are dedicated to aligning our ethics & eco-activism with our creation process. Cycles Journal is never printed in factories in China or anywhere else because we are dedicated to small, quality batches. We also consider the environment when choosing the recycled, certified paper, and we package with recycled materials as much as possible.

We offer accessible options & discounts for low-income BIPOC.

We are dedicated to providing accessible options for those who are marginalized and need some financial assistance. We are starting a pooled fund of donations; through the pay-it-forward method, you can support someone to receive a journal at a variable of a discounted price, which is open for discussion/sliding scale based on need. Pay it forward via the “add-on” option when you check out.

Visit cyclesjournal.com/pay-it-forward for more info on how this process will work &/or to apply for relief.

We are dedicated to intersectional feminism, anti-racism, and dismantling unjust power systems of white supremacy and patriarchy.

This creation is inherently radical in the best way. Through empowering ourselves and learning how to harness our greatest assets (aka our bodies & mental health), we are rising up and bringing the matriarchal power back into alignment. We are dedicated to uplifting, representing, and focusing on serving our Black, Indigenous & Brown sisters & folks through this creation and all that it offers.

We are committed to inclusivity & diversity.

Someone told us last year that the journal was "too inclusive" and we took that as a win because that's the goal. We believe that queerness is beautiful, and we consider all gender identities who may embody a womb and use this journal. This is why we don't only use the word "women" to address our community, and it is why the journal aims to represent and address as many body types, gender presentation and skin tones as possible. This shows not only our want for justice and equality, but our refusal to go without it.

When you support us, you support yourself.

This journal is a gift to yourself or someone you love whether you realize it or not. The once-a-year investment is small compared to the expansion you'll uncover upon working with this journal. It is a powerful tool to help you shift your mind & practices. We believe that this is a beautiful reciprocal tool; you support our efforts and costs in creating this, and in return you receive a space of possibility & guidance, along with being a part of the collective evolutionary healing.

About the Creator

I wanted to tell you a bit about who I am & why I started this creation, if you are curious. I'm Rachael Amber — I'm an illustrator & designer, a menstrual health & self-care advocate, an environmental activist, a plant whisperer, a cat-lover.... I create tools and visuals for change because it is how I feel driven to cope with some of the confinements and injustices of our society. Doing this work grounds me, gives me hope, and connects me to all of you. I am thankful that I can create work that resonates with others.

My Story

I once bled in alignment with the full moon for 12 consecutive months. I had always sensed a connection to the moon’s influence, but now it was confirmed.

 

I was going wild each cycle and needed solid ground to figure out what was influencing it all. I was in constant pain physically, was wildly unpredictable, and aggressive emotionally. I hated my own cycle — I was not at peace with myself, inside or out. There was a deep disconnect and war raging inside of me. 

 

I sought to mend my lack of connection between myself and my womb. Slowly, I started to close the gaps and find understanding as I followed the lunar cycle and tracked my patterns alongside it. However, I did this mostly in my head or scattered between various apps that I would constantly forget to use or feel overwhelmed by more screen-time. 

 

As I continued to sync up with the full moon, the intensity fueled me to know more. I felt called to dive deeper through a more organized approach. Creating a tool seemed like the only way I could figure out what influenced me and where it all linked — to uncover the magic that I was starting to feel beneath the surface.

 

I wanted something to track it all in one place. Something that would inspire and motivate me to actually feel dedicated to it. So I realized that if it didn't exist already, this was my sign to create it.

 

Originally, I was going to make a simple booklet for myself to use, but as I told others my revelation, I realized this was desired and needed by so many more. There was an underlying realization of lack of cyclical focus in our world. And so, like all of my ideas, I want to share it and expand it to help other people, too. Thus the guiding tool of Cycles Journal was born — for all of us.

All Photography by Devon Dadoly. Model: Zuwena Mshale

A Message to You 

The more intentional we can be leading up to things such as our bleeding time, the more we can work with our bodies rather than against. I like to say we are learning to flow with our tides rather than against them. Once we are aware, doors open everywhere for our expansion and transcendence from pain. We realize everything is intimately connected — and oftentimes — just needs our love and attention.

 

Individually, self-care allows us to feel supported so we can be a better part of the collective whole. It helps us realize that we are worthy of choosing to prioritize ourselves. Collectively, we are learning to diverge from a strictly work & logic mindset that the world is focused on. We’re learning to instead be perceptive, to listen, to feel, and to realize it's much more beautiful and intuitive to live this way. We are learning that we can use this knowledge to be even better versions of ourselves.

 

It's truly a ripple effect. It's beautiful how much pain we can shed & love we can share with ourselves and one another once we get beyond the idea that our periods are a burden and our bodies are not on our side. We are ending the deflected war against our human vessels & the natural, beautiful, magic processes they carry us through. That all of this is pure and to be cherished is the most important thing to remember. When we are intentional and caring, we can make anything happen.

Risks & Challenges

With all projects, there are risks and challenges. The main ones we face are printing and production time. For the past two years we have met our deadlines and all has gone according to plan, aside from minor delays and spelling/number errors uncaught pre-press. We are making sure this doesn't happen again!

  • We have an editing team to make sure the information is correct and spelling errors are caught pre-press.
  • We are working hard to create the journal to its fullest and most beautiful potential. Any speed bumps will be met with care and communication.
  • We have allowed extra cushioning room in our schedule so that you will receive your journals well by the holiday season if you pre-ordered — and at least a month+ ahead of time before the new year & the journal's official start date of the Solstice on December 29, 2020.
  • We have also factored in the chances of shipping delays and such with corona looming in the air still. While we can’t fully control any postal delays, we just assume things always take longer than expected, so that’s why we say November delivery and appreciate your patience.

A Note on Shipping:

Our goal is to get everyone in the U.S. their journal before December - November is our goal, before holidays & especially before its start date in December 2020 - with no promises to international although we will prioritize shipping yours first. While we cannot guarantee shipping delays won't be in effect due to COVID, the mail for the election in the U.S. & holiday season, we are allowing extra time to accommodate this and will do all we can.

We will ship in the following order:

1. International

2. Shop/Retail Bulk Orders

3. Other Bulk

4. Early Birds

5. Etc in order of tiers

Shipping estimates are always just estimates - oftentimes they are inaccurate, especially when you factor in the layers of chaos in the world right now :-). We appreciate your patience in advance and are factoring in extra time. A normal time-frame for priority mail in the U.S. is 2-5 days, but at this point we must allow up to 2 weeks. As for international, sadly I've had orders take up to 3 months to arrive, but on average I say allow 1-2 months. We will ship yours first regardless in hopes it arrives sooner than later.

Our goal is to ship everything in early November so it has a full month to reach everyone before it begins and before holiday season. We will be prioritizing shipments to shops & international orders first - in October if possible. We are also going to ship all orders via priority mail this year, aside from bulk orders which are media mail unless an upgrade is requested.

We hope for the best for the future of the understaffed and threatened USPS and their underpaid workers. We will update you as time goes on and hope for the best. While we cannot control the postal service, we will do everything in our power to ensure that you get your journals.

Help Us Spread The Movement

As a small project growing and rooting, we can use all the help we can get spreading the word. We are grateful to anyone who helps us reach more cyclical beings to help and heal together!

How you can help:

  1. Share on Social: Click the "share" button on this page and simply share to your social media
  2. Follow & Share Us on IG @cyclesjournal for progress, inspiration, & previews
  3. Share via Email to any friends/loved ones with a womb you think this could help!
  4. Join our newsletter & share it with others, to always know when future years’ pre-orders come out, moon musings, sales, benefits, events, and more!

Thank You!

Thank you for being here on this healing journey with us. We are so grateful for all the connection and love this has fostered between us all. We are growing a powerful movement together, and we are excited to keep raising the bar for us all. We deserve to love our bodies, be friends with our cycles, and ride the waves of life with more ease and bliss. We are magical, powerful, beautiful, cyclical beings — and it's time we owned it!


Team:

Founder, Illustrator & Designer: Rachael Amber

With assistance from:

Editor: Hannah Herrera

Website/Campaign Design Assistant: Natalie Rozvadovsky

Order Fulfillment: Sam Levson, Nicholas Cain

Marketing Strategy: Rachel Krampe

 

Community & Sponsors
featured in the journal:

Jessi Mendez of Wild Essence Alchemy — Ani Ferlise — Raven Rose — Allie McFee — Mackensey Alexander — Nicole Pemberton — Amanda Ananda — Sofiya Maria  — Andie Osbey — Alexandra Marisia — Hara Rose Satori — Shannon Danielle

& more within our pages & our Healing Resource Directory (TBA soon)

www.cyclesjournal.com / @cyclesjournal
