The journal has been sent to print! :) Yay!
RE: the indiegogo message at checkout says crowdfunding is not shopping for their safety, but you WILL receive the physical perk you select
Discounts end on 9/30
Cycles Journal is an illustrated lunar and menstrual tracking calendar for those seeking to prioritize self-care, slow down — and deeply listen. You’ll be guided on a journey to uncover patterns within & reconnect to your natural flows through journaling, lunar insight, sacred tips, and more. Reclaiming the power of your cycle helps you regain control within your life — so that you can heal + transform your relationship with yourself, others & the world. Societal stigma tries to convince us we can't work magic and bleed at the same time (it's quite the opposite!) or that we don't deserve to rest when we need to. We’re standing up against that notion. It’s time to use our menstrual cycles to plan & prepare for our  lives — to experience less burn-out and more flowing magnetism.It’s time for us to reclaim ourselves and our powerful flows. It’s time to mend the parts of our nature we may feel disconnected from or at internal war with.We are empowering ourselves as unique parts of a blossoming whole. We are decolonizing and unraveling forced, limiting linear timelines. We are rebuilding our own beautiful, flowing cyclical way of life. And it starts by understanding our own waves.  NOTE:At checkout, Indiegogo says "crowdfunding is not shopping but a donation and does not guarantee a 'perk' " - but if you select a perk you WILL receive that physical item in the mail within the estimated delivery time! This campaign is a pre-order campaign. We're sending this to the printer and distributing no matter what - we take the cost difference risk, which is why we're fundraising via pre-orders offset costs via this campaign.
Mo(o)nthly Overview Calendarto track symptoms & patterns
— Follow your menstrual cycle alongside the moon’s cycle —— Notice your own patterns from one cycle to the next —— Lunar months instead of calendar months for easy comparison​& to serve as an anchor for irregular or non-existent periods —— Space for your own unique symptoms —— Astrological symbols for consideration —Daily Journaling Spaceto write & release• Dated pages from the end of Dec. 2020 - Dec 2021 •• Space to expand in more detail on your symptoms • • Intention-setting space per quarter moon •• Illustration of the moon’s phase per day •• Consider weather & astrology’s impact •• Track fertility with your temperature  •• Reminders to track & tune in •
Cycle Reflectionsto help you deepen your observations,find patterns, and prepare for your next cycle
• Record your patterns, caution days, bliss days & irregularities •​• Reminders for self-exams & date nights with yourself •​• Find where your cycle aligns with the lunar cycle •​• Reminders to plan & prepare for your next cycle •​• Integrate your cycle into your life & work  •​• Keep track of your favorite rituals •​• Extra space for inspiration •
Community Featuressharing wisdom, rituals, prose & more
(spread from last year's journal by Abigail Vetesse)• Inspiring you through many modes of healing •• Sprinkled throughout & each mo(o)nth •• Connecting you to nature & potential •• Illustrations to spark magic • (please note that all spreads are mock-ups & are subject to minor changes as we finalize the structure & internal pages, colors, etc. the final product will be similar if not identical)

 Materials & Specs6"x9” Hardcover Journal with Lay-Flat Binding320 pages: Full color printing — Aprox 1.5 lbsPremium 120g paper: FSC Certified, Uncoated & easy to write on without any bleed or resistance of ink pens or pencilsHigh-quality features: Rounded corners — Scratch-resistant cover — Illustrated end-leavesExtra Included Features: Accordion pocket — 2 Ribbon Bookmarks — Elastic band enclosurePrinted in limited quantity — Ethical small batch printer in Europe — Eco-friendly packaginghttp://cyclesjournal.com/pay-it-forwardProject & Campaign TimelineOur plan is to send the journal to print in September, receive them by early-mid October, prioritize getting them to retailers first for holiday season, and then to individuals.Since you can’t use them until late December, there’s no worries and it will most definitely be in your hands at least a month before then (aka November) for overviewing & gifting!There’s always the chance for sooner depending on production and such, but with corona still looming we’ve got some delays factored into our plan to leave plenty of leeway for time and to keep expectations in that range. February-April: research, collaborations, drawing, creating, designing, planningMay-July: journal creation, product creationAugust: campaign begins; finalizing journal creation, editing, proofing, preparing, ordering suppliesSeptember: campaign ends, journals finalized & print proof, sent to printOctober/November: journals received, fulfillment begins first to stores/bulk orders, then individualsNovember/December: distributed & in your hands well before holiday season & its start at the end of DecemberWhere is all this money going?As a self-published independent project, we are entirely self-funded. We host a fundraiser yearly to provide you with some amazing discounts & deals for helping us afford printing costs. Your support via pre-orders and sponsorships help make this journal possible!We believe in transparency, so you can see where all the money is being directed. Any extra money helps us get more journals printed so that we can keep spreading the magic! Plus, the creator hopes to get paid for all her hard work once all costs are covered so she can keep feeding herself and keep on creating this for you!All fees are covering printing & shipment to my home studio, covering platform & transaction fees, paying the postal service to ship these orders out to all of you & packaging supplies for shipments. I chose not to include other expenses such as marketing, paying our team helpers who make this possible, paying out collaborators, federal & state taxes, and other costs - this will be covered through sponsorships, and a hope for stretch goals beyond our base goal!Why Support Us?(photographed above is our 2020 journal)We’re a small, self-publishing, grassroots business founded by an independent artist and activist. This journal has been created from the heart & soul of a group on the same path as you.We only print in small-batches with recycled materials & never in mass-producing unethical factories. We are dedicated to aligning our ethics & eco-activism with our creation process. Cycles Journal is never printed in factories in China or anywhere else because we are dedicated to small, quality batches. We also consider the environment when choosing the recycled, certified paper, and we package with recycled materials as much as possible.We offer accessible options & discounts for low-income BIPOC.We are dedicated to providing accessible options for those who are marginalized and need some financial assistance. We are starting a pooled fund of donations; through the pay-it-forward method, you can support someone to receive a journal at a variable of a discounted price, which is open for discussion/sliding scale based on need. Pay it forward via the “add-on” option when you check out.Visit cyclesjournal.com/pay-it-forward for more info on how this process will work &/or to apply for relief.We are dedicated to intersectional feminism, anti-racism, and dismantling unjust power systems of white supremacy and patriarchy.This creation is inherently radical in the best way. Through empowering ourselves and learning how to harness our greatest assets (aka our bodies & mental health), we are rising up and bringing the matriarchal power back into alignment. We are dedicated to uplifting, representing, and focusing on serving our Black, Indigenous & Brown sisters & folks through this creation and all that it offers.We are committed to inclusivity & diversity.Someone told us last year that the journal was "too inclusive" and we took that as a win because that's the goal. We believe that queerness is beautiful, and we consider all gender identities who may embody a womb and use this journal. This is why we don't only use the word "women" to address our community, and it is why the journal aims to represent and address as many body types, gender presentation and skin tones as possible. This shows not only our want for justice and equality, but our refusal to go without it.When you support us, you support yourself.This journal is a gift to yourself or someone you love whether you realize it or not. The once-a-year investment is small compared to the expansion you'll uncover upon working with this journal. It is a powerful tool to help you shift your mind & practices. We believe that this is a beautiful reciprocal tool; you support our efforts and costs in creating this, and in return you receive a space of possibility & guidance, along with being a part of the collective evolutionary healing.About the CreatorI wanted to tell you a bit about who I am & why I started this creation, if you are curious. I'm Rachael Amber — I'm an illustrator & designer, a menstrual health & self-care advocate, an environmental activist, a plant whisperer, a cat-lover.... I create tools and visuals for change because it is how I feel driven to cope with some of the confinements and injustices of our society. Doing this work grounds me, gives me hope, and connects me to all of you. I am thankful that I can create work that resonates with others.My StoryI once bled in alignment with the full moon for 12 consecutive months. I had always sensed a connection to the moon’s influence, but now it was confirmed. I was going wild each cycle and needed solid ground to figure out what was influencing it all. I was in constant pain physically, was wildly unpredictable, and aggressive emotionally. I hated my own cycle — I was not at peace with myself, inside or out. There was a deep disconnect and war raging inside of me.  I sought to mend my lack of connection between myself and my womb. Slowly, I started to close the gaps and find understanding as I followed the lunar cycle and tracked my patterns alongside it. However, I did this mostly in my head or scattered between various apps that I would constantly forget to use or feel overwhelmed by more screen-time.  As I continued to sync up with the full moon, the intensity fueled me to know more. I felt called to dive deeper through a more organized approach. Creating a tool seemed like the only way I could figure out what influenced me and where it all linked — to uncover the magic that I was starting to feel beneath the surface. I wanted something to track it all in one place. Something that would inspire and motivate me to actually feel dedicated to it. So I realized that if it didn't exist already, this was my sign to create it. Originally, I was going to make a simple booklet for myself to use, but as I told others my revelation, I realized this was desired and needed by so many more. There was an underlying realization of lack of cyclical focus in our world. And so, like all of my ideas, I want to share it and expand it to help other people, too. Thus the guiding tool of Cycles Journal was born — for all of us.All Photography by Devon Dadoly. Model: Zuwena MshaleA Message to You The more intentional we can be leading up to things such as our bleeding time, the more we can work with our bodies rather than against. I like to say we are learning to flow with our tides rather than against them. Once we are aware, doors open everywhere for our expansion and transcendence from pain. We realize everything is intimately connected — and oftentimes — just needs our love and attention. Individually, self-care allows us to feel supported so we can be a better part of the collective whole. It helps us realize that we are worthy of choosing to prioritize ourselves. Collectively, we are learning to diverge from a strictly work & logic mindset that the world is focused on. We’re learning to instead be perceptive, to listen, to feel, and to realize it's much more beautiful and intuitive to live this way. We are learning that we can use this knowledge to be even better versions of ourselves. It's truly a ripple effect. It's beautiful how much pain we can shed & love we can share with ourselves and one another once we get beyond the idea that our periods are a burden and our bodies are not on our side. We are ending the deflected war against our human vessels & the natural, beautiful, magic processes they carry us through. That all of this is pure and to be cherished is the most important thing to remember. When we are intentional and caring, we can make anything happen.Risks & ChallengesWith all projects, there are risks and challenges. The main ones we face are printing and production time. For the past two years we have met our deadlines and all has gone according to plan, aside from minor delays and spelling/number errors uncaught pre-press. We are making sure this doesn't happen again!
We have an editing team to make sure the information is correct and spelling errors are caught pre-press.
We are working hard to create the journal to its fullest and most beautiful potential. Any speed bumps will be met with care and communication.
We have allowed extra cushioning room in our schedule so that you will receive your journals well by the holiday season if you pre-ordered — and at least a month+ ahead of time before the new year & the journal's official start date of the Solstice on December 29, 2020.
We have also factored in the chances of shipping delays and such with corona looming in the air still. While we can’t fully control any postal delays, we just assume things always take longer than expected, so that’s why we say November delivery and appreciate your patience.
A Note on Shipping:Our goal is to get everyone in the U.S. their journal before December - November is our goal, before holidays & especially before its start date in December 2020 - with no promises to international although we will prioritize shipping yours first. While we cannot guarantee shipping delays won't be in effect due to COVID, the mail for the election in the U.S. & holiday season, we are allowing extra time to accommodate this and will do all we can.We will ship in the following order:1. International2. Shop/Retail Bulk Orders3. Other Bulk4. Early Birds5. Etc in order of tiersShipping estimates are always just estimates - oftentimes they are inaccurate, especially when you factor in the layers of chaos in the world right now :-). We appreciate your patience in advance and are factoring in extra time. A normal time-frame for priority mail in the U.S. is 2-5 days, but at this point we must allow up to 2 weeks. As for international, sadly I've had orders take up to 3 months to arrive, but on average I say allow 1-2 months. We will ship yours first regardless in hopes it arrives sooner than later.Our goal is to ship everything in early November so it has a full month to reach everyone before it begins and before holiday season. We will be prioritizing shipments to shops & international orders first - in October if possible. We are also going to ship all orders via priority mail this year, aside from bulk orders which are media mail unless an upgrade is requested.We hope for the best for the future of the understaffed and threatened USPS and their underpaid workers. We will update you as time goes on and hope for the best. While we cannot control the postal service, we will do everything in our power to ensure that you get your journals.Help Us Spread The MovementAs a small project growing and rooting, we can use all the help we can get spreading the word. We are grateful to anyone who helps us reach more cyclical beings to help and heal together!How you can help:

Share on Social: Click the "share" button on this page and simply share to your social media

Follow & Share Us on IG @cyclesjournal for progress, inspiration, & previews

Share via Email to any friends/loved ones with a womb you think this could help!

Join our newsletter & share it with others, to always know when future years’ pre-orders come out, moon musings, sales, benefits, events, and more!
Thank You!Thank you for being here on this healing journey with us. We are so grateful for all the connection and love this has fostered between us all. We are growing a powerful movement together, and we are excited to keep raising the bar for us all. We deserve to love our bodies, be friends with our cycles, and ride the waves of life with more ease and bliss. We are magical, powerful, beautiful, cyclical beings — and it's time we owned it!Team:Founder, Illustrator & Designer: Rachael AmberWith assistance from:Editor: Hannah HerreraWebsite/Campaign Design Assistant: Natalie RozvadovskyOrder Fulfillment: Sam Levson, Nicholas CainMarketing Strategy: Rachel Krampe Community & Sponsorsfeatured in the journal:Jessi Mendez of Wild Essence Alchemy — Ani Ferlise — Raven Rose — Allie McFee — Mackensey Alexander — Nicole Pemberton — Amanda Ananda — Sofiya Maria  — Andie Osbey — Alexandra Marisia — Hara Rose Satori — Shannon Danielle& more within our pages & our Healing Resource Directory (TBA soon)www.cyclesjournal.com / @cyclesjournal

story:
What is Goblin Market?

Goblin Market is an immersive theatrical adventure which tells the story of two sisters, Lizzie and Laura. Through the glen, we follow the sisters as they struggle to preserve their innocence against the temptations of the Goblin merchants and their sumptuous fruit.

Adapted from the 1862 poem by Christina Rossetti by the same name, Goblin Market is a new piece of immersive, site-specific, theatre adapted and directed by Tanner Efinger, Artistic Director of Syracuse-based Breadcrumbs Productions.

Goblin Market combines elements of performance with visual art created by Cathedral Art Collective, founded by Jamie Santos, Cayetano Valenzuela, and Issac Bidwell.  Cathedral Art Collective will also host an exclusive, two-night-only event Black Masquerade; a costume ball where audiences can experience more unique performances, and purchase one-of-a-kind artwork.

When & Where

Goblin Market 
October 14, 15, 16 @ 7:30pm
October 21, 22, 23 @ 7:30pm

Black Masquarade
October 16 & 23 @ 10:00pm

Tickets go on sale September 23!

Why We Need Your Help

We are committed to the long term sustainability of local artists. This practice comes in many forms starting with providing a fair wage for local artists and encouraging this practice throughout our community. We also provide artist development through training, resource sharing, networking, and project development. 

The prolonged goal is creating and maintaining a flourishing arts community where a youthful and talented population of artists can continue to thrive.  A fertile soil is a benefit to all growing flowers in a garden.  Let’s make a place artists want to live; where one flourishes, all flourish!

By contributing to Goblin Market and Black Masquarade, you help sustain the professional artists working with Breadcrumbs Productions and Cathedral Art Collective.

Who We Are

Breadcrumbs Productions, Inc. is a professional theatre and creative production company based in Syracuse, New York, in residence at Wunderbar. We produce full theatrical productions, event entertainment, and artist opportunities. Our vision is an artist-centered enterprise, pushing the boundaries of imaginative theatre and adding to a healthy local artistic ecosystem.

Cathedral Art Collective started as an idea of enriching the arts community through public arts shows.  The main driving force and passion for the projects has been bringing attention to the arts by the general public, while also promoting local artists, and growing a culture in alternative arts within the CNY community.  The Collective is not about any one person; it is about the mutual benefit and combined group efforts to make the art scene thrive. We care about each other and our artistic community.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!
Follow us on social media for exclusive content, upcoming classes & events, and how to stay involved!

Facebook:  
Breadcrumbs Productions
Cathedral Art Collective

Instagram:  
@breadcrumbsproductions
@cathedral_collective


See you soon...

story:
Ordering now from our store at www.STICKYBONES.com

ACCEPTING PRE-ORDERS NOW.

Stickybones is a highly-articulated, precision-poseable animation puppet, allowing artists, animators, students, and creatives at heart to explore expressive, gravity-defying poses quickly and easily. Stickybones is the best tool for storytellers looking to bridge the gap between your ideas to the computer. 

 

  • Custom engineered materials
  • Built to last a lifetime
  • Used at every major animation studio in the world
  • Good for beginners and experts alike
  • Made in the USA



Check out this stop motion animation we made with Stickybones!


 

 


Super-flexible and extremely intuitive, Stickybones is made of engineering-grade polymers for ultimate strength combined with a sophisticated joint system, allowing you to tell your stories in a tactile, visually-engaging way. 

 

 

Insanely FUN & FLEXIBLE

 

 


 

 

 

NEW! Watch Stickybones and FLY-RIG DemoVideo

 

 

 

Create & Animate Infinite Poses Quickly!
 

Magnets in the feet and hands allow for dynamic, gravity-defying poses.  The special patent pending ball and socket joints allow you to rotate each joint on any axis and are capable of tiny micro-movements allowing for seemingly infinite combinations.

 


 

 

Magnetic Hands & Feet

 
 

 

 

Move from idea to animation faster than ever

                                    


 

 

Stickybones is the Ultimate Artist’s Companion

 

  Stickybones can hit and hold the poses you've always wished your poseable figure could.  We spend a vast amount of time studying human kinesiology to ensure Stickybones meets and exceeds the natural range of motion.

 

“I could definitely use Stickybones in my paintings—I paint a lot of dancers among other things and Stickybones is perfect for that because it gives me the perspective elements and structure I need to get a solid drawing. Then I can add all the other elements—the lighting, clothing and the general appearance of the character." 
 — Emanuele Pavarotti, Blue Sky Studios (pictured above)

 

“I am an avid sketcher. I love drawing in my sketchbook and just coming up with really unique poses.  When I first saw Stickybones, I thought that this would be a really awesome way to explore posing.”

— Garrett Shikuma, Blue Sky Studios (pictured above)

 

 

 

A Wide Variety of Uses

 

 

 

“I can see Stickybones technology as a go to in the performing arts for many disciplines of dance—not only for describing complicated choreography with intricate detail, but also for preserving works created today and historically. Our current forms of notation lack detail and movement—but Stickybones could allow for full and fluid demonstration. Also, Stickybones has endless options as a choreographic tool. This could be utilized for years to come.”      — Derrick Agnoletti, Leading Artist with The Joffrey Ballet

 

 

Intuitive Tool for Students & Teachers

"As an art instructor, I have always wanted a better way to show my students how the human body moves. Using live models or wooden manikins left me wanting more.  When Erik and Lauren introduced their Stickybones figure to my middle school 3-D action figure sculpture class, it was quickly evident that this was the moveable figure that my students would benefit from and the type of figure I had been looking for. I can envision many exciting advantages and possibilities that Stickybones can offer, not only to the fine arts but also to many other teaching disciplines."  

— Sharon Wilkus, Art Instructor & Yearbook Adviser, Almaden Country School

 

 

 

 

 

 


Ready to animate right out of the box

 

Stickybones lowers the barrier of entry for anyone looking to explore stop motion animation.  You can take Stickybones out of the package and start posing and animating immediately—no need to spend large amounts of time and money on building your own puppet from scratch.


 

 

(CG Rendering)

 


 

SHIPPING INFO:

How shipping will work...Once we lock down the packaging and final product weight,we'll be pricing multiple carriers to try to find the best shipping deals.  Then we'll collect the shipping fees from you for the total items ordered, survey you for your color choice, confirm your current mailing address... and ship!!  :)  (International backers should expect import tax.) 

 

 

 

 

How it works

 

 

 

 

Joints Engineered To Hold Your Poses

 

Stickybones has been engineered to withstand anything your imagination throws its way. As animators, we understand the importance of having strong and precisely functioning joints to consistently hold our poses.  From the outset, creating a solution that enables our joints to endure wide ranges of motion and repeated use has remained at the heart of our Stickybones design and functionality.  

Because our joints have the great benefit and convenience of a pre-tensioned socket system, one of the physical characteristics we are carefully scrutinizing are qualities relating to the retention of surface volume for increased longevity and optimum joint performance, enabling Stickybones to maintain their stiffness and ability to hold your poses with repeated use.

 

Our primary objective is to make the most robust and highly functioning animation/artistic figure on the market while keeping the price accessible to everyone.  Currently, the best way we can accomplish this is by having high-grade steel molds precisely tooled that will be used to then injection mold our parts with the highest quality engineering grade polymers.  Through the combination of design for animation and poseability, world-class tooling, ultra-tight tolerance injection molding, and specially tuned materials, Stickybones is infused and methodically constructed to help you more rapidly animate and create the poses you really want to hit!

 

 

Where Are We in Production?

 

We’ve designed and built working prototypes—now the next step is to build the tooling and molds for manufacturing.  We’ve chosen and are working hand-in-hand with a US-based manufacturer specializing in precision tooling and tight-tolerance injection molding.  We’ve also chosen a US-based packaging company and are currently reviewing packaging options.


We've already saved tens of thousands of dollars during the past year and a half of development by designing with precision CAD based software(Autodesk Fusion 360) and fabricating our own animation-ready prototypes using a combination of 3D (SLA) printing, tooling, and injection molding processes.



 

 

 

Made by Animators, for Animators & Artists

With the years of knowledge gathered working in the animation industry, we've worked hard to pour these nuggets of creative goodness into the development of Stickybones.  As a result, Stickybones has become a versatile, precisely calibrated tool for artists and storytellers to create their own images.

 

 

Meet the Stickybones Team



 

Why Fund us on Indiegogo?

Once on store-shelves, it is important to us that Stickybones remains affordable and within reach for students on a budget. The best way to achieve this is to use full-scale manufacturing to make the parts. However, the tooling necessary for full-scale manufacturing is a labor intensive and an extremely expensive process, requiring a huge upfront investment. Here is the best part... You can help get Stickybones manufactured and be one of the first people to get your very own Stickybones simply by contributing to our Indiegogo Campaign!

 

 

Official Sponsors & Partners

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Stickybones FAQs

 

Q: How do I pre-order a Stickybones of my very own?

Answer: You can pre-order Stickybones by claiming one of the exclusive perks we’ve offered above. The perks are listed on the right-hand side of the campaign page, starting at the top. To claim one of the perks, all you have to do is click on one you would like and go through the payment confirmation. You will get a confirmation email from Indiegogo. 

Q: What is the Indiegogo Limited Edition Color going to be?

Answer:  A backer's vote has been taken and the winner is Spark Blue!  

 

Q: Will the final product be 3D-Printed?

Answer:  Nope. 3D printed materials currently lack the strength, durability, and a gamut of physical characteristics required for optimum joint performance and longevity. Our primary objective is to make the most robust and highly functioning animation/artistic figure on the market while keeping the price accessible to everyone, and currently, the best way we can accomplish this is with high-precision injection molding with strong, engineering-grade materials.

 

Q: SHIPPING: WHERE will you ship?

Answer: We plan to ship worldwide!  However, please note:  Every country has its own shipping regulations and rules.  Once the final Stickybones is manufactured and packaged, if your country, (for some reason) says we cannot ship it there, then you will be issued a full refund.

 

Q: I do not live in the United States...what are some international shipping cost considerations?

A: Some extra shipping cost considerations for International Backers will be customs/duty taxes.  (Some countries require a VAT.)   Please make sure you're comfortable covering International shipping and the customs and duty taxes of your own country before contributing/pre-ordering, as some countries are notoriously high--which (of course) we have no control over.

 

Q: SHIPPING: How much will shipping cost?
Answer: We are working out final shipping costs right now.  We have backers from 90 countries!  Which is awesome! But as you can imagine, calculating shipping to all of them is quite an enormous chunk of work!   Before we ship anything to you, we will get in touch with you to confirm your mailing address, get any color preferences and collect shipping fees.  International backers must anticipate import taxes and fees charged by your country's customs agency.

 

Q:  How do I get in touch with your team?  

Answer: Email hello@stickybones.com

 

Q: How tall is Stickybones?

Answer:  Stickybones is 8.5 inches (21.5 cm) tall.  (1/9th Scale)

 

Q: Can I put clay, foam, or latex over Stickybones?

Answer:  Stickybones is designed to be a simple, easy-to-use solution that doesn't require extra work.  We have not tested adding any kind of bulk to this figure... But that being said, we encourage people to get experimental and try out anything they'd like!

 

Q:  Is Stickybones meant to replace traditional stop motion armatures?

Answer:   We're creating Stickybones to be a useful tool for all kinds of animators and artists—with the fantastic benefit of having the functionality of being able to create stop motion animation... it's not meant to replace traditional stop motion armatures.  It's meant to be a fast, easy and affordable solution for someone who wants to jump right in and pose or animate!

 

Q: Do you plan to release other characters or a quadruped?

Answer:  Yes, we are looking forward to using our patent pending joint system in alternate characters and animals!  Also, because our limbs and joints are modular, we can release variations on individual body parts.

 

Q: How can I hit mid-air poses? Will you release an articulated arm/rig?

Answer:  Yes, you can pre-order our super duper FLY_RIG!

 

Q: I’m just starting out in animation or looking to learn more about it. Is Stickybones for me?

Answer: Yes!  We’re creating Stickybones to be an intuitive, easy-to-use tool to help both professionals and beginners alike push their art and animation further!

 

Q:  Will you offer a surface or base that Stickybones can attach to?

Answer: Yes.  Every Stickybones will come with a FREE compact Pose-Plate to display your sweet poses.  If you want a larger surface on which to animate,  we recommend you pre-order a Performance Stage! 

 

Q: How long can Stickybones hold each pose?

Answer: Most poses should hold as long as you’d like them to!

 

Q:  How do the joints work?

Answer:  We have a patent pending joint system comprised of pre-tensioned, interlocking, snap-to-fit ball and socket parts you can pop apart and back together, when desired.  This allows Stickybones to be more modular and enhances the ability to modify the appearance and swap parts with variations we may release in the future.  This pre-tensioned ball and socket design also opens up the freedom of motion, maximizing the rotational range of our joints on the X,Y, Z axis.

 

Q:  How are the joints able to hold extreme poses with repeated use?

Answer:  Stickybones joints are robust in design and construction.  They are made with a combination of high-performance and highly wear-resistant materials, enabling them to maintain their stiffness and ability to hold your poses with repeated use.  As animators, we understand the importance of having stiff joints and precision functionality to consistently hold poses and create performances.  From the outset, creating a solution that enables our joints to endure repeated use has remained at the heart of our Stickybones design and functionality.  

 

Q: I’m having trouble claiming a perk. Who should I reach out to?

Answer:  Email support@indiegogo.com

 

Q: I didn't get a confirmation email for a perk I contributed to, who should I reach out to?

Answer: Email support@indiegogo.com

 

Q: How do I upgrade my perk?

Answer:  https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles...

 

Q: I would like a refund. How do I do this?

Answer: https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/213172367
story_txt:
Ordering now from our store at www.STICKYBONES.com
ACCEPTING PRE-ORDERS NOW.Stickybones is a highly-articulated, precision-poseable animation puppet, allowing artists, animators, students, and creatives at heart to explore expressive, gravity-defying poses quickly and easily. Stickybones is the best tool for storytellers looking to bridge the gap between your ideas to the computer.  
Custom engineered materials
Built to last a lifetime
Used at every major animation studio in the world
Good for beginners and experts alike
Made in the USA
Check out this stop motion animation we made with Stickybones!
 
 
Super-flexible and extremely intuitive, Stickybones is made of engineering-grade polymers for ultimate strength combined with a sophisticated joint system, allowing you to tell your stories in a tactile, visually-engaging way.   Insanely FUN & FLEXIBLE     NEW! Watch Stickybones and FLY-RIG DemoVideo   Create & Animate Infinite Poses Quickly! 
Magnets in the feet and hands allow for dynamic, gravity-defying poses.  The special patent pending ball and socket joints allow you to rotate each joint on any axis and are capable of tiny micro-movements allowing for seemingly infinite combinations.   Magnetic Hands & Feet    Move from idea to animation faster than ever                                    
  Stickybones is the Ultimate Artist’s Companion
 
  Stickybones can hit and hold the poses you've always wished your poseable figure could.  We spend a vast amount of time studying human kinesiology to ensure Stickybones meets and exceeds the natural range of motion.
 

“I could definitely use Stickybones in my paintings—I paint a lot of dancers among other things and Stickybones is perfect for that because it gives me the perspective elements and structure I need to get a solid drawing. Then I can add all the other elements—the lighting, clothing and the general appearance of the character."  — Emanuele Pavarotti, Blue Sky Studios (pictured above)
 

“I am an avid sketcher. I love drawing in my sketchbook and just coming up with really unique poses.  When I first saw Stickybones, I thought that this would be a really awesome way to explore posing.”
— Garrett Shikuma, Blue Sky Studios (pictured above)
 
 
 
A Wide Variety of Uses

 
 
 
“I can see Stickybones technology as a go to in the performing arts for many disciplines of dance—not only for describing complicated choreography with intricate detail, but also for preserving works created today and historically. Our current forms of notation lack detail and movement—but Stickybones could allow for full and fluid demonstration. Also, Stickybones has endless options as a choreographic tool. This could be utilized for years to come.”      — Derrick Agnoletti, Leading Artist with The Joffrey Ballet  
Intuitive Tool for Students & Teachers

"As an art instructor, I have always wanted a better way to show my students how the human body moves. Using live models or wooden manikins left me wanting more.  When Erik and Lauren introduced their Stickybones figure to my middle school 3-D action figure sculpture class, it was quickly evident that this was the moveable figure that my students would benefit from and the type of figure I had been looking for. I can envision many exciting advantages and possibilities that Stickybones can offer, not only to the fine arts but also to many other teaching disciplines."  
— Sharon Wilkus, Art Instructor & Yearbook Adviser, Almaden Country School
 
 
  
 

 

Ready to animate right out of the box
 
Stickybones lowers the barrier of entry for anyone looking to explore stop motion animation.  You can take Stickybones out of the package and start posing and animating immediately—no need to spend large amounts of time and money on building your own puppet from scratch.

 
 

(CG Rendering)
 
 
SHIPPING INFO:
How shipping will work...Once we lock down the packaging and final product weight,we'll be pricing multiple carriers to try to find the best shipping deals.  Then we'll collect the shipping fees from you for the total items ordered, survey you for your color choice, confirm your current mailing address... and ship!!  :)  (International backers should expect import tax.)   
  
How it works
 
  

 
Joints Engineered To Hold Your Poses

 
Stickybones has been engineered to withstand anything your imagination throws its way. As animators, we understand the importance of having strong and precisely functioning joints to consistently hold our poses.  From the outset, creating a solution that enables our joints to endure wide ranges of motion and repeated use has remained at the heart of our Stickybones design and functionality.  
Because our joints have the great benefit and convenience of a pre-tensioned socket system, one of the physical characteristics we are carefully scrutinizing are qualities relating to the retention of surface volume for increased longevity and optimum joint performance, enabling Stickybones to maintain their stiffness and ability to hold your poses with repeated use.
 
Our primary objective is to make the most robust and highly functioning animation/artistic figure on the market while keeping the price accessible to everyone.  Currently, the best way we can accomplish this is by having high-grade steel molds precisely tooled that will be used to then injection mold our parts with the highest quality engineering grade polymers.  Through the combination of design for animation and poseability, world-class tooling, ultra-tight tolerance injection molding, and specially tuned materials, Stickybones is infused and methodically constructed to help you more rapidly animate and create the poses you really want to hit!
 
 
Where Are We in Production?
 
We’ve designed and built working prototypes—now the next step is to build the tooling and molds for manufacturing.  We’ve chosen and are working hand-in-hand with a US-based manufacturer specializing in precision tooling and tight-tolerance injection molding.  We’ve also chosen a US-based packaging company and are currently reviewing packaging options.
We've already saved tens of thousands of dollars during the past year and a half of development by designing with precision CAD based software(Autodesk Fusion 360) and fabricating our own animation-ready prototypes using a combination of 3D (SLA) printing, tooling, and injection molding processes.   
Made by Animators, for Animators & Artists
With the years of knowledge gathered working in the animation industry, we've worked hard to pour these nuggets of creative goodness into the development of Stickybones.  As a result, Stickybones has become a versatile, precisely calibrated tool for artists and storytellers to create their own images.
 
 
Meet the Stickybones Team

 Why Fund us on Indiegogo?
Once on store-shelves, it is important to us that Stickybones remains affordable and within reach for students on a budget. The best way to achieve this is to use full-scale manufacturing to make the parts. However, the tooling necessary for full-scale manufacturing is a labor intensive and an extremely expensive process, requiring a huge upfront investment. Here is the best part... You can help get Stickybones manufactured and be one of the first people to get your very own Stickybones simply by contributing to our Indiegogo Campaign!  
Official Sponsors & Partners
 
 

  
 
  
 
 
 

 
Stickybones FAQs Q: How do I pre-order a Stickybones of my very own?
Answer: You can pre-order Stickybones by claiming one of the exclusive perks we’ve offered above. The perks are listed on the right-hand side of the campaign page, starting at the top. To claim one of the perks, all you have to do is click on one you would like and go through the payment confirmation. You will get a confirmation email from Indiegogo. 
Q: What is the Indiegogo Limited Edition Color going to be?
Answer:  A backer's vote has been taken and the winner is Spark Blue!  
 
Q: Will the final product be 3D-Printed?
Answer:  Nope. 3D printed materials currently lack the strength, durability, and a gamut of physical characteristics required for optimum joint performance and longevity. Our primary objective is to make the most robust and highly functioning animation/artistic figure on the market while keeping the price accessible to everyone, and currently, the best way we can accomplish this is with high-precision injection molding with strong, engineering-grade materials.
 
Q: SHIPPING: WHERE will you ship?
Answer: We plan to ship worldwide!  However, please note:  Every country has its own shipping regulations and rules.  Once the final Stickybones is manufactured and packaged, if your country, (for some reason) says we cannot ship it there, then you will be issued a full refund.
 
Q: I do not live in the United States...what are some international shipping cost considerations?
A: Some extra shipping cost considerations for International Backers will be customs/duty taxes.  (Some countries require a VAT.)   Please make sure you're comfortable covering International shipping and the customs and duty taxes of your own country before contributing/pre-ordering, as some countries are notoriously high--which (of course) we have no control over. Q: SHIPPING: How much will shipping cost?Answer: We are working out final shipping costs right now.  We have backers from 90 countries!  Which is awesome! But as you can imagine, calculating shipping to all of them is quite an enormous chunk of work!   Before we ship anything to you, we will get in touch with you to confirm your mailing address, get any color preferences and collect shipping fees.  International backers must anticipate import taxes and fees charged by your country's customs agency. Q:  How do I get in touch with your team?  
Answer: Email hello@stickybones.com
 
Q: How tall is Stickybones?
Answer:  Stickybones is 8.5 inches (21.5 cm) tall.  (1/9th Scale)
 
Q: Can I put clay, foam, or latex over Stickybones?
Answer:  Stickybones is designed to be a simple, easy-to-use solution that doesn't require extra work.  We have not tested adding any kind of bulk to this figure... But that being said, we encourage people to get experimental and try out anything they'd like!
 
Q:  Is Stickybones meant to replace traditional stop motion armatures?
Answer:   We're creating Stickybones to be a useful tool for all kinds of animators and artists—with the fantastic benefit of having the functionality of being able to create stop motion animation... it's not meant to replace traditional stop motion armatures.  It's meant to be a fast, easy and affordable solution for someone who wants to jump right in and pose or animate! Q: Do you plan to release other characters or a quadruped?

Answer:  Yes, you can pre-order our super duper FLY_RIG! Q: I’m just starting out in animation or looking to learn more about it. Is Stickybones for me?
Answer: Yes!  We’re creating Stickybones to be an intuitive, easy-to-use tool to help both professionals and beginners alike push their art and animation further!

story:
I'd like to start by saying check the perks. We have some vape products available for a contribution equivalent to the typical retail price of the mods, RDA's, and RTA's. These are fair deals for you and they help us fund our project.

Hello! Thanks for taking a moment to read about our new business venture! Our names are Jim, Sara, and Roy. We are all ex smokers and have made the switch to vapor. With the vaping experience we were all able to get off big tobacco and reduce health risks dramatically. We love the vaping experience and can't wait to share it with our customers in a new and exciting way. We look to open a new vape shop in Longmont Colorado that will cater to the needs of our local vape community, as well as local artists. 303 Vapes will offer an extremely low consignment rate for local artists that otherwise might not have a profitable place to showcase and sell their pieces. We hope to help more new people discover vaping as an alternative to tobacco and get healthy! Our shop will also offer a comfortable environment where people can hang out and socialize while vaping as we will be offering free wifi and other amenities. We appreciate every contribution that helps us achieve the dream of owning a successful vape business. So there are quite a few vapor shops out there but that's not important. What is important is that we have a recipe for success and are eager to become entrepreneurs in this new market before it's too late. Contrary to information that big tobacco may provide the news about there not being enough research and there are possible risks, we vouch for VAPOR and the health benefits that come with the switch. Big tobacco will lobby and pay secretively for advertisements against vapor. They are afraid, as they should be, that people are finally finding a way to kick tobacco. I'd like to see Big Tobacco bankrupt.

FYI: More incentives coming soon including vapor starter kits, coffee mugs, RDA Mod combos and more... check back soon for new 303 Vapes Gear. Even a $1 contribution would help, It will all add up to success! Incentives ship within the USA only.

A little history about us:

Jim grew up working in a custom wood shop with his father who would design and build furniture. These skills, hand me down techniques and tricks of the trade have given Jim the ability to transform what may seem like some scrap pieces of wood into an amazing piece whether it be something as small as a coaster or mod stand to larger pieces like tables and desks. Jim also is a skilled stone mason who can cut, shape, fabricate and lay stone with the best of them.  His experience doesn't stop there. Jim also has experience with working in a weld shop, antique restoration shop, landscape construction, and many more hobbies/jobs that ultimately helped form his creative mind for sculpting metal and mixing mediums like metals and exotic woods.

Roy is a third generation stone mason who takes his trade very seriously. His attention to detail is immaculate, and inherited from his father who is well known for the quality of stone masonry that he provides. Roy Has learned some skills with woodworking from Jim and is experimenting with others like steam bending. Roy also enjoys Blacksmithing as a hobby where he is working on the art of forging and brazing his own carbide chisels for stone masonry, creating cold steel chisels, knives, tuckpointers, trowels, and anything that seems plausible when the forge fires up. Roy also enjoys welding which he uses in the fabrication of his own industrial art pieces which range from Desks and tables to a collection of wild and science fiction like lamps.

Sara has spent 14+ years working as manager in well known banks in the area. She is  an avid networking figure and because of this she is involved in many areas of our community.  Due to all her connection in the area she is also involved in many diverse projects. Just to name a few, Sara works with a local non-profit as a board member/treasurer to help under privilege youth get music lessons. Sara takes pride in also being very involved with music and the arts scene in our area. Her most recent endeavors have taken her to the Stage as a performer/actress in a very moving theatrical/musical  production to bring awareness to domestic violence. She has always been eager to have a career that will let her explore some of her more creative Goals and aspirations. Sara has started a candle business called "Candle Nerd" where she creates interesting and unique soy based scented candles that smell amazing and look just as great along with custom soaps that are unique and fun. Needless to say, Sara has a very extensive creative and business driven background.   

So in conclusion we want to take these wild creations of ours and use them to help create an art friendly environment where people can come in to purchase their much needed vaping supplies, vape, enjoy a rotating display of artwork which will be mostly for sale, hang out and use the wifi while vaping or building coils, and just be comfortable. We estimate that we will need as much as $20,000 to really make this idea hit the ground running and as little as $15,000 on a tighter budget. We will all be contributing as much as we can to keep momentum but we can't do it without some support. $7500.00 would pay for a year of service with a website service provider (Roy has experience and will work with jim and sara to create the website) it will pay for our professional logo for business cards, secure a property for the store, Purchase of an eye catching sign for the shop, Some SEO services for the website, and possibly a point of sale system. One great thing about Jim and Roy's fabricating abilities is that they can build/create most of the furniture in the shop, so some of these funds may also go towards material for furniture creations and interesting displays.

We just registered our business "J.L.S Vapors L.L.C." and our trade name "303 Vapes". This will be an amazing start where every contribution will be greatly appreciated.

Regards,
Jim, Sara, and Roy
J.L.S Vapor "303 Vapes"
Longmont, Co

Shipping is included in the perks price for United States only. Not sure how to make amendments for international shipping. If anyone can provide details on that subject we would appreciate the tips.

story:
DALAI LAMA'S TIBET: a book and exhibition to help the Tibetan cause.

As the Dalai Lama approaches his 80th birthday in 2015, this year presents itself as an important moment to document and explain the here and now of the Tibetan cause. The dream of a free Tibet has evolved in recent times. Instead of independence, Tibetans are pursuing political and cultural autonomy within China. It is a very realistic step for them. One that, without a doubt, has many more possibilities than the pursue of independence. But for now, the authorities of the biggest country of the world remain silent. The fourteen Dalai Lama, authentic leader of the Tibetan people and worldwide recognized figure, has renounced to his political duties -now fulfilled by a Prime Minister and a Tibetan Parliament in exile, installed in Dharamsala, India- to focus exclusively on being a religious and spiritual leader. 

Our project:

Thanks to our personal relationship with Thubten Wangchen-la  -who is Deputy of the Tibetan Parliament, an old friend of the Dalai Dama and his representative in part of Europe (Spain, Portugal, France, Germany)- we have guaranteed access to the places and the protagonist of the story we want to tell: Dalai Lama's Tibet: his memories and vision of Tibet after over half a century in exile.

We will visit Tibet and Dharamsala (India) to chat with his holiness. Our photographic journey will interlace conversations with the spiritual leader, to share with the world an up close and personal vision of Tibet.

Then we will produce a coffee table book, in English and Spanish, and we will donate 1000 copies to the Tibetan Government to create awareness and to help them with the means to generate some funds for the cause. We will also present an exhibition that will open in Barcelona (Spain) where Thubten Wangchen-la is the director of Casa del Tíbet. It is also our intention to bring the exhibition to New York in 2,016.

Fundraising campaign:

• Phase 1 – Content production in Dharamsala and Tibet: $10,000

• Phase 2 – Book production: $15,000

A4 format. 200 pages approx. #1,000 copies in English and Spanish to be donated to the sponsoring charity.

• Phase 3 – Exhibition: $5000 per location

Total $35,000

Who are we?

We are a team of two journalist friends who want to capture and share the essence of the Tibetan cause today, as the Dalai Lama enters his sunset years.

Eduardo Rubio is a globetrotter journalist based in Barcelona, Spain, who has extensively traveled the planet for decades, producing photo-reports published in Spanish and European media, focusing on war and social issues. He has published the following books: “Indira Ghandi” (1996), “Niños” / Kids (Lunwerg Editores, 2002), “Nosotros: el mundo hoy” / We: the world today (Lunwerg Editores, 2004), “Guatemala” (Lunwerg Editores, 2005), “Chagas: la enfermedad silenciosa” / Chagas: the silent disease (for Doctors Without Borders ), “Holy Places, Sacred Sites”  (Times & Hudson, 2009), “Au nom d´un dieu” / In the name of God (Editions du Rouergue, 2009). Eduardo has exhibited his photographic work in Spain and Mexico.

http://www.behance.net/eduardorubiophoto

http://eduardorubioclick.com 

Mónica Gutiérrez is a New York based journalist and creative director, currently in charge of the homepage content strategy of Univision, the leading media company in Hispanic America, gateway to information and entertainment consumed by the vast majority of Spanish language users in the USA. She writes for the Huffington Post and other media outlets, mostly about human rights, sustainability, arts and culture.

www.linkedin.com/in/trixel/


_________________________ VERSION EN ESPAÑOL _________________________

El Dalai Lama está próximo a cumplir sus ochenta años: razón de peso para documentar el aquí y ahora de la causa tibetana, que hoy por hoy es diferente a los años pasados. Los tibetanos han renunciado a la independencia y ahora luchan por tener una autonomía política y cultural dentro de China. Es un paso muy realista, aunque las autoridades del país más grande del planeta no se pronuncian. Indudablemente la autonomía tiene mas posibilidades que la independencia.

Por su parte el Dalai Lama -autentico líder de los tibetanos y figura de relieve mundial- ha renunciado a sus cargos políticos, que ahora ejercen un Primer Ministro y un Parlamento Tibetano en el exilio, instalado en Dharamsala. El XIV Dalai Lama se enfoca unicamente en ser líder y autoridad religiosa.

El proyecto: un libro y una exhibición itinerante

Gracias a la relación personal de Eduardo con Thubten Wangchen-la  ---Diputado del Parlamento Tibetano, un viejo amigo del Dalai Lama y su representante en una parte de Europa (España, Portugal, Francia, Alemania)--- tendremos acceso a los lugares y protagonistas de la historia que queremos contar: El Tíbet del Dalai Lama, memorias y visiones tras dos tercios de vida en el exilio.

Visitaremos el Tíbet y Dharamsala (India) para encontrar la historia de frente. Nuestro viaje fotográfico intercalará anécdotas, recuerdos, enseñanzas y visiones que permitan materializar un vistazo cercano y personal del líder espiritual y su pueblo.

Produciremos un libro artístico, en español e inglés, y donaremos mil copias al gobierno tibetano para ayudar a diseminar la causa y colaborar con un medio para que generen fondos. También presentaremos una exhibición en la Casa Tíbet de Barcelona, que dirige Thubten Wangchen-la. Es nuestra intención que la muestra se presente también en Nueva York al año siguiente.

Campaña para levantar fondos:

• Fase 1 – Producción de contenidos en Dharamsala y Tíbet:

€ 9,250

• Fase 2 – Producción del libro: € 14,000

Formato A4. 200 páginas aprox. #1,000 copias para donación

• Fase 3 – Exhibición: € 4500 por localidad

Total € 32,250

¿Quiénes somos?

Somos un equipo de dos amigos periodistas que desean capturar y compartir la esencia de la causa tibetana en el ocaso de la vida del XIV Dalai Lama.

Eduardo Rubio es un fotoperiodista trotamundos que vive en Barcelona, España. Ha viajado extensa e intensamente el planeta por décadas, produciendo reportajes para medios europeos, con foco en guerras y temas sociales. Ha publicado seis libros: “Indira Ghandi” (1996), “Niños” (Lunwerg Editores, 2002), “Nosotros: el mundo hoy” (Lunwerg Editores, 2004), “Guatemala” (Lunwerg Editores, 2005), “Chagas: la enfermedad silenciosa” (para Médicos Sin Fronteras), “Holy Places, Sacred Sites”  (Times & Hudson, 2009), “Au nom d´un dieu” (Editions du Rouergue, 2009). Eduardo ha exhibido su trabajo fotográfico en España y México.

http://www.behance.net/eduardorubiophoto

http://eduardorubioclick.com

Mónica Gutiérrez es una periodista y directora creativa que vive en Nueva York. Actualmente está a cargo de la estrategia de contenidos digitales de Univision, el medio en español más importante de Estados Unidos. Escribe para el Huffington Post y otros medios, mayormente sobre temas de derechos humanos, sustentabilidad, arte y cultura.

www.linkedin.com/in/trixel/
story_txt:
DALAI LAMA'S TIBET: a book and exhibition to help the Tibetan cause.As
the Dalai Lama approaches his 80th birthday in 2015, this year presents itself as an important moment to
document and explain the here and now of the Tibetan cause. The
dream of a free Tibet has evolved in recent times. Instead of independence,
Tibetans are pursuing political and cultural autonomy within China. It is a
very realistic step for them. One that, without a doubt, has many more
possibilities than the pursue of independence. But for now, the authorities of
the biggest country of the world remain silent. The
fourteen Dalai Lama, authentic leader of the Tibetan people and worldwide
recognized figure, has renounced to his political duties -now fulfilled
by a Prime Minister and a Tibetan Parliament in exile, installed in Dharamsala, India- to focus exclusively on
being a religious and spiritual leader. Our project: Thanks to our personal relationship with Thubten Wangchen-la  -who is Deputy of the Tibetan Parliament, an old friend of the Dalai Dama and his representative in part of Europe (Spain, Portugal, France, Germany)- we have guaranteed access to the places and the protagonist of the story we want to tell: Dalai Lama's Tibet: his memories and vision of Tibet after over half a century in exile.We will visit Tibet and Dharamsala (India) to chat with his holiness. Our photographic journey will interlace conversations with the spiritual leader, to share with the world an up close and personal vision of Tibet.Then we will produce a coffee table book, in English and Spanish, and we will donate 1000 copies to the Tibetan Government to create awareness and to help them with the means to generate some funds for the cause. We will also present an exhibition that will open in Barcelona (Spain) where Thubten Wangchen-la is the director of Casa del Tíbet. It is also our intention to bring the exhibition to New York in 2,016. 
Fundraising
campaign:
•
Phase 1 – Content production in Dharamsala
and Tibet: $10,000
• Phase
2 – Book production: $15,000
A4
format. 200 pages approx. #1,000 copies in English and Spanish to be donated to
the sponsoring charity.
• Phase
3 – Exhibition: $5000 per locationTotal $35,000
Who
are we?We are a team of two journalist friends who want to capture and share the essence of the Tibetan cause today, as the Dalai Lama enters his sunset years.
Eduardo Rubio is
a globetrotter journalist based in Barcelona, Spain, who has extensively
traveled the planet for decades, producing photo-reports published in Spanish
and European media, focusing on war and social issues. He has published the
following books: “Indira Ghandi” (1996), “Niños” / Kids (Lunwerg Editores, 2002), “Nosotros: el mundo hoy” / We: the world today (Lunwerg Editores, 2004), “Guatemala” (Lunwerg Editores, 2005), “Chagas: la enfermedad silenciosa” / Chagas: the silent disease (for Doctors Without Borders ), “Holy Places, Sacred Sites” 
(Times & Hudson, 2009), “Au
nom d´un dieu” / In the name of God (Editions du Rouergue, 2009). Eduardo has exhibited his
photographic work in Spain and Mexico. 
http://www.behance.net/eduardorubiophotohttp://eduardorubioclick.com 
Mónica
Gutiérrez is a
New York based journalist and creative director, currently in charge of the homepage content strategy of Univision, the leading media company in Hispanic
America, gateway to information and entertainment consumed by the vast majority
of Spanish language users in the USA. She writes for the Huffington Post and
other media outlets, mostly about human rights, sustainability, arts and
culture. 
www.linkedin.com/in/trixel/

_________________________ VERSION EN ESPAÑOL _________________________

ochenta años: razón de peso para documentar el aquí y ahora de la causa
tibetana, que hoy por hoy es diferente a
los años pasados. Los tibetanos han renunciado a la independencia y ahora
luchan por tener una autonomía política y cultural dentro de China. Es un paso
muy realista, aunque las autoridades del país más grande del
planeta no se pronuncian. Indudablemente la autonomía tiene mas posibilidades
que la independencia.
Por su parte el Dalai Lama
-autentico líder de los tibetanos y figura de relieve mundial- ha renunciado a
sus cargos políticos, que ahora ejercen un Primer Ministro y un Parlamento
Tibetano en el exilio, instalado en Dharamsala. El XIV Dalai Lama se enfoca
unicamente en ser líder y autoridad religiosa.

story:
"The experience in Selma... would have been probably intolerable except for the gatherings at the Jackson's home." 

- Rev. Joseph Lowery, Fmr. SCLC president 

====================================

By contributing to the Jackson home and cookbook campaign, you can be part of making history; of preserving a treasure and spreading the beautiful, delicious story of one family whose generous hearts, passion for justice , and fine and fabulous cooking fed the Selma heroes body and soul. 

=====================================

"I am so tired, and your house is the only place I could think of where I can be left alone, get some sleep, and be by myself to think."

 - Dr. King to Mrs. Richie Jean Sherrod Jackson

=====================================

Why is the Jackson home so important? 

In 1965 Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. set up an informal headquarters in Selma at the home of Dr. Sullivan Jackson, a dentist; Richie Jean Sherrod Jackson, an educator and his wife; and Jawana, their only child. The Jackson family, portrayed positively in the movie SELMA, provided a sanctuary from the hostility swirling around these leaders, making life bearable and even at times, filled with joy.  

  • The home was the residential HQ of the 1965 Selma movement. 
  • Dr. King heard President Johnson's "We shall overcome" speech at this home.
  • Leaders such as Rabbi Abraham Heschel, Nobel Laureate Ralph Bunche, James Bevel, Rev. C.T. Vivian, etc. stayed at the Jackson's home.
  • The stories from this home have not been systematically collected and shared.
  • The home requires care to be maintained as a private museum. 

Former SCLC president Rev. Joseph Lowery said: 

"The  experience in Selma during the voting rights campaign would have been much more stressful and probably intolerable except for the gathering in the Jacksons’ home. This home, so full of love and warmth, gave us perseverance, patience, and determination to continue the day-to-day efforts to finish the task. . . . Thank God for this loving, faithful family. Their significance to the effectiveness of the movement is a tale that’s never been told. They put their own safety at risk to serve the common good. —Reverend Joseph Lowery

What we need: $10,000 

Join us in preserving this powerful, essential story.

Today Jawana Jackson is converting her parents'  home into a museum and collecting stories for a cookbook co-authored with culinary historian Nancie McDermott, the author of ten cookbooks. This campaign is the start of a journey to help both dreams come to fruition.

  • $5,000 will purchase items needed for the museum and website. 
  • $5,000 will support a cookbook proposal (photographs, design, and initial research).
  • If we do not reach our goal, we use any funds raised towards the museum's infrastructure.  

With your help, we can create a living, lasting HOME for this powerful, essential American story!

Our approach:

1. We are a high-capacity, seasoned, volunteer team. Our first volunteers are people who personally know the Jackson family. Our second wave of recruits is coming from people who have learned the story and wish to support sharing it. Please consider volunteering if our cause inspires you!

2. Excellence. As noted by this U.S. Congressional tribute to Mrs. Jackson, she was strict! Our first creative project is a cookbook and it will be excellent. We are working with Nancie McDermott, the author of ten cookbooks and a contributing editor for Saveur and Edible Piedmont magazines. Her work has been published in Food & Wine, Fine Cooking, Bon Appetit, Everyday with Rachel Ray, and the Los Angeles Times. She is the president of the Culinary Historians of the Piedmont North Carolina (CHOP).

Our team:

We're excited to have a great team working with us to bring this story to life. Our team has a long successful history in business and social enterprise. 

Jawana V. Jackson, CEO

Jawana V. Jackson was born in Selma, Alabama the only child of Dr. Sullivan and Richie Jean Sherrod Jackson.  After completing her education in the Selma public school system, Ms. Jackson finished Fisk University in 1981 and earned a bachelor’s degree in Psychology and master’s work in Gerontology.

In 1985 Ms. Jackson began employment at The Martin Luther King, Jr. Center for Nonviolent Social Change in Atlanta, Georgia under the leadership of Mrs. Coretta Scott King where for 10 years she held numerous positions including Director of Visitor Services and Coordinator of several King Week activities.  In 1996, Ms. Jackson accepted a position in Government and Community Relations with The Metropolitan Atlanta Rapid Transit Authority, a position she held until 2007.  

Jawana V. Jackson lives in Atlanta, Georgia and shares her life and heart with Mr. James Richie.  She is also co-owner of Par Golf, LLC one of a few minority companies in the United States that produces golf apparel.  

James Richie, VP, Foundation

Born and raised in Atlanta, Georgia, he is a graduate of Morehouse College. He excelled during his 10-year career at Lockheed Aerospace, becoming one of the first African Americans to perform structural repairs on a major government aircraft. In 1976, Mr. Richie became manager of Real Estate for MARTA-Metropolitan Atlanta Rapid Transit Authority, managing real estate acquisitions in the building of Atlanta's new rail system- a position he held for over 30 years. In 2013 Mr. Richie founded Par Golf, LLC- one of the few African American owned companies to manufacture golf gloves in the United States.  

Mark A. Peterson, Executive secretary, Foundation

Founder and Managing Director of Ceyero, Mark Anthony Peterson, has more than 25 years of consulting and executive management experience.  Peterson spent six years as a strategy consultant with Accenture.  As CEO and President of PrideRock Holdings, Peterson helped build the biometrics from a garage start-up to a $20M screening company. He is the author of Guerrillapreneur and has created an incubator program to help small businesses in the Black Belt. He has two degrees from Dartmouth (BA.MBA) and is a 1987 graduate of Selma High School.

Allegra Jordan, volunteer

Allegra Jordan is an author and global innovation consultant. She led marketing at USAToday.com, handled crisis communications for the Enron investigation, and has taught innovation in 16 countries on five continents. Her articles, cases and book reviews have appeared in USA Today, TEDx, and in publications by Duke, Harvard and UT-Austin.  A graduate with honors of Harvard Business School, she has been named a top executive under 40 in Austin, Texas and Birmingham, Alabama. She is the author of the Amazon.com best-selling novels The End of Innocence (Sourcebooks 2014) and Harvard 1914 (Gold Gable Press, 2012). She is a former student of Mrs. Richie Jean S. Jackson and the 1987 debate team partner of Mr. Mark A. Peterson. She was the 1987 Selma High School valedictorian.

Christine S Weerts, volunteer

Christine S. Weerts has 15 years' experience in nonprofit fundraising and serves as special advisor to several ministries across Alabama and in New Orleans. A resident of Selma, she is author of Heros of Faith: Rosa Young, a profile on the founder of Lutheran black ministry in central Alabama, and is working on profiles of accomplished Lutheran African Americans in Alabama. BA, Butler University; MA, Concordia University Chicago.

Angela Hatcher, volunteer

Atlanta native Angela Hatcher holds a B.A in sociology and minor in philosophy from Howard University. She has worked in donor relations, content development, and policy research in environmental justice in Washington D.C. The granddaughter of a Selma native who served in the Selma Public Schools, her connection to Selma runs deep.

Nancie McDermott, Historian and author

Nancie McDermott is he author of ten cookbooks and a contributing editor for Saveur and Edible Piedmont magazines. Her work has been published in Food & Wine, Fine Cooking, Bon Appetit, Everyday with Rachel Ray, and the Los Angeles Times. She is the president of the Culinary Historians of the Piedmont North Carolina (CHOP).


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share our story with your friends!
  • Help identify grant opportunities.
  • Check out our website for volunteer opportunities. www.jacksonfoundationandmuseum.com
  • If you knew the Jackson family, please reach out to us with your stories.

Help us share the story of a quiet leadership through hospitality and friendship that led to a bright, better future for our world.

story:
What is Artonomy?

 

The goal of Artonomy is to provide a place for artists to showcase their work while we work to find people who are interested in purchasing from or hiring our artists. It is the goal of Artonomy to help connect our artists to people in need of creativity! Our customers can choose to purchase showcased work or choose an artist to complete a project they have in mind. Remember, this is all at no cost to our artists. Come join us as an artist or take a look around to see if any of our artists' work interests you! 

What We Need

 

Currently Artonomy is working with a basic website that is limiting to both the artist and the customer. It requires a rather convoluted process that can be frustrating to both parties. The need is for a web designer to be hired in order to drastically update the website to make it easier to use.

We have contacted a web designer with Crave Media, who has quoted us an estimate of approximately $7500, and this upgrade will greatly enhance the overall productivity and ease of use of the website, as well as allowing the addition of uploads of additional artistic endeavors..

 

The Impact

 

The primary impact with this upgrade will be a drastic increase in the ease of use for the website users and will allow the following:

  • grants artists more control of their submissions
  • greater variety of artistic mediums
  • smoother communication between client and artist  
  • inclusion of paypal
  • allows clients to purchase directly from artist

story:
Its pretty straight forward really. 
Glasgow City Council think the best use of the Buchanan St stairs is to spend £400 million to demolish this public space and replace it with more corporate space - space you have to pay to use and a space over which you have no say. 
We have a different idea. An idea that would cost about £500 to put into practice. Thats £399,999,500 cheaper than the council plans. The idea is to use the stairs in their current state as the natural amphitheatre, platform and stage that they are. 

With £500 we can buy some battery powered speakers, some stage lighting, smoke machines and a small handheld generator to power them. This will provide enough equipment to turn up and within 20 minutes put on a full on performance of any kind. Gigs, theatre, movie screenings even.

Any money on top of this could go towards using the large open space around the Donald Dewar statue as an open forum for an arts market, public art performances or whatever the people of Glasgow would wish to use it for.

Our aim is not to decide who should use the space or how they should use it. Our aim is to be able to facilitate nothing short of an artistic renaissance. An open collective with the equipment and means to facilitate any artistic use of this special public space. 

Why should yet another public realm be consumed by corporate space when the surrounding area is already littered with empty units. The people deserve a place to sit, to socialise, to be entertained, to perform and to display.

A public space therefore has to be defined by those who use it not those who seek to control and demolish it. We are not a protest group. We do not intend to have placards or banners. We simply intend to use the space to its full potential for as long as it continues to exist. It would truly be a travesty if one day the stairs and their natural stage, amphitheatre and viewing platform were gone and all we were left with is the passing thought that 'wouldn't it have been nice if we did something with them while they were there...'

Once the equipment is purchased, there will be a facebook group and email for any creative group, band, act or otherwise to contact and hire the equipment for free for any public event they wish to put on. The equipment will be based within the city centre all days and will provide a means for any group to use and add to a public space.

Watch a video about Public Space here

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j1F5hEwN1RE

4 Parcam RGB stage lighta - £154.99

LED Smoke machine - £33.14

Portable generator - £154.90
http://www.ebay.co.uk/itm/271709311098
story_txt:
Its pretty straight forward really. Glasgow City Council think the best use of the Buchanan St stairs is to spend £400 million to demolish this public space and replace it with more corporate space - space you have to pay to use and a space over which you have no say. We have a different idea. An idea that would cost about £500 to put into practice. Thats £399,999,500 cheaper than the council plans. The idea is to use the stairs in their current state as the natural amphitheatre, platform and stage that they are. With £500 we can buy some battery powered speakers, some stage lighting, smoke machines and a small handheld generator to power them. This will provide enough equipment to turn up and within 20 minutes put on a full on performance of any kind. Gigs, theatre, movie screenings even.Any money on top of this could go towards using the large open space around the Donald Dewar statue as an open forum for an arts market, public art performances or whatever the people of Glasgow would wish to use it for.Our aim is not to decide who should use the space or how they should use it. Our aim is to be able to facilitate nothing short of an artistic renaissance. An open collective with the equipment and means to facilitate any artistic use of this special public space. Why should yet another public realm be consumed by corporate space when the surrounding area is already littered with empty units. The people deserve a place to sit, to socialise, to be entertained, to perform and to display.A public space therefore has to be defined by those who use it not those who seek to control and demolish it. We are not a protest group. We do not intend to have placards or banners. We simply intend to use the space to its full potential for as long as it continues to exist. It would truly be a travesty if one day the stairs and their natural stage, amphitheatre and viewing platform were gone and all we were left with is the passing thought that 'wouldn't it have been nice if we did something with them while they were there...'Once the equipment is purchased, there will be a facebook group and email for any creative group, band, act or otherwise to contact and hire the equipment for free for any public event they wish to put on. The equipment will be based within the city centre all days and will provide a means for any group to use and add to a public space.Watch a video about Public Space here
