story:
Summary

Who we are

Black Cube Collective (BCC) is a Scottish-based Community Interest Company creating new and accessible opportunities for emerging artists in the UK and internationally. We run an Annual Show that provides an unprecedented opportunity for artists to show their work in an open, non-institutional large-scale and affordable public exhibition in Edinburgh. We also have been working on EU projects bringing together art and technology practitioners and pioneering multidisciplinary practices.

S.permaroutsi-Arcadia is an ongoing project that deals with sustainability and self-sufficient agriculture and is part of a wider reconstructive development in a rural area of Greece. The founder of S.permaroutsi, Dimitri Foundos explains:

“The economic crisis brought upon us the beast of unemployment.  We had to react in order to survive.  That is when the reactive movement S.permaroutsi was created, named after our village.  It was an incentive of Dimitris Foundos, with the support of Panagiota Dimitropoulou.”


Campaign and background
We will bring artists from outside of Greece committed to issues of environmentalism and sustainability to develop ideas around 'alternatives to austerity'. Their projects will aim to rebuild communities and promote relationships with Europe more positively, in addition to demonstrating how artists and the creative industries can have a constructive and active role in environmentally aware reconstructive and sustainable projects. 
Your help will not only provide genuine support to artists and their work but will also build cultural solidarity and make a real contribution to finding alternatives to living under austerity.

The collaboration was ignited when Dimitris came to a BCC exhibition in Athens and we immediately established mutual ambitions and passions. Dimitris wanted to work with international artists and BCC wanted to work with Greek sustainability initiatives so the collaboration happened quite naturally. 

The small village of Routsi in Arcadia was hit by devastating fires in 2007 and then again in 2012. Along with the impact of the economic crisis, many villagers lost their livelihoods due to the destruction of olive trees, walnut trees and other crops. The main aim of the S.permaroutsi project is to replant the landscape using methods of natural farming and forest gardening in order to help the community live sustainably.


In June this year and with little notice Athens decided to shut banks in a defensive move to prevent a bank run as the Greek government’s negotiations with its creditors collapsed in disarray. The people of Greece are painfully learning that without functioning banks, the daily lives of citizens and businesses come to a juddering halt. People are suddenly unable to pay rent or even to buy food. Capital controls that limit the free movement of money are measures of desperation and whether they work depends on how well the treatment suits the disease.


What we aim to achieve

So what is the alternative? Is there any alternative? We believe that there is and that artists can play a crucial role in finding one. Many artists offer alternative and critical ways of viewing the world, and as innovators, can explore and develop other positive possibilities to meekly accepting imposed austerity.

Now, more than ever, the people of Greece and in other communities around the world need to find ways of tackling financial instability, finding new means of support and make the most of their shared resources.

Artists in all countries are often undervalued as contributors to society, huge funding cuts in the cultural sector over the past few years clearly indicate this. This project will bring about a move towards sustainable living in a small village in Arcadia (Greece) and demonstrate how artists in particular can bring about solidarity with other communities and work for positive, proactive change in human society and the wider environment. As well as that, artists are significant contributors to the economy:

'A recent study found that the culture and creative industries (CCI) contributed with 4,2% of GDP of Europe in 2012. The majority of the total revenue is attributed to the visual arts, well above advertisement and TV.' 

(ICT ART CONNECT.study Brochure, iMinds, Artshare, Bozar, 2014)


What We Need & What You Get

Our Target Budget

We need your help to raise funds for the next phase of the project, which will take the form of a 4-day event in October. The target budget includes travel expenses for 6 artists, food, accommodation and travel expenses in Routsi, tools and art materials. We aim to cover international artists’ expenses so that all they will focus on is the art!

The target budget also includes financial support to help sustain the collaboration with our Greek partners and the transition into the next and future stages of the project. That way, we can ensure a sustainable project with an impactful legacy!

The target budget comprises:

  • 6 artists’ flights (approx. £1500)

  • 6 artists’ accommodation and food in Routsi (approx. £1300) - this directly supports the Routsi community

  • Tools & materials to make the artworks (approx. £700)

  • Collaboration fund (approx. £1000) - this money supports any joint ventures of BCC & S.permaroutsi

  • Project Sustainability (approx. £1000) - this will go directly towards future activities within the framework of this project

  • Direct costs (approx. £2000) - this money supports the direct expenses of organising and running the event in October, we work primarily on a volunteer basis but we do require some financial support in order to be able to continue working on such projects!

  • Campaign costs - £900

Our Perks

We have a variety of limited edition art prints to offer, both digital and hand-made, in return for your donation. Get your hands on this Greek mythology-inspired limited edition linocut print by Black Cube Collective Director and artist Svetlana Kondakova or this etching called 'Ground' by Black Cube Collective lead curator Ronald Binnie, if you donate £40. 

                  

The postcards and digital prints will portray the artworks produced at the event and will be a great reminder of what your donations has helped us to achieve. 

Those of you generous enough to donate £500, will be able to join us at the event for 4 days in Routsi (28th Oct.-1st Nov.) including an Athens transfer, 3 homemade Greek meals a day, accommodation at the traditional Greek village house and nightly entertainment of traditional Greek music! You can join us at the workshops and learn about natural farming or simply enjoy the Greek countryside.


The Impact

Project Aims

  • Educating Greek people on natural farming and permaculture methods, bringing them out of cities and providing them with the knowledge and skills to live more sustainably and at harmony with nature

  • Providing artists with the opportunity, inspiration and experience to create genuine environmental art (see Artists’ Brief), leading to a higher appreciation of artists’ role in society

  • Helping the people of Routsi by re-planting the lost trees and vegetation, helping to restore the wildlife and repopulate the semi-deserted village

  • Sharing our story of success with others, paving the way towards sustainable living in small rural communities across Europe


Things to consider:

  • We are not connected with any government nor do we have any party political affiliations

  • We are not a government funded organisation

  • We do not take a salary. We work on a consultation basis, allowing us to maximise BCC's income and our time, calling in people to work on projects as and when needed. We feel it is important artists and other individuals are remunerated for their time in some fashion, and obviously we do need financial support to help support the workload that is required to achieve our aims.

  • The money will launch and consolidate the ‘Artists in Residence’ program

  • It will also help sustain the collaboration with our Greek partners

  • By bringing artists and visitors to Greece we will be helping the Greek economy, moreover the artists’ accommodation and food expenses go directly to the Routsi community

  • This is the first phase of a long-term collaboration and supportive plan of action and with your help we will establish a long-lasting project which will facilitate and support the artist/environment relationship and sustainable living in Greece



Risks & Challenges

The main challenge in our initiative is to raise sufficient funds in order to achieve our aims. We are confident that, with your help, we will reach our target. If however, we do not, we will look for other methods of fundraising and in the worst case scenario postpone or scale down our event. No matter what happens however, we are fully committed to this venture and will persevere to make it happen!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in a position to donate, we understand. If like us, you believe that artists can bring about positive change in communities and the environment and can contribute to sustainable living, you can help in other ways:

  • Spread the word about our project and campaign
  • Encourage other like-minded people to donate
  • Share this campaign on facebook, twitter, your blog or any other social media that you use
Thank you for your support!

story:
Led by Annika Buxman & Barb Skoog

www.sustainandheal.com & www.barbskoog.com

update: marbling workshop rescheduled for December 11-21, 2015 if current events allow

October 9-19, 2015  cancelled due to political unrest and security alerts throughout the country

We invite you to help fair-trade artisans in Bangladesh develop new marbling techniques by supporting a skill enhancement workshop. Artisans from several rural co-ops across the country will gather together for a three-day intensive training with Annika and Barb. This will allow the artisans to expand their product offerings and provide living wage opportunities for more women in their villages.

 Barb Skoog and Annika Buxman met through a mutually shared inspiration by art materials ~ the organic way of water and pigment flowing together in the art of marbling. Three years later, we are excited about collaborating together on a teaching trip that will combine Annika's Sustain & Heal connection with fair trade artisans in rural Bangladesh and Barb's expertise in practicing and teaching Ebru Marbling.

Please watch our video and consider donating to the advancement of women in Bangladesh who have very few income opportunities to support their families. If you are unable to financially support please consider promoting this project on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and other social media connections. We so appreciate your advancement of this global meeting of artists.

Funds donated beyond our goal will go toward employing more artisans and marketing their work.

story:
Although this campaign has ended you can visit

Guardian Mural for Beautify Earth

visit beautifyearth.org/donate and support the nearly completed project. Make sure you tag the donation for the Guardian,Red Cross mural.


'Guardian'
A mural for the Santa Monica Red Cross

Francisco Letelier with Beautify Earth

My name is Francisco Letelier. For more than three decades I have been making murals and public art that express the dreams and histories of communities and individuals.
Beautify Earth is a non-profit 501(c)3 organization that offers love to neglected communities through the installation of public murals. They are working in communities across the United States, putting an end to blighted walls and fixtures by empowering artists, encouraging social responsibility, and instilling community pride in impoverished or neglected communities and streets. 
I am working with Beautify Earth to create a mural for the Santa Monica Red Cross. We share the conviction that acts of imagination can lead to profound change.  As part of the greater efforts of Beautify Earth, the mural will add to the momentum already started on Broadway Avenue, creating a cluster of murals situated near each other for a gallery effect. 


The Santa Monica Red Cross is one of the oldest civic organizations in the city, founded in 1918 by the historic Santa Monica Bay Women's Club. A largely volunteer organization, the efforts of the Santa Monica Red Cross chapter have left a tremendous impact on the lives of thousands across generations. The chapter serves more than 90,000 people over 16 square miles. Nonetheless, many remain uninformed about the work they accomplish. Despite the organization's enduring commitment to its surrounding communities many overlook its heroic dimensions and take for granted the importance of its tasks. For every crisis, every fire, every earthquake within its district, the Red Cross shows up for those who are in need.

I am asking my extended community to help create a place of imagination and memory through a public art work. I invite you to join me in giving a sense of place and belonging to an organization that has responded to human need for close to a century.Through its staff and volunteers the Santa Monica Red Cross consistently acknowledges the power of cooperation and helps reveal the inherent strength of our communities.Together, lets create a public monument that celebrates that spirit for their upcoming centennial.

The Guardian Mural


I will create a mural along the south facade of the Santa Monica Red Cross chapter building as well as another public art work created with volunteers located on the retaining walls surrounding the front entrance parking lot. After conversations with Santa Monica Red Cross Director, Julie Thomas and Resident Historian, Anna Lisa Debois, I began the design phase of the project. Beautify Earth is committed to providing materials and scaffolding or lifts for the project. What we need now is direct financial support so that I can undertake the task of creating the mural.

I am seeking funding of $5,500.00 to keep me on the wall until the project is completed.

We estimate that the project will take 2 months to complete.

Your donation will go directly towards my expenses while I am at work. This will allow me to focus on the project without distractions.  By supporting this campaign, you help create a 'win' for all involved.  The Santa Monica Red Cross receives recognition through a mural, I receive the support required to give my art and efforts, Beautify Earth creates more murals, and you become a part of something that truly matters to many people.

 Donations are tax deductible through Beautify Earth, a 501(c)3 non profit organization.

All donations make a difference, 

I plan to complete this project whether I reach my goal or not.


Impact

Your contribution benefits everyone in the community and will continue to have an impact long into the future. This project draws attention to a small organization with a historical legacy that has helped shape the community of Santa Monica. Projects like this help maintain a sense of continuity within communities; an important social resource that can be lost or threatened when a place undergoes the growth and infrastructure change that is occurring in Santa Monica.

As part of the greater efforts of Beautify Earth, the mural will create increased momentum for the organization's ongoing goals of painting the world in color 'until no unkempt wall remains.' 

Your contribution fuels volunteers, mentorships, and partnerships between private and public sectors of the community. Murals have an extraordinary ability to sustain and help create community. Part of the project will call for the direct participation of community members and others creating opportunities for community education. When people have the opportunity to work together to improve and 'beautify' their physical environment, they often create long lasting relationships and understandings. To participate in the creation of a public artwork is a powerful experience. The relationships that are born in the process create new lines of communication as people discover a previously unfelt sense of ownership and pride that transforms 'the public' into protagonists and stewards of memory and imagination.

As you may know, I have facilitated this kind of art making many times, integrating diverse communities into dialogues through the arts. As we experience new sensibilities brought about through the internet, social media and cell phones it may be easy to presume that community art and collective participation has transformed, that maybe the experience itself has changed. We live in a world where change is constant but the truth remains that the experience of making public art with others, the act of working together to create something that affects public space is one of the most powerful experiences many participants will ever have. It remains undiminished. This kind of collective experience was powerful when Stonehenge was created as well as when barns were raised by neighbors working together in farming communities. The collective imagination is kindled when nimble hands come together together to create a quilt, and when giving hearts come together and volunteer to aid victims of fire and earthquakes.

The Guardian Mural project will harness this energy and create renewed lines of support and imagination for the Santa Monica Red Cross. Please consider joining us in this imaginative undertaking.

No public art project is without risks or challenges. This project creates new partnerships between organizations and individuals and requires a fair amount of teamwork and planning for its completion. We are also facing  a wet winter, we want the project established before El Nino settles in!

No matter what challenges encountered, with your help, I'll work with the staff of the Red Cross and the coordinators of Beautify Earth to create a work that years from now you'll want to say with pride and certainty, “I helped that happen.”

Other ways to Help

There are also other things you can do to help get the mural created. If you can't contribute economically please help us get the word out by forwarding and sharing this information, put it on your Facebook page and help me to keep painting both in my community and anywhere else I can for things that matter.  Anything you say to others about the campaign is highly appreciated. 

After our campaign ends  you can continue to support the Guardian Mural as we seek matching funds. We will offer the same rewards to contributors, please visit the link below:

Guardian Mural for Beautify Earth
story_txt:
Although this campaign has ended you can visit
Guardian Mural for Beautify Earth
visit beautifyearth.org/donate and support the nearly completed project. Make sure you tag the donation for the Guardian,Red Cross mural.'Guardian'

A mural for the Santa Monica Red Cross
Francisco Letelier with Beautify Earth
My
name is Francisco Letelier. For more than three decades I have been making murals and
public art that express the dreams and histories of communities and
individuals.
Beautify Earth is a non-profit 501(c)3 organization that offers love to neglected communities through the installation of public murals.  They are working in communities across the United States, putting an end to blighted walls and fixtures by empowering artists, encouraging social responsibility, and instilling community pride in impoverished or neglected communities and streets. I am working with Beautify Earth to create a mural for the Santa Monica Red Cross. We share the conviction that acts of imagination can lead to profound change.  As part of the greater efforts of Beautify Earth, the mural will add to the momentum already started on Broadway Avenue, creating a cluster of murals situated near each other for a gallery effect. 



The
Santa Monica Red Cross is one of the oldest civic organizations in
the city, founded in 1918 by the historic Santa Monica Bay Women's
Club. A largely volunteer organization, the efforts of the Santa Monica Red Cross chapter have left a
tremendous impact on the lives of thousands across generations. The
chapter serves more than 90,000
people over 16 square miles. Nonetheless,
many remain uninformed about the work they accomplish. Despite the
organization's enduring commitment to its surrounding communities many overlook its heroic dimensions and take for
granted the importance of its tasks. For every crisis, every fire,
every earthquake within its district, the Red Cross shows up for
those who are in need.



I
am asking my extended community to help create a place of imagination
and memory through a  public art work. I invite you to join me in
giving a sense of place and belonging to an organization that has
responded to human need for close to a century.Through
its staff and volunteers the Santa Monica Red Cross consistently
acknowledges the power of cooperation and helps reveal the inherent
strength of our communities.Together, lets create a public monument that celebrates that spirit for their
upcoming centennial.




The Guardian Mural

I
will create a mural along the south facade of the Santa Monica Red
Cross chapter building as well as another public art work created with
volunteers located on the retaining walls surrounding the front entrance parking lot.  After
conversations with Santa Monica Red Cross Director, Julie Thomas and Resident Historian, Anna Lisa Debois, I began the design phase of the project. Beautify
Earth is committed to providing materials and scaffolding or lifts
for the project. What we need now is direct financial support so that I can undertake the task of creating the mural.



I
am seeking funding of $5,500.00 to keep me on the wall until the
project is completed.

We
estimate that the project will take 2 months to complete.




Your donation will go directly towards my expenses while I am at work. This will allow me to focus on the project without distractions.  By supporting this campaign, you help create a 'win' for all involved.  The Santa Monica Red Cross receives recognition through a mural, I receive the support required to give my art and efforts, Beautify Earth creates more murals, and you become a part of something that truly matters to many people.
 Donations are tax deductible through Beautify Earth, a 501(c)3 non profit organization.


All
donations make a difference, 
I plan to complete this project whether
I reach my goal or not.

Impact

Your
contribution benefits everyone in the community and will continue to
have an impact long into the future. This project  draws attention to
a small organization with a historical legacy that has helped shape
the community of Santa Monica. Projects like this help maintain a
sense of continuity within communities; an important social resource
that can be lost or threatened when a place undergoes the growth and
infrastructure change that is occurring in Santa Monica.

between private and public sectors of the community.  Murals have an
extraordinary ability to sustain and help create community. Part of
the project will call for the direct participation of community
members and others creating opportunities for community education. When people have the opportunity to work together
to improve and 'beautify' their physical environment, they often
create long lasting relationships and understandings. To participate in the creation of a public artwork is a powerful experience. The relationships that are
born in the process create new lines of communication as people discover a previously unfelt sense of
ownership  and pride  that transforms 'the public' into protagonists
and stewards of memory and imagination.

participation has transformed, that maybe the experience itself has
changed. We live in a world where change is constant but the truth remains that the experience of making
public art with others, the act of working together to create something that affects public space is one of the most powerful experiences many participants
will ever have. It remains undiminished. This kind of collective experience was powerful when
Stonehenge was created as well as when barns were raised by neighbors working together in
farming communities. The collective imagination is kindled when nimble hands come together together to
create a quilt,  and when giving hearts come together and volunteer

joining us in this imaginative undertaking.

story:
HOLA!
We are two short female filmmakers, short in height and short on money. We need your help to raise some money for a video art installation we are doing this January in London. We've received some funds through a grant from Oberlin and we'd like to match it here! We've got enough to get there and feed ourselves but that's about it. Help us make some amazing art!    
                        (scroll down to know who are we, Manpriya -left, Christy-right)                                                                                
https://www.facebook.com/meditationonmedia/

Meditation on Media

It is an interactive video art installation that will take place in a public space in London this January. The installation is inspired from Mikhail Bakhtin's idea of Carnival Laughter. Through the lens of laughter, it will challenge and ask participants to consider the political and social power of media. 
LAUGHTER
A form of meditation, a form of universal communication, a form of expression and rebellion. According to Bakhtin, laughter was once used as a political tool in Carnivals during the Renaissance. The common crowd could not talk against the hierarchy it was in but could laugh at the mockery of the kings in these carnivals. This laughter rooted a deep sense of discomfort towards the hierarchy, which in turn brought people together to overthrow the rulers and bring forth revolutions. 
Contrary to that, political humor is losing its standpoint today. We are being served with a superficial sense of freedom and liberty. So out of this freedom, we talk and discuss about the unjust bureaucracy, the political unrest around us. But we are complacent collectively as a society. We laugh at anything and everything. If we were to only use laughter wisely, we could potentially bring forth a change.
MEDIA
While laughter in media could be an effective tool to bring forth change, it is being infiltrated and controlled to persuade us in thinking a certain way. We have grown complacent by simply absorbing media rather than challenging, responding, or experimenting with its power to create action and bring people together. The scrutinized media we consume every day has reduced our ability to think clearly about social, political and cultural issues.
WHAT WILL THE INSTALLATION HAVE?
Throughout January we will collect footage and audio recordings related to social media, internet activism and popular culture in and around London. We will conduct interviews with new media artists and activists focusing specifically on laughter and satire in their work. Based on our research we will construct four interlinked narratives on the following questions; When did man first laugh? What is he laughing at? How and why did he begin to laugh, and What is laughter in media doing now? These interlinked narratives will be projected on four different screens and sequences from each will be played through holograms. Several pressure sensitive switches will be placed along the floor and as participants walk over them changes in texture, mapping, and sound design will occur. A web camera will also be used to insert participants in a split screen with one of the narratives. The participants' physical presence in the space will impact the way the media is experienced by all participants viewing the installation. Through interactivity in a social event we hope participants will sense and react to their agency over this experience with media and reflect and think about their engagement with media and the ways in which laughter in media could bring about more effective social and political change. 

WHAT WE HAVE FUNDS FOR ALREADY 

Housing, Transportation, Food

WHAT WE NEED FUNDS FOR! 

To Research 

To ShootTo Design Holograms  

To Design Interactive Sensors  

To Have a Quadraphonic Speaker Array  

To Rent Projectors and Sound Gear

To Pay and Feed the Actors

To Do Post Production

To Hire a Place for the Installation

 

(because a crowdfunding campaign isn't complete without a graph)


Below is a video of stock footage aimed at drawing attention to some of the absurdities we experience in media today. 

Here is a test example of some of the holograms we built out of fiber glass for the installation.

THE TWO SHORT FILMMAKERS 

  

Christiana Rose(left) - 150cms - is someone with varied interests and many talents. At Oberlin, Ohio where she is studying now, she can be seen climbing ropes at one time, composing music at the other and sometimes she is seen carrying camera gear around making films. To be more precise her creative interests lie in the intersections between sound, video and acrobatic movement. 

Christiana has studied composition under Aurie Hsu, Lyn Goeringer and Tom Lopez. Her work was represented at the Threshold Music Festival and the Trinity Film Festival. She recently presented her original interactive instruments in her recital, append, a collaborative exploration about humans and technology through dance, circus and interactive sound.

Manpriya Makhni (right) - 147cms - has immense love for cinema. She can be seen doing all varied kinds of things on film sets most of the times. From being a director to being a cinematographer. From running generators on set to being a producer. She has written, directed and edited four short films and worked on 15 short films and commercials as a director of photography.

Manpriya studied film and specialised in cinematography at the Prague Film School last year. She started worked on productions for CNN-IBN and BBC Four while she was in university. Her films have been screened at several international film festivals this year. For a brief period of time, she was running a production company in Delhi. She continues to work as a creative producer for some forthcoming films. She was recently giving trials at Fabrica, the communications research centre in Treviso.

To check out our works. 

www.manpriyamakhni.com 

http://christianarose.wix.com/christianarose

www.vimeo.com/manpriyamakhni

https://vimeo.com/christianarose
Follow the campaign on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/meditationonmedia/

Manpriya studied film and specialised in cinematography at the Prague Film School last year. www.manpriyamakhni.com 
http://christianarose.wix.com/christianarose

www.vimeo.com/manpriyamakhni



https://vimeo.com/christianarose

Follow the campaign on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/meditationonmedia/

story:
The In My Flow (IMF) Startup Campaign:

"A really great talent finds its happiness in execution," Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe

My name is Vickie Brent-Touray and literary and performance arts are my super powers! Read on to find out more about my personal crusade to help the youth in our communities to find their own super powers: 

Who is Vickie Brent-Touray and Why Does She Care?

I am a certified 7-12 Language Arts/ English educator, with more than 20 years of teaching experience. I've taught both in Michigan and in Georgia, and was an Atlanta Public Schools Teacher of the Year (2013-2014 school year). I am both founder and organizer of  Yaktown Poets and The Yaktown Poets Revue. In existence since the fall of 2014, Yaktown Poets hosts The Yaktown Poets Revue once a season and touts itself as "The ultimate spoken word "experience" for the grown and sexy, fabulous and fly!" The Labor Day Edition of the Yaktown Poets Revue served approximately 150 patrons for a night of "grown folk" spoken word entertainment.  We've garnered more than 275 Facebook followers, in our first year together. I'm the owner of a small publishing company, and have published 3 books over the past couple years, including my own collection of poetry entitled "A Peace of My Mind." I've always had an affinity for writing, spoken word and performance arts, so you can imagine how truly heartbroken I am that so much art education has been, all but deleted from most public school curriculum. My high school and undergraduate drama club, choir and debate team were my saving graces as a youth. My involvement with these entities, without a doubt, gave me the skill, self confidence and courage needed to accomplish many of  the goals that I've set for my life. 

I couldn't begin to name or count the number of extremely talented, passionate students and youth that I've come across in my profession and personal life. They oftentimes have amazing, untapped, natural talent but absolutely NO WHERE to revel in, nurture or express it. For many students, the lack of opportunity to utilize and showcase these natural gifts and talents can lead to boredom, depression, violence and other negative "acting out" behaviors. I've also witnessed the faces of youth light up like Christmas trees, when they realize that they have a natural affinity to something like speaking, movement, painting or performing poetry. I've seen in the eyes of those students a satisfaction that can in no way be compared to another. It's a wondrous phenomenon. Over the years however, I've watched students come and go, different curriculum come and go, as well as administrators and initiatives. As steadily as these changes have come, so have the elimination of the arts from most public school classrooms. At one time, a public school student might have been able to "pick up" an arts and crafts or ballet class at the community center, if the courses weren't offered in school.  Nowadays, most inner-city community centers have experienced as much "arts" budget cuts as the public school systems--in some cases, they've experienced more.  As the youth say "the struggle is real." I believe that IMF can be a viable resource in assisting talented youth by creating and environment for them to   nurture, perfect and ultimately "unleash" their natural talents in the area of spoken word  and other performance arts. I want to assist these youth in the"artistic evolution" of their lifetime. My desire is to help them to "flow" in the areas of artistic expression where they are naturally inclined.


What This Has to Do With YOU:

By getting involved with the IMF Startup Campaign, you are making a conscious effort to help young people flourish in their "natural" gift and talents. Your assistance will afford these young people some opportunities that may have been "a given" with earlier generations, but are no longer easily accessible. Through classes, workshops, field trips, community partnerships and  performances, IMF participants will gain the opportunity explore, to hone, perfect and ultimately share their natural gifts and talents with the communities that produced them and others. Its the perfect feedback loop!

What We Need and What YOU Get:

As you know, we have a goal of $5000 . We want to complete this startup goal in the next 60 days. This $5000 will be used for the following:

$ 2,300 to be used for licensing, incorporation fees, consultant fees

$2000  to be used for branding: logo, patents, stationary, tshirts, promotional items, sponsorship gifts.

$700 to be used for web design, web hosting and website maintenance and          hosting for a year.

Our Gift to YOU!

While many of you would be satisfied with simply writing a big FAT check for no more than a verbal "thank you", most of us (including myself!) wouldn't mind a small "trinket" as a gesture of appreciation for your gift, and we've got you covered. Depending on the level of your gift, IMF would show our appreciation in the following ways:

Platinum Level Sponsor ($500+):  Your company name and/or logo on the IMF Promotional video (credits section); Your  company  name and/or logo on the IMF Website (sponsor section); Your company name and/or logo on the first IMF T-shirts design; Your company name and/or logo in the first IMF Performance program booklet; one IMF T shirt; two tickets to the first IMF public performance; "Thank you" communication from an IMF member.

Yellow Gold Level Sponsor($250+): Your company name or logo on the first IMF T-shirt design; Your company name or logo in the first IMF Performance program booklet;  one IMF T shirt; two tickets to the first IMF public performance; "Thank you" communication from an IMF member.

White Gold Level Sponsor ($125+):  Your company name or logo in the first IMF Performance program booklet. One IMF promotional item. Two tickets to the first IMF public performance;"Thank you" communication from an IMF member.

Bronze Level Sponsor ($50+): One IMF promotional item; Two tickets to the first IMF public performance; " Thank You" communication from an IMF member.

Silver Level Sponsor ($25+): Two tickets to the first IMF public performance; " Thank You" communication from a IMF member.

I sincerely believe that there are many people, JUST LIKE YOU and I, who long to see youth excell in their natural given talent, so I believe that we will reach this $3000 goal, in the time we have set out to meet it. If we encounter hiccups however, and fall short of the projected goal in the time allotted, then we will continue to raise the funds, until we have the full $3000 to get started, 
The IMPACT:
As I have explained before, my profession has afforded me the opportunity to participate in the day-to-day development of many youth.  I've seen enough as an educator of 20 years, to write a book on that subject alone.  Nothing I've seen however, is more PURE than the satisfaction that I have witnessed in the eyes of a youth who has finally "discovered" a natural talent or ability. Whether that discovery came as a result of a writing assignment, a video project or if the student had just delivered the best 5 minute monologue our class had ever heard, it didn't matter. Something very powerful takes place when a person "stumbles upon" that one particular thing that they are good, and in some cases, GREAT at doing! The discovery alone can bring a satisfaction that can be seen in widened eyes, shoulders that are suddenly squared or a gait that has transformed into a long confident stride. The liberation is thrilling for the youth and the onlooker. IMF gives us the opportunity to take an active part in this "artistic evolution" of such youth.
Risks and Challenges:

We all know that there are risks involved with opening a non-profit.  The biggest risk being that funding may not always remain available for the maintenance of the organization. What IMF proposes is NEEDED in our community in a really BIG way. Cuts to the arts in public schools and community organizations is now the norm. Because of the GREAT need for art appreciation and expression, I am confident that IMF will become a partner in the community and in return,  individuals, businesses and organizations will embrace and support  it. In addition to teaching, I've also served as founder and/or project manager for many organizations and churches as well as Yaktown Poets.  I've honed my skills as a project manager in schools, churches, community organizations and abroad. My earlier work with the Pontiac Area Urban League, Impact  (an arm of Campus Crusade for Christ), The Pontiac Gospel Fest, etc lend themselves as examples of  my personal skills, talents and abilities to spearhead and maintain projects. The IMF Youth Arts Project is my next target, and I'm up to the challenge.  I do hope that you will join us in this "evolution." 

Other Ways YOU Can Help:

We ARE human, so we do understand that everyone isn't in the position to give financially. However, there ARE ways that you too can help with the IMF Startup Campaign

  • Share our posts on YOUR social media pages! (Please use the Indiegogo share tools , if at all possible).
  • Get the word out to other art lovers like yourself! Email, text, phone call, snail mail! Share our project with them. They too may be interested in joining the evolution!
  • Make us aware of youth who might benefit from the IMF Youth Arts Project!

I've also witnessed the faces of youth light up like Christmas trees, when they realize that they have a natural affinity to something like speaking, movement, painting or performing poetry. I've seen in the eyes of those students a satisfaction that can in no way be compared to another. It's a wondrous phenomenon. Over the years however, I've watched students come and go, different curriculum come and go, as well as administrators and initiatives. As steadily as these changes have come, so have the elimination of the arts from most public school classrooms. At one time, a public school student might have been able to "pick up" an arts and crafts or ballet class at the community center, if the courses weren't offered in school.  Nowadays, most inner-city community centers have experienced as much "arts" budget cuts as the public school systems--in some cases, they've experienced more.  As the youth say "the struggle is real." I believe that IMF can be a viable resource in assisting talented youth by creating and environment for them to   nurture, perfect and ultimately "unleash" their natural talents in the area of spoken word  and other performance arts. I want to assist these youth in the"artistic evolution" of their lifetime. My desire is to help them to "flow" in the areas of artistic expression where they are naturally inclined.

What This Has to Do With YOU:
By getting involved with the IMF Startup Campaign, you are making a conscious effort to help young people flourish in their "natural" gift and talents. Your assistance will afford these young people some opportunities that may have been "a given" with earlier generations, but are no longer easily accessible. Through classes, workshops, field trips, community partnerships and  performances, IMF participants will gain the opportunity explore, to hone, perfect and ultimately share their natural gifts and talents with the communities that produced them and others. Its the perfect feedback loop!
What We Need and What YOU Get:
 As you know, we have a goal of $5000 . We want to complete this startup goal in the next 60 days. This $5000 will be used for the following:
$ 2,300 to be used for licensing, incorporation fees, consultant fees
$2000  to be used for branding: logo, patents, stationary, tshirts, promotional items, sponsorship gifts.
$700 to be used for web design, web hosting and website maintenance and          hosting for a year.
Our Gift to YOU!
While many of you would be satisfied with simply writing a big FAT check for no more than a verbal "thank you", most of us (including myself!) wouldn't mind a small "trinket" as a gesture of appreciation for your gift, and we've got you covered. Depending on the level of your gift, IMF would show our appreciation in the following ways:
Platinum Level Sponsor ($500+):  Your company name and/or logo on the IMF Promotional video (credits section); Your  company  name and/or logo on the IMF Website (sponsor section); Your company name and/or logo on the first IMF T-shirts design; Your company name and/or logo in the first IMF Performance program booklet; one IMF T shirt; two tickets to the first IMF public performance; "Thank you" communication from an IMF member.
Yellow Gold Level Sponsor($250+): Your company name or logo on the first IMF T-shirt design; Your company name or logo in the first IMF Performance program booklet;  one IMF T shirt; two tickets to the first IMF public performance; "Thank you" communication from an IMF member.
White Gold Level Sponsor ($125+):  Your company name or logo in the first IMF Performance program booklet. One IMF promotional item. Two tickets to the first IMF public performance;"Thank you" communication from an IMF member.
Bronze Level Sponsor ($50+): One IMF promotional item; Two tickets to the first IMF public performance; " Thank You" communication from an IMF member.
Silver Level Sponsor ($25+): Two tickets to the first IMF public performance; " Thank You" communication from a IMF member.
I sincerely believe that there are many people, JUST LIKE YOU and I, who long to see youth excell in their natural given talent, so I believe that we will reach this $3000 goal, in the time we have set out to meet it. If we encounter hiccups however, and fall short of the projected goal in the time allotted, then we will continue to raise the funds, until we have the full $3000 to get started, 

The IMPACT:
As I have explained before, my profession has afforded me the opportunity to participate in the day-to-day development of many youth.  I've seen enough as an educator of 20 years, to write a book on that subject alone.  Nothing I've seen however, is more PURE than the satisfaction that I have witnessed in the eyes of a youth who has finally "discovered" a natural talent or ability. Whether that discovery came as a result of a writing assignment, a video project or if the student had just delivered the best 5 minute monologue our class had ever heard, it didn't matter. Something very powerful takes place when a person "stumbles upon" that one particular thing that they are good, and in some cases, GREAT at doing! The discovery alone can bring a satisfaction that can be seen in widened eyes, shoulders that are suddenly squared or a gait that has transformed into a long confident stride. The liberation is thrilling for the youth and the onlooker. IMF gives us the opportunity to take an active part in this "artistic evolution" of such youth.
Risks and Challenges: We all know that there are risks involved with opening a non-profit.  The biggest risk being that funding may not always remain available for the maintenance of the organization. What IMF proposes is NEEDED in our community in a really BIG way. Cuts to the arts in public schools and community organizations is now the norm. Because of the GREAT need for art appreciation and expression, I am confident that IMF will become a partner in the community and in return,  individuals, businesses and organizations will embrace and support  it. In addition to teaching, I've also served as founder and/or project manager for many organizations and churches as well as Yaktown Poets.  I've honed my skills as a project manager in schools, churches, community organizations and abroad. My earlier work with the Pontiac Area Urban League, Impact  (an arm of Campus Crusade for Christ), The Pontiac Gospel Fest, etc lend themselves as examples of  my personal skills, talents and abilities to spearhead and maintain projects. The IMF Youth Arts Project is my next target, and I'm up to the challenge.  I do hope that you will join us in this "evolution." 
Other Ways YOU Can Help:
 We ARE human, so we do understand that everyone isn't in the position to give financially. However, there ARE ways that you too can help with the IMF Startup Campaign  Share our posts on YOUR social media pages! (Please use the Indiegogo share tools , if at all possible). Get the word out to other art lovers like yourself! Email, text, phone call, snail mail! Share our project with them. They too may be interested in joining the evolution!
Make us aware of youth who might benefit from the IMF Youth Arts Project!

story:
First Things First- WHY should you want to "Follow Your Art"?

It's fun! It can be like the message tied to a balloon. Who will find it? What will they think of it? Could fate play a part? There are all kinds of "games" we can come up with. The ideas don't end with us.

Also, consider that one of the greatest things to come about with the existence of social media is the knowledge that most likely, you will never fully lose someone.  That awesome teacher you had in 2nd grade? You just might be able to find her.  Your best friend that moved away in the middle of high school? You can just look them up and keep in contact. As artists, we spend a lot of time and effort on each piece we work on, sometimes existing on a violent roller coaster of emotions. Sometimes it's a relief to let it go. But often nostalgia creeps up on us and we wonder who might be enjoying that tricky still-life we sold years ago.  We want this site to exist so that most likely, you will never fully lose your art. 

This website can be used as casually or as comprehensively as you desire. 

And like most social media, it will be free to sign up! 

More and more information is being transmitted in real-time.  There is no reason art should be left behind.


Artstalker Project- The Business

Artstalker Project is a brand new small home business, whose mission statement states: We are committed to discovering new ways to share and follow art while supporting the art community. Currently, our sole focus is the Artstalker Project website. Future plans include moving into an office, hiring employees, and continuing to meet the needs of the Artstalker Project community. Although Artstalker Project seeks to be a successful small business, at its heart it is all about the art.


Artstalker Project- The Website


In order for Artstalker Project to be anything to anyone, we need to get the website up and functional. The website will be necessary to generate the unique tracking numbers for personal artwork and to connect to other members. And that's just the beginning. We've brainstormed many future possibilities for the website, but right now we are focusing our efforts on the first steps.

For artists, there will be a custom gallery function, enabling you to showcase all your original artwork in one place. Plus, the tracking feature will naturally build your very own provenance, something usually reserved for famous works of art. 

For the art lover, there will be the option to follow your favorite artists, and learn more information about your newest art purchases. 

For everyone, the website will be a place to keep us all connected with a shared passion. 


Artstalker Project- The Community

In our mind's eye, the Artstalker Project community is made up of everyone in the world, whether they know it or not. For now, we have our team and our family and friends who support us at all times. And then there is you. Consider this an open invitation to join us. We have no doubt that there are like-minded Artstalkers who need to be reached, we just need help to find them.


Artstalker Project- The Team

     Ty Pierce

At the head of our table is business owner and team leader, Ty Pierce. His iron plated work ethic and his skill with the paintbrush are merely two of a million reasons we choose to follow him. He has a proven track record of getting the job done and getting it done beautifully. His educational background is in fine art, his work experience is in multimedia development, and in his chest beats the determined heart of a determined artist.


     Sarah Pierce

Ty's wife and team co-captain, Sarah does most of the writing for Artstalker Project. She also nervously provided the voice acting for our pitch video above. She claims to have no artistic talents but does have a deep love for a number of talented artists.


     Jake Walker

Based in Winston-Salem, NC, Jake is our designated "cool guy". He has been a vital part of this team since the very beginning, before we had a plan, before we had a name. He is a talented writer and artist, and contributes to this project in any way he can.


     Terra Cooley

Arguably one of our biggest fans, Terra is like the Artstalker Project head cheerleader. She brings valuable business knowledge to this project and she keeps us encouraged and afloat when the going gets tough, even from afar.


How Your Donations Will Be Used

$24,000 will go towards paying for the site to be custom built. An official breakdown from the company can be found here.

$500 will go towards making sure we have the equipment to keep the site running smoothly.

$500 will go towards business cards, flyers and t-shirts. We hope to spread the word!


How Else You Can Help

This all began because an artist wanted this service to exist. We know that there are more artists and art lovers out there who want to see this succeed. Help us find them. If you have a person in mind, tell them about us. Share our website information. Like our Facebook page.

Like our Facebook page.

story:
PLEASE POST AND SHARE TO HELP US OUT!

ALCHEMISTAS - Beyond the Veil, Volume 2

Have you ever experienced a piece of artwork that moved you, that spoke to your soul and inspired you to dream of your highest potential?  Or an image of such sublime beauty that it took your breath away and transported you to another state of mind?  With this book we are hoping to bring this experience to the world, and into your hands!

After the success of the groundbreaking Visionary Art Book, entitled Alchemistas - Beyond the Veil, we now present the long-awaited second edition, featuring all new artwork from some of your favorites and more Emerging Artists who have never been published before.  So get ready for an otherworldly visionary journey one more time!

This book is a culmination of a dream and several years of hard work by the artists and designers who have put this project together.  It is completely artist owned and created and we have not received any outside funding or influence on our vision for this creation.  We are asking you and the conscious community to help us by pledging your support.  

You can even pre-order Alchemistas - Volume 2 right now...  and get the original book as well... or lots of great artist perks!

check out our rewards! ---------------------------------->

This collection will be displayed in a beautifully bound, exquisitely illustrated full-color book with high quality images that could even be framed as separate works of art!  This will be the first time that all of these amazing artists have been published together, and it certain to be a collectors item and a source of constant inspiration!


What We Need & What You Get

We have launched this campaign to ask you to help us bring this vision to life.  We have spent the last 2 years compiling images of these artists' ground breaking artwork, and carefully selecting emerging artists from hundreds of submissions.  It will all culminate in this project, bringing the transformational images of these artists to the public in a way never seen before with inspiring words and passages that illuminate the images and unite them together.

We are determined to complete this epic project and make it a resounding success, but we are going to need YOUR PARTICIPATION! 

If you have ever experienced a piece of art or vision that moved you and captured your imagination - this is your chance to help us share that feeling with the world...


We are asking for funds to get this book project designed and printed.  To do that, it is going to take many long hours of design and layout, pairing beautiful images with the words that expand their understanding, and presenting it all in a way that is artistic and imaginative.  To do this, our team of professionals will need to dedicate 2-3 months of solid full-time work to make it happen.  After that we want to find the best quality printer at a price that makes the book affordable for everyone.

We are hoping to have the books ready by Spring of 2016 

Please join us in creating this Visionary Art Book, and showing the world the inspiring and mind-blowing artwork and stories we have created.  It is our sincere hope that these visions will affect people deeply and help further the conscious evolution of our planet!

Some of our Perks include the following:

  • Be one of the very first people to receive a copy of the new book!
  • Get our Original first edition while they are still available
  • Combine both books at a discount for the full Visionary Experience!
  • Deck your walls with our huge fine-art tapestries in brilliant satin fabric
  • Wear the Art with one of our full-color all over printed T's!
  • Get a frame-able paper, canvas or metal print with gorgeous detail
  • Make an investment in the project with a unique original painting
  • Become a Patron(ess) of the project, get access to special events and more!

 

  

See Gallery Section for higher quality images of Perks!

----------------------------------------------------
Produced by Keyframe Entertainment


What is Visionary Art? It is the child of surrealism and fantasy, but with a stronger message of conscious evolution.  Art that captures the depths of imagination, the infinite potential of other dimensions, the journey of altered states of being, and the quest for spiritual enlightenment.  It is a glimpse into other worlds, or what our world could become...

Our Book will Feature these Visionary Artists and More:

Robert Venosa, Martina Hoffman, David Heskin and Aloria Weaver, Cameron Gray, Luke Brown, Andrew Jones, Simon Haiduk, David Lawell, Jonathan Solter, Randall Roberts, Morgan Mandala, Shawn Hocking, Emily Kell, Viandara, NicoPsy, Bryan Itch, Eloh Projects, Robby Donaghey, Martin Dimitrov, Trevor Hamlett, Xenodimensional, Vanja, Melissa Williams, Gio Berishvili, Alex Tooth, 

And many others...You can see more artists and even submit artwork at www.visionaryartbooks.com or www.facebook.com/VisionaryArtBooks

 

 

  


PLEASE POST AND SHARE TO HELP US OUT!

PLEASE POST AND SHARE TO HELP US OUT!

story:
My first Art Show ever! Wow! I am so excited and nervous. It has been a long journey from when I began dicking with digital imagery in the late 1990s, but I am so glad I started this whole mess. In 2003 I had a life altering allergic reaction to a medication, which disabled me from being able to work a traditional job, I credit my focus on improving my skill and depth at producing digital art from that time until now with being the main reason I am still living and breathing. There were so many times along the way when I was thinking “nope, just can’t do this anymore,” and I would find myself seeking comfort in front of my computer working on an art piece. From that distraction and focus I would get just enough energy to get through that night, and then the next day, and so on. Working on art has helped me in so many ways, as mentioned of course importantly, but also by requiring me to think about exactly what I was attempting to express in my art; a concept in renewed thinking that bubbled over into the thought processes involved in moving the rest of my life. It also has helped to reinvigorate parts of my brain I though permanently lost to me.

What a donation to my effort will afford me is this chance to push my Art Career forward into the world of professional practice. It will also grant me this venue in which to expose naked to the world the part of my vision that is encapsulated within each piece I produce. A donation will give me the actuality of this opportunity in providing funds to produce and transport my art pieces, and the necessary funds to do what needs doing in order for me to appear at the show in person. The funds will also help me get the word out about my participation in this show, and hopefully draw an audience for my work at the show. With entrance into this show, I gain access to  Art Basel Miami, the Tribeca Art Show in New York, and any other venue in the organization's circuit including shows in Europe.

I realize it is bloody cheek to ask for cash without being in a position to offer perks in exchange. All I can offer any of you is the opportunity to help a friend, and whatever value that helping me has for you … and my thanks, gratitude, and heart (figuratively speaking of course). However you can help will be of immense value to me, indeed. Thank you.

story:
Hi!  We are 428collective, a group of 11 artists based in Sonoma County, California.  Together we produce art projects, events, and exhibits to celebrate the innovative, boundary-pushing art that is made in our area.

THE PROJECT

OUT HERE is our most ambitious project to date.  Launching with a party and art exhibit on November 14th, we’re creating a dynamic series of events and expanding the idea of how art relates to place. We’ll have art exhibits, dinners, radio programs, performances, lectures, drive-in movie screenings and more.

Culminating in the Spring of 2016, OUT HERE presents a weekend tour of commissioned art sites in Sonoma County.  Commissioned artists will make one-day long interactive art projects.  Collaborative in nature, we’ll encourage the artists to make local people and communities each project’s core focus.

Your contribution to this online campaign will support the creation of the OUT HERE website, artist fees, printing costs and school bus rentals for our annual tour. Stretch our goal and you’ll support even more ambitious artist projects and help purchase an OUT HERE truck headquarters and exhibition space !

We’ve teamed up with Independent Arts and Media as our fiscal sponsor so your donations are tax deductible.

Through our art events, OUT HERE inspires new ways for us to think and learn about place, uncover what goes unnoticed, and experience our surroundings with new perspective. We are so excited to launch this project, and we thank you or your support!

FOR MORE INFORMATION ON OUR PROJECT AND 428COLLECTIVE, GO TO:
www.428collective.com


(image: Michelle Blade)


WHAT FUNDS WILL COVER

Funds from this online campaign will support the creation of the OUT HERE website, printing costs for publications and maps, publicity, school bus rentals for our annual tour, and artist fees for commissioned art projects.  We are looking for a minimum of $20,000 to get the project going, with a final goal of $50,000 (along with extra help from grants and other fundraisers).    The more money we raise, the better the overall project will be!  We want to give artists the chance to push themselves and have the funds to realize their most ambitious projects.  With additional support, we will also be able to  purchase a truck for our roving OUT HERE headquarters and exhibition space.  

We have teamed up with Independent Arts and Media as our fiscal sponsor, so this means that all donations will be tax deductible!

PERKS

Check out our fun list of perks on the right!  Go to the Gallery page above to see images and descriptions of the art available to you in exchange for your donation.  (note that some perks are not tax deductible) There is something for just about every donation level.  If you are unable to donate money but would still like to be involved, contact us and we will let you know about chances to volunteer at our events!

OUR TRACK RECORD

Since our formation in 2012, we have produced wonderfully successful art events for our community.  These events include a series of free art classes for kids and adults, a culture lecture series, literary nights, a year-long program of art installations in a local gallery, a wildly successful annual art CSA subscription project, community dinners to discuss the role on innovation and creativity in our area, drive-in movie nights featuring local filmmakers, design shows, and more! 

The members of our “dream team” collective have a wide range of skills and backgrounds that have allowed each event to run smoothly and professionally.  When a few bumps come our way in the planning process we bring together our team and outside help when necessary to keep things moving forward.

To learn more about 428collective and our projects, go to www.428collective.com

OUR PHILOSOPHY

We want:
-art that actively involves and is relevant to the culture, place, and community where it is created.
-projects by creative visionaries who reveal new ways to think about art and place.
-a platform for artists to take risks, experiment, and work outside big cities and white walls
-an inspiring and challenging dialogue about creative practices and rural culture

THANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING INNOVATIVE ART IN SONOMA COUNTY!
story_txt:
Hi!  We are 428collective, a group of 11 artists based in Sonoma County, California.  Together we produce art projects, events, and exhibits to celebrate the innovative, boundary-pushing art that is made in our area.THE PROJECT
OUT HERE is our most ambitious project to date.  Launching with a party and art exhibit on November 14th, we’re creating a dynamic series of events and expanding the idea of how art relates to place. We’ll have art exhibits, dinners, radio programs, performances, lectures, drive-in movie screenings and more. Culminating in the Spring of 2016, OUT HERE presents a weekend tour of commissioned art sites in Sonoma County.  Commissioned artists will make one-day long interactive art projects.  Collaborative in nature, we’ll encourage the artists to make local people and communities each project’s core focus.Your contribution to this online campaign will support the creation of the OUT HERE website, artist fees, printing costs and school bus rentals for our annual tour. Stretch our goal and you’ll support even more ambitious artist projects and help purchase an OUT HERE truck headquarters and exhibition space !We’ve teamed up with Independent Arts and Media as our fiscal sponsor so your donations are tax deductible. Through our art events, OUT HERE inspires new ways for us to think and learn about place, uncover what goes unnoticed, and experience our surroundings with new perspective. We are so excited to launch this project, and we thank you or your support!FOR MORE INFORMATION ON OUR PROJECT AND 428COLLECTIVE, GO TO:www.428collective.com 
(image: Michelle Blade)

WHAT FUNDS WILL COVERFunds from this online campaign will support the creation of the OUT HERE website, printing costs for publications and maps, publicity, school bus rentals for our annual tour, and artist fees for commissioned art projects.  We are looking for a minimum of $20,000 to get the project going, with a final goal of $50,000 (along with extra help from grants and other fundraisers).    The more money we raise, the better the overall project will be!  We want to give artists the chance to push themselves and have the funds to realize their most ambitious projects.  With additional support, we will also be able to  purchase a truck for our roving OUT HERE headquarters and exhibition space.  We have teamed up with Independent Arts and Media as our fiscal sponsor, so this means that all donations will be tax deductible!PERKSCheck out our fun list of perks on the right!  Go to the Gallery page above to see images and descriptions of the art available to you in exchange for your donation.  (note that some perks are not tax deductible) There is something for just about every donation level.  If you are unable to donate money but would still like to be involved, contact us and we will let you know about chances to volunteer at our events!

OUR TRACK RECORD
Since our formation in 2012, we have produced wonderfully successful art events for our community.  These events include a series of free art classes for kids and adults, a culture lecture series, literary nights, a year-long program of art installations in a local gallery, a wildly successful annual art CSA subscription project, community dinners to discuss the role on innovation and creativity in our area, drive-in movie nights featuring local filmmakers, design shows, and more!  The members of our “dream team” collective have a wide range of skills and backgrounds that have allowed each event to run smoothly and professionally.  When a few bumps come our way in the planning process we bring together our team and outside help when necessary to keep things moving forward.To learn more about 428collective and our projects, go to www.428collective.comOUR PHILOSOPHYWe want:-art that actively involves and is relevant to the culture, place, and community where it is created.-projects by creative visionaries who reveal new ways to think about art and place.-a platform for artists to take risks, experiment, and work outside big cities and white walls-an inspiring and challenging dialogue about creative practices and rural cultureTHANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING INNOVATIVE ART IN SONOMA COUNTY!

story:
Click Here for english 

VANILLA è un cortometraggio erotico, sperimenta una contaminazione di linguaggi artistici ( si avvale della partecipazione dell'illustratore Onze ) e mostra tutto ciò che c'è da mostrare senza paura di attingere (ebbene sì!) anche al PORNO. Un viaggio nella mente della nostra protagonista: una bellissima mistress (Lilith Primavera), che si muove in mondi patinati, iper realtà in cui oramai conviviamo e nei cliché di un immaginario collettivo che si sovrappone alla nostra quotidianità. Nel mondo bdsm, "Vanilla" (trad. "Vaniglia") è il termine che indica la sessualità vissuta in maniera "ordinaria", quella che non prevede giochi di ruolo e feticci...ma siamo proprio sicuri che anche questa ordinarietà non possa diventare a sua volta un feticismo?


XXXMAS STREAMING

Nel corto il tema ricorrente dei soldi e l'immagine patinata da copertina, restituiscono una visione di questo mondo globalizzato come fosse un "monopoly", un gioco in scatola dentro cui prima o poi chiunque dovrà riporre i pezzi. La ricerca di luoghi e non luoghi - non comuni alla maggior parte di noi - serve a sottolineare questa componente ludica e sviluppare la conseguente componente critica: d'altronde chiunque può affittare una limousine per un addio al nubilato, regalarsi lussi e coccole a breve termine, sperimentare varie esistenze possibili.

 Vorrei mostrare con leggerezza ed ironia il mondo del feticismo e inscrivervi "l'amore romantico", patologizzarlo, perché l’amore forse è il più grande feticismo, o perlomeno.. il più pericoloso.

La mia storia personale è difficilmente catalogabile e inscrivibile in uno schema. Desidero rompere caselle e categorie e per questo motivo scelgo di mostrare il corpo e il lavoro sessuale. Combatto per liberare la potenza sessuale di noi donne. Mostrando la debolezza del costrutto sociale "uomo" portatore malsano di privilegi. 

Combatto le etichette, il più delle volte nate da definizioni psichiatriche patologizzanti, fatte da medici.... inutile dirlo: maschi. 

Detto questo io sono LILITH PRIMAVERA, "Frocio" "Troia" "Femminista" sono un..."eccetera eccetera". Spero che guardando questo corto avrete modo di pensare o, al meglio, che possiate farlo.... con le mani... "


Bozzetti di ONZE

SCEGLI IL TUO PERK !!!

Finanziare un cortometraggio erotico dal basso, senza censura, è una sfida a cui crediamo. Determinati prodotti hanno vita solo grazie alla rete e al contributo di tutti voi.

Basta poco per contribuire...abbiamo pensato a TANTISSIMI REGALI PER VOI. 


A partire dai più utili (i profilattici), per finire ai cimeli più preziosi e originali (il ciuffo di Lilith, le tette d'artista o le "du palle" di Natale). Potrai inoltre assistere all'anteprima del film a Roma, per una proiezione privata con buffet in presenza degli autori del film. Oppure scegliere un pacchetto "personale" per chi vorrà approfondire l'amicizia con l'artista. 

Da non dimenticare inoltre i bellissimi regali messi a disposizione da Onze (cartoline, stampe e borse personalizzate). 


Per gli amanti del sesso, inoltre, un viaggio nella Roma Underground, alla scoperta dei club privé più hard della capitale (ce n'è per tutti i gusti) assieme a Lilith e la sua crew. 

Insomma non ti resta che scegliere...DONATE E GODETENE TUTTI !!!!

Cast artistico:

Regia: Lilith Primavera

Arte: Onze

Direttore della fotografia: Clarissa Cappellani

Musiche originali di Felice Zaccheo -registrato, montato e mixato da Franco Pietropaoli (Ermese Records)


* ACCREDITATI NEI CREDITS DEL FILM

** ACCREDITATI COME PRODUTTORI ASSOCIATI

 

english Vanilla is an erotic short film experimenting through a contamination of different artistic methods ( availing of the participation of the ONZE illustrator ) and shows everything that has to be shown without fear of using pornographic language. A journey in the mind of a stunning mistress (Lilith Primavera), who moves in glossy worlds, hyper realities in which we ourselves already live and in universes and in the clichés of a collective imagination that overlay our daily life. Vanilla, in language referring to sexuality, is sex lived in an ordinary way, without role-play and fetishisms. But are we really sure that this “ordinary” way of living sexuality cannot become a fetish itself?


Sketch by ONZE 

In the short film the recurring theme of money and of the glossy cover image render a vision of a globalized world as if it were a monopoly, a board game within which everyone most recompose the pieces sooner or later. 

The research places and non – places not common to most of us serves to underline this playful component and to develop the resulting critical component: on the other hand anyone can rent a limousine bid farewell to the single life, indulging in short lived luxury and cuddles, experimenting various possible experiences. 

I would like to introduce the world of fetishism with lightness and irony, incorporating romantic love, rendering it pathological in the same way as the western world transforms desire, fun, curiosity in paraphilias caring to preserve mononuclear family schemes and binary of gender. 

My personal history is difficult to categorize and fit in to a scheme. I wish to break away from categories and boxes and for this reason i choose to show the body and sexual work. I fight to liberate the sexual prowess of us women. Showing the weakness of the social construct "man" unhealthy carrier of privileges.

 I refuse labels, that are mostly pathological psychiatric definitions given by doctors – males - that goes without saying .

That said, I’m LILITH PRIMAVERA , a “Queer”, a “Slut", and a “Feminist”, and so on . I hope that by seeing this short film you will have the possibility to think or at best  you could... do it with your hands!



CHOOSE YOUR PERK!

Crowdfunding a short movie, without censorship, is a challenge we believe in. Some products are alive only thanks to the web and to the help of every one of you.

It takes very little to give your contribution... and we developed many perks for you.

They go from the most useful ones (condoms), and include precious and original relics (Lilith's tuft of hair and artistic boobs). You can also book one place to "Vanilla" first preview in Rome ( Buffet + Drink free) . Or else you can choose a “personal” package for those of you who want to deepen their friendship with the artist.

Last but not least, the beautiful cards and prints made by Onze.

Furthermore, sex lovers can enjoy a journey in Underground Rome, to discover the most extreme VIP areas of the city (there's something to suit everybody's fancy) with Lilith and her crew.

You only need to choose... DONATE AND COME WITH US !!!

Director: Lilith Primavera

Cinematography: Clarissa Cappellani

Art: Onze

Original Soundtrack by Felice Zaccheo - Recording, editing, mixing by Franco Pietropaoli



SPECIAL PERKS:

*MENTIONED IN THE FILM CREDITS

*MENTIONED AS ASSOCIATE PRODUCERS

story:
Art, like morality, consists in drawing the line somewhere - Gilbert K. Chesterton

Dear Peeps, Posse, Squa(d) and Big Poppas out there!  THE MOD need YOU!  Be a part of the first Museum of Drawing in Houston.  Help us achieve our goals and make a presence in our arts community.  Our plans include bringing in the next generation of drawing, sprinkling animation and kinetics.  What are we doing to draw the line?

THE TEXAS CONTEMPORARY ART FAIR - October, 2015

THE MOD SQUAD .5K at MKT BAR (inspired by Jose Solis) - December 2015

FRANCISCO LARIOS exhibition - Spring 2016

story:
What is Junk?

Junk is the first installment in a series of coffee table books that showcases photogenic aspects of male anatomy. Junk is not highbrow. It is fun and a little goofy. It's about people being comfortable with their bodies and having a good time.

The concept for the coffee table book Junk started as many of mankind’s greatest ideas were formed: a conversation with a friends about male anatomy and creating a book based on it. And, luckily armed with a quick wit, a friend named the book and I sprang to action. Throughout various conversations afterward, countless friends, models, and exhibitionists showed so much interest that I had to make the book happen. Conversations had swelled to a fully-fledged project that I knew belonged on the coffee tables of every amateur appreciator and seasoned connoisseur of the masculine form. 

Junk is a celebration of the male form that I want to share with you. With your help, you can be a part of the beginning of a great project that will continue to create an engrossing visual experience from the comfort of your couch.

There’s no need to beat around the bush: I need your support to get Junk onto your table. I am in the process of creating merchandise to complement the book and donations will be compensated with Junk  tanks and t-shirts and greeting card that contain two 4x6 Junk prints. 

Junk is completed after many photo shoots and countless hours of editing. I plan to expand the series to include other features of human bodies under the titles Rack, Crack, and Trunk already in production.

With donations Junk will be able to go to print with self publishing. Donations will send Junk to print and create apparel and other merchandise.

Dickiebot is a multi-media visual artist. I specialize in photography, fine art and graphic art. My background as a multi-media visual artist has given me the skills to complete this book through my artistic filter and create a unique experience for readers and watchers.

story:
My Story

My name is Yael Horowitz, I am a student at Wesleyan University. I am a double major in Film and African American Studies and this coming year, I am planning on completing two theses and graduating. It has been my dream for a long time to be a film maker. I am trying to raise money to cover production costs for my film thesis. I work three jobs and will be financing the film independently. 

What will the money go towards?

Making a film can be expensive, some of the costs are:
  • Location fees.
  • Insurance for location, actors and equipment.
  • Fees for renting lenses ($400 for 14 days). 
  • Sound mixing ($450).
  • Gas and transportation for crew and actors.
  • Food for the actors and crew. 

The Impact

As a woman entering the film industry, I will be encountering many challenges. I feel it is very important for women's voices, especially women who care about intersectional social justice, to be present as producers of culture and images. My film will tell the story of an unlikely pairing of a babysitter and the child he's babysitting growing up in a time of #BlackLivesMatter. It will deal with themes of youth empowerment, systemic racism, and the proliferation of violent images. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this! 
  • Connecting me with people who could provide discounted food/locations in CT!
