story:
Short Summary


One of the great blessings I had having regained sobriety was the possibility to travel again. So, with director Catherine McGilvray we went to India to shoot a documentary about a story of unconditional forgiveness. Samundar Singh, a Hindu fanatic, had killed in 1995 a Catholic nun, Rani Maria. In prison, he was forgiven by the family, who asked and obtained his release from jail. The mother and sister of Rani Maria than welcomed him as a son and a brother. All this would not have been possible without Swami Sadanand, a Catholic priest whose mission was to actively spread the message of forgiveness to all people, ragardless of their faith, social conditions or wrongdoings. To fulfill his mission, he risked his life more than once,  Since then, Swami was a costant companion and guide both for me and Catherine. His loving smile could heal every moment of depair, suffering, uncertainty. He came to New York and Rome for the screening of the documentary (The Heart of a Murderer), and his speeches on forgiveness touched the hearts of many. While he was with us we did some shooting so to have a testimony of his his life and words. This year, at the age of 68, he left this world to return where he belonged, the house of the Father,
We decided not to keep to ourselves the shootings, and to make a documentary. We think that his committment to forgivness and reconciliation, his quest for God, and his loving smile should reach as many people as possible. In the documentary I will also briefly talk of my past as an alcoholic and gambler. Now that i have ragained sobriety (and how wonderful this is), I would like to give testimony that it is possible to exit hell and begin to walk a path of peace.

WHY WE DO IT

We feel that there is too much talk on religion and too little real religious commitment. When I asked Swami why so many people meditate, pray, do yoga, etc., and so few of them seem to express a spiritual attitude (acceptance, forgiveness, thankfulness, joy and so no) in their everyday life, he explained to me that are not ready to sacrifice what they have (even preoccupations) when they search for God or inner peace. Swami took that challange seriously, and it changed his all life. Then, seeing God in others as well, he dedicated himself completely to solve inner and outer conficts. While living he had an enormous impact on thousands of lives (http://mattersindia.com/2016/04/revolutionary-c...), and we wish that our work, with all its faults and errors, may continue to bring his healing voice to all those in sorrow and in need.

So, we have a lot to work with, and we are putting all our efforts in this project, but we need help, so that we can do some additional shooting, finish the editing, work in the postproduction of the film and spread the message. If you want to know more about Swami, please go to the following Vimeo pages:

https://vimeo.com/82090040 (Swami's life)
https://vimeo.com/82089739 (Swami's spiritual lesson to Samundar, murderer of Rani Maria)
https://vimeo.com/120976387 (Interview given to Rome Reports together with director Catherine McGilvray on the documentary The Heart of a Murderer)
https://vimeo.com/82089097 (Swami blessing Samundar)

If you want to know more about director Catherine McGilvray, the best way is to see for yourself her way of telling stories. Here is the link to the documentary film Rielo, Poet of God, on the life of the mystic and founder of the Idente Missionaries Fernando Rielo

https://vimeo.com/82081737

Her biography you can find at the website www.heartofamurderer.com

What We Need & What You Get


We will need an estimated 12.000 euros, so divided:


4000 for the editing

4000 for the postproduction

2000 for the original score

2000 for marketing purposes

If we don't reach the 10.000, we will anyway put what we have gained in the documentary, because we feel is so important we will make it anyhow.  But please help us out to have an acceptable quality!

"The well being of all creatures is the joy of God;
Everything in the universe is the gift of God, proclaiming his presence"

Swami Sadanand


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially, doesn't matter. May be you could help spreading the message using social media and the Indiegogo facilities.
story_txt:
Short Summary
One of the great blessings I had having regained sobriety was the possibility to travel again. So, with director Catherine McGilvray we went to India to shoot a documentary about a story of unconditional forgiveness. Samundar Singh, a Hindu fanatic, had killed in 1995 a Catholic nun, Rani Maria. In prison, he was forgiven by the family, who asked and obtained his release from jail. The mother and sister of Rani Maria than welcomed him as a son and a brother. All this would not have been possible without Swami Sadanand, a Catholic priest whose mission was to actively spread the message of forgiveness to all people, ragardless of their faith, social conditions or wrongdoings. To fulfill his mission, he risked his life more than once,  Since then, Swami was a costant companion and guide both for me and Catherine. His loving smile could heal every moment of depair, suffering, uncertainty. He came to New York and Rome for the screening of the documentary (The Heart of a Murderer), and his speeches on forgiveness touched the hearts of many. While he was with us we did some shooting so to have a testimony of his his life and words. This year, at the age of 68, he left this world to return where he belonged, the house of the Father,We decided not to keep to ourselves the shootings, and to make a documentary. We think that his committment to forgivness and reconciliation, his quest for God, and his loving smile should reach as many people as possible. In the documentary I will also briefly talk of my past as an alcoholic and gambler. Now that i have ragained sobriety (and how wonderful this is), I would like to give testimony that it is possible to exit hell and begin to walk a path of peace.WHY WE DO ITWe feel that there is too much talk on religion and too little real 
religious commitment. When I asked Swami why so many people meditate, 
pray, do yoga, etc., and so few of them seem to express a spiritual 
attitude (acceptance, forgiveness, thankfulness, joy and so no) in their
 everyday life, he explained to me that are not ready to sacrifice what 
they have (even preoccupations) when they search for God or inner peace.
 Swami took that challange seriously, and it changed his all life. Then,
 seeing God in others as well, he dedicated himself completely to solve 
inner and outer conficts. While living he had an enormous impact on 
thousands of lives (http://mattersindia.com/2016/04/revolutionary-c...),
 and we wish that our work, with all its faults and errors, may continue
 to bring his healing voice to all those in sorrow and in need.
So, we have a lot to work with, and we are putting all our efforts in this project, but we need help, so that we can do some additional shooting, finish the editing, work in the postproduction of the film and spread the message. If you want to know more about Swami, please go to the following Vimeo pages:https://vimeo.com/82090040 (Swami's life)https://vimeo.com/82089739 (Swami's spiritual lesson to Samundar, murderer of Rani Maria)https://vimeo.com/120976387 (Interview given to Rome Reports together with director Catherine McGilvray on the documentary The Heart of a Murderer)https://vimeo.com/82089097 (Swami blessing Samundar)If you want to know more about director Catherine McGilvray, the best way is to see for yourself her way of telling stories. Here is the link to the documentary film Rielo, Poet of God, on the life of the mystic and founder of the Idente Missionaries Fernando Rielohttps://vimeo.com/82081737Her biography you can find at the website www.heartofamurderer.com
  What We Need & What You Get

We will need an estimated 12.000 euros, so divided:

4000 for the editing
4000 for the postproduction
2000 for the original score
2000 for marketing purposes
If we don't reach the 10.000, we will anyway put what we have gained in the documentary, because we feel is so important we will make it anyhow.  But please help us out to have an acceptable quality!
"The well being of all creatures is the joy of God;
Everything in the universe is the gift of God, proclaiming his presence"
Swami Sadanand

Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't help financially, doesn't matter. May be you could help spreading the message using social media and the Indiegogo facilities.

story:
The problem

You're biking through the playa on Friday night when suddenly a shape appears directly in front of you. Whoa, a darkwad! You swerve and eat dust in an attempt to avoid a collision. You yell at them but they don't hear you through the thumping bass and light show of a passing art car. 

We, the fairies of light and magic, have invented a magical machine to solve this problem.


The vision - light up the night

In the distance the burner sees a form she is familiar with: a gumball machine. But unlike those delight-dispensing fixtures of her past, this one glows with magical lights. Upon closer approach she reads a sign on top - “Get Lit”, it commands.

Rather than take your money, this machine has a different purpose - to give the much needed resource of light to illumination-starved burners, AKA “darkwads”. For the meager price of a kind thought, the machine dispenses a personal illumination device in an iconic plastic egg. A spiral chute sits on the side to collect the empty eggs.

This piece is an oasis of light in the darkness. From it, individuals carry sparks of light out to the rest of the playa. Be the light you wish to see in the world, and help others shine too!



The backstory

Last year, we dressed up as the Fairies of Light and Magic, and we wandered through the playa gifting blinky rings to darkwads, helping their fellow burners see them in the dark, dusty night.

This year, we want to scale that effort beyond what we mere tutu-adorned mortals could do, by recycling a giant gumball machine into a blinky ring machine. 

The perks

Help us bring light to the darkwads of the playa and you could receive one of these exciting perks! ba Bum BUM....



The budget

Here's a basic breakdown of where we'll spend the funds:

  • $200: Cost of the used gumball machine.
  • $100: Costs for the egg receptacle parts.
  • $50: Costs to decorate pieces with CD mosaic and/or reflective paint.
  • $75: Supplies for securing pieces to the ground - anchors, bolts.
  • $600: Supplies for lighting - SLA batteries, control board, LED strips.
  • $225: Costs for campaign rewards.
The big wildcard is the rings that are dispensed. Our machine fits around 1000 rings at a time. The highly illuminating blinky rings cost $.25 each. 
That puts the total at $1,500 for a completely filled machine. We're aiming for $3,000 so that we can keep the machine stocked throughout the week (6 refillings). The more we get, the more we can give. (At $36,000, we could gift illumination to every person at Burning Man!)

The team

We are Jacob & Pamela, two makers from the bay area.

 

We'll be joined by Erin and Howard...

...And Liz and Janardyn!

...Plus LED wizard Jason Trager!



Thank you

We'd like to thank the Burning Man community for your support. Together, we can make the world a brighter place!

story:
Boomerang Club!

Boomerang Club is a spoken word night that's taken West London by storm. Now with the Fringe coming up, we felt it was a good time to take our show on the road and bring the fun we have on a monthly basis up to Edinburgh!

Boomerang Club is the love child of Joel Auterson and Jake Wild Hall. With the help of Chris Lawrence and Tyrone Lewis on the hosting team, the night has built a name and a strong community for itself. Our nights showcase not just amazing poetry from open micers and features, but also a loving community spirit - and with your help, we'd like to extend our community to the Fringe.

We've got an amazing show planned, packed with world-class featured acts, mostly-likeable hosts and the ever-popular open mic. It's going to be wild.


We need your help

Running a show at the Fringe is quite a complex process with a lot of moving parts. Our show is a free show - you don't have to buy tickets! - but there are a few extra things that do unfortunately cost money. These include:
  • Flyers and promotional materials
  • Our entry into the official Fringe guide
  • Accommodation and other living costs (Edinburgh is really expensive in August, for some reason...)
We've always been determined to keep our nights as affordable as we possibly can, but that means the Fringe show is a big financial risk for all of us. With your help we can make the risk that wee bit smaller.
In return, we've got all sorts of goodies, like Boomerang London tickets, personalised poems, videos or even a dinner date with the very handsome Jake Wild Hall. Have a look at the perks section to see what's going.
You'll also get our undying love and affection, which, trust us, is a very valuable commodity indeed. We give great hugs.

How else you can help

Maybe you're not going to the Fringe, or don't care about the Fringe. Maybe you don't know who we are but you think we seem like nice people. Whatever. It would be amazing if you could fire this campaign out amongst your social media pigeons. Maybe we'll get a bite.
Wait, no. That would be fish. Stupid metaphor. You know what I mean.

We'd be so grateful if you'd help make our Fringe show as good as it can possibly be!
Peace and love,
The Boomerang Crew

story:
Batwood Creations Origins:

I am Blaine Atwood of Price Utah. As a youth I struggled with mainstream academia due to a case of undiagnosed dyslexia. This caused me to be drawn to the arts. Feeling a sense of accomplishment as I explored the arts gave me the confidence to work hard in my regular classes, graduate high school, and ultimately go on to graduate from college with my BA in ceramics in 1995. 

  • In 2000 I was privileged to accept a job teaching ceramics and sculpture at The College of Eastern Utah. I loved teaching there. For thirteen years I taught and watched as students lives were touched and molded by their own encounter with the arts. As I was in the process of obtaining my MFA in ceramics (which I completed in the spring of 2014), I was forced to move on from the teaching job that I loved at CEU due to budget cuts that closed the ceramics program at the college. Since then my wife and I have dedicated our time to selling my pottery under the name of Batwood Creations. 

  • As a youth, finding I had a talent in clay and other artistic areas was such a benefit to me that helping people of all ages to discover art through ceramics has become a passion of mine. We want to transform our small home-based operation into a large full-functioning ceramic studio where we can teach community classes and increase pottery production.

  • This studio will benefit a whole community providing a creative, constructive outlet for all ages. Who knows, with your help, we may even be able to help a child or two develop the confidence to accomplish more than they think they can.


We are raising $20,000 dollars by selling handmade mugs and coasters.

  • We need the $20,000 to buy new equipment for classes and to upgrade the electrical in the new studio location. 

  • You will love the mugs I make: Three years ago I dedicated my online shop to selling primarily mugs. It was my goal to make mugs fast enough and good enough that the public could have a unique handmade mug and wouldn’t need to suffer with the subpar stuff offered at the large chain stores. I was happy when I could finally start selling my large, 16-20oz, mugs for as low as $20.00 and bulk custom mug orders for even less.

  • All funds we make from this campaign will go toward achieving these goals.

               Mug Colors Available

Individuals:

  • These are lightweight, unique large mugs. Each mug is handmade on the potters wheel and is signed on the bottom by me, Blaine Atwood. Purchasing a mug from me not only gives you a beautiful piece of pottery but it also benefits the whole community of Price Utah. I have seen how a single ceramics class can change someone’s life, and that is what you are helping to accomplish. True, individual, personalized change.

Businesses, Large Groups:

  • Help me help you!
  •  For you, this is an opportunity to offer something substantial, handmade, unique and best of all personalized with your logo to your employees, members, or executives. This will help raise morale and instill pride in your brand. Just think you could have all your Christmas shopping done and paid for in May/June, then delivered in Oct. No last minute stressing over what to do for that party. Best of all you know that you are helping a community and a business grow.


Risks & Challenges:

The worst thing that could happen is that we don't raise enough for the expansion. 

  • I currently have enough equipment and clay to fill all orders generated through this campaign. 
  • If it all goes wrong, then we will be getting a small loan to accomplish our goals.   

Other Ways You Can Help:

We are not the kind of studio that wants something for nothing. In fact we have done all we could to make this campaign affordable and high quality. But because we don’t sell our products at a super high price, we need to have a lot of supporters to meet our goal. 

  • Please send this link to friends, family, and anyone you know who owns a business. 
  • Just think about it, here we are in May and June and you could have your Christmas shopping all done.

Thank you!

story:
PLEASE DO NOT DONATE ON THIS PAGE ANYMORE! Please instead visit the Donate page at www.theminghon.com.

PLEASE JOIN US MON JUNE 27TH FOR OUR FUNDRAISER SHOWING AT THE RACHEL BROWNE THEATRE 211 BANNATYNE. FOR RESERVATIONS, DONATIONS OR QUESTIONS ABOUT PRIZES PLEASE CONTACT MING AT mingminghon@gmail.com!

THANK YOU FOR YOUR INTEREST AND SUPPORT. SEE YOU JUNE 27TH!! XOXO MING



HI!
We are Hilary Bergen, Hilary Crist, Ming Hon, Trevor Pick, and jaymez.  We are the cast and crew of the performance Chase Scenes #1-58.  Fifty-Eight chase scenes brought to life in a romp of a DIY hollywood film studio theme park ride.  We'll leave you breathless....

We have been invited to perform Chase Scenes #1-58 at SummerWorks Performance Festival in Toronto this August 4-14th in their Special Presentations Series.  To perform in this acclaimed Canadian Festival is an incredible opportunity and we just need a little help to get us there for a 7 show run (no pun-intended)!
 
We first premiered this production 1 year ago at aceartinc. in Winnipeg to rave reviews and packed houses.  A bit a bout the show:
'Inspired by our collective nightmare of being followed and the manifestation of this in film culture, dancers enact various chase scenes in combination with video cameras displaying live feed projections. Real, living bodies in motion blur with the spectacle of filmic bodies on screen.  Exploring how the emotional makes way for the physical and how the psychology, adrenaline, and intense fear of the pursued manifests in the inherent impulse of forward motion.'

"Ming Hon's Chase Scenes #1-58 is a visceral performance and cinematic journey which grabs the viewer by the throat and whispers jokes into their ear." - Seema Goel, Critical Distance, AceArtInc.

We are currently in rehearsals preparing for SummerWorks and a fundraiser showing of the performance Mon June 27th 8pm in The Rachel Browne Theatre at Winnipeg's Contemporary Dancers.  A ONE NIGHT only performance of Chase Scenes #1-58, Suggested donation of $20 at the door.  Please join us for this very special send off! We will have a refreshments and a bar after the show. Our online campaign will close on this night, with an announcement of the WINNERS of the following PRIZES**:

1.  GRAND PRIZE (announced June 27th!)

Highest Donation (minimum of $500): An original exclusive print by the Winnipeg's own Karen Asher !! Hot off the heels of her critically acclaimed solo exhibition The Full Catastrophe, this untitled 20 X 20 print (ft Ming in her studio) will go to a very lucky winner.  

2.  Dance Dance Dance Package

First online donation of $200 or more: A full season ticket package to the first Contemporary Dance Company in Canada - Winnipeg's Contemporary Dancers 16/17 season, and get dancing with a 10 class card at The School of Contemporary Dancers (Adult Classes only).

3. Tony Knows, Tony Knows.

First online donation of $150 or more gets an exclusive front of the line tony chestnut dress!  Be the first to wear this 'mini sack dress with handpainted dots and handmade from 100% European Linen.  For a good time, anytime.'


4.  VIP seating  

First online donation of $50 or more gets 2 reserved exclusive floor level seats to the preview performance of Chase Scenes June 27th at The Rachel Browne Theatre.

Funding is scarce in the arts and we are thankful for anything you can help us out with, any amount it is incredibly helpful!  We are splitting the costs 5 ways and putting a lot of blood (type A, B, and corn syrup mixed with a little red food colouring), sweat (marathon training rehearsals), and tears (cutting onions and visine eyedrops) into this performance because we believe it to be a very special production.  Your support in donations and enthusiam helps us from running on empty..

If you're curious about some of the costs incurred in taking this production on tour the money goes directly to:
-travel to and from Toronto (5 people)
-accomodations for 12 days
-daily per diems
-shipping props and costumes (we have a lot of them in this show!)
-artist fees for the choreographer, dancers, and lighting designer/technical director
-rehearsal rental space
-living expenses while away
-Printing costs and Marketing


Please share this with all of your dance, theatre, performance, and art lovers!  We hope to have you join us at our fundraiser showing (June 27th) and at SummerWorks Festival in August!

‘Cutting to the chase' is a common turn of phrase originating from early silent films. Screenwriters would bore the audience with unnecessary filler for a length of time leading up to the chase scene, which was the most anticipated part of the movie. Chase Scenes #1-58 are delivered straight, no chaser.'

Created by Ming Hon I Featuring Hilary Bergen, Hilary Crist, Ming Hon, and Trevor Pick I Lighting Design and Technical Direction by jaymez I Video by Kayla Jeanson & jaymez

www.theminghon.com

**Prizes in the online campaign are limited to one prize per online donation. All Prizes will be publicly announced June 27th at the showing and delivered after this date.

We hope to have you join us at our fundraiser showing (June 27th) and at
 SummerWorks Festival in August! ‘Cutting to the chase' is a 
common turn of phrase originating from early silent films. Screenwriters
 would bore the audience with unnecessary filler for a length of time 
leading up to the chase scene, which was the most anticipated part of 
the movie. Chase Scenes #1-58 are delivered straight, no chaser.'Created by Ming Hon I Featuring Hilary Bergen, Hilary Crist, Ming Hon, and Trevor Pick I Lighting Design and Technical Direction by jaymez I Video by Kayla Jeanson & jaymez www.theminghon.com**Prizes in the online campaign are limited to one prize per online donation. All Prizes will be publicly announced June 27th at the showing and delivered after this date.

story:
Bonjour à tous ,


Nous participons au festival jeunesse du 25 au 29 Juillet Prochain . Pendant les JMJ de Cracovie . 

Nous allons réalisé une installation artistique . 

Notre objectif est de réalisé un cœur gigantesque composé de milliers de photos de mains de participants, pèlerins et volontaires .

Nous avons besoin de vos mains en photos !!! Collecte jusqu'au 14 Juillet 

Nous avons besoin de votre soutien, le travail graphique et d'édition de chaque main devient un  Process onéreux vu la quantité à éditer . Chaque main est plastifiée.  Le montant du Crownfounding  demandé est sur une projection d'impression de 6000 mains . C'est pourquoi nous avons choisi de laisser la récolte des fonds " flexible " et "In Demande" si nous dépassons, les fonds serviront pour d'autres installations 

Une scène de 600m2 sera investie sur un fond blanc au sol  . Le cœur sera au milieu de la reproduction des mains de la Création de Michel - Ange. Les mains seront éditées en très grand format plus de 10 mètres de longueur . Ce qui représente un coût d'impression également important . 

Donc voila les raisons pour lesquelles nous lançons cette campagne, le coût d'une main est d'environ 70 cents imprimée, plastifiée. 


Alors si vous participez même en donnant un euros votre dons nous sera utile .

En espérant que vous comprenez notre démarche .


Merci à Tous pour votre soutien .


Julien Touchard


Voici les liens où vous pouvez découvrir, participer et rejoindre le concept en publiant la photo de votre main , 

http://www.facebook.com/Handbyhandproject/


https://instagram.com/p/BGjncpSmJXZ

story:
Who Am I?

My name is Linda Kaye-Moses and I have been a maker of art jewelry for forty years. You can check out my jewels at lindakayemoses.com. Welcome to my Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign, “From Drawings to Jewelry”. There is just a single goal for this campaign, a goal to raise $8,000.00, but more about that below. Read on to find out, and to discover how you can personally be a part of my vision.

The Inspiration for This Campaign

Over a decade ago, I began writing a memoir tracing the path I followed to become the artist I am today; the path that allowed me to indulge my passion for making jewelry. This memoir, titled Roots, Stems, and Branches; A Recollection, was originally handwritten and included my hand-drawn, illuminated letters. 

In 2012 it was published in hardcover and paperback <http://www.blurb.com/search/site_search?search=Linda+Kaye-Moses> 

Why am I talking about the book, when this project is less about Roots, Stems, and Branches; A Recollection,and more about the drawings within it and the jewelry that grew out of it? Because each section and each chapter in the book began with my own hand drawn, illuminated letters and ended with a drawing using an element from each of those letters, and THESE DRAWINGS DIRECTLY INSPIRED MY JEWELRY AND THIS CAMPAIGN.

How Did Tht Happen and What Happened Next?

Many of my collectors commented that these designs could be re-interpreted as jewelry, as my unruly jewels, although I hadn’t envisioned the drawings in the book for this purpose. (it never even occurred to me). So the idea of translating my drawings into jewelry began to percolate. 

From that moment, I became compelled, destined, and driven to revisit the drawings with this in mind. I selected ten of them (see images below) on which to base the jewelry designs. I became immersed in the process of making this jewelry, and so, after working steadily in my studio for many months, ten pendant neckpieces were created. 

The Pendant Neckpieces

Based on the themes of the chapters from which the drawings were taken, the pendant neckpieces are titled as follows: This Gathering, Summer Breeze, The Gift, Mixed Messages, Syncopator, Walking Through Ancient Lives, A Land Removed, The Way In, Divergence, and Astonishing Vistas. 

Each of these hand-fabricated jewels is made using Fine (Pure) and Sterling silver, with 14k or 18k gold details. Most are set with gemstones. The Sterling silver chains from which the jewels are suspended, are joined with hand made clasps based on the design of the pendant neckpieces themselves. Each of these pendant neckpieces has been enameled in colors that refer back to the colors of the original drawings. 

And Now Presenting...The Single Goal of the Campaign

Since I haven’t really told you yet, you may have begun to wonder what this campaign is all about. There is only one goal of this campaign. The expense of purchasing the materials and supplies, and then creating these jewels, was substantial. The single goal of this campaign is to help me offset that cost by raising $8,000.00. I’m inviting you to help me do this.

How You Can Help

To encourage you to become a part of this project, I’m offering a range of some very elegant, interesting, and, I hope, irresistible perks for all levels of generosity. Have a look, read through them, and please join me in creating the success of this campaign!

story:
Artistic Exploration of Iceland

For the past 6 years, I have been showing my artwork across Seattle, honing my style and perfecting my techniques to prepare myself for this upcoming trip. In June, I will be spending one month traveling around Iceland, creating a body of work inspired by the Icelandic scenery and people! Come, join me on this awesome journey of self discovery. 
I will be travelling around the country by myself, camping every night and creating one original watercolor painting per day. At the end of the trip, I will come back to Seattle and feature all the new paintings at KoLab Gallery in Urban Light Studios for Greenwood Art Walk. 
By donating to this campaign, you will not only help an artist grow and evolve, but you will be helping fulfill a 10-year-old dream to see Iceland myself. 
Here is a link to the route that I have plotted out
www.plotaroute.com/route/194913

What I Need & What You Get

Since Iceland is a pretty expensive country to visit, each one of your donations will go to the following accommodations:
  • Car Rental: $2,500
  • Gas: $300
  • Watercolor Paper and Travel Watercolor Set: $150
  • Incidentals: $1,000
  • Food and Camping Supplies: $1,050
Some of the perks for donating include anything from a postcard sent to you from my adventures in Iceland, to an 8x10 print set of all 30 paintings I make while I am there, or even a photo book filled with photography from my Icelandic travels and process photos of all the paintings I create while I am there. 

The Impact

This trip is, for me, a once in a lifetime opportunity. I have wanted to spend time in Iceland since I was 17 years old, but was never financially able to. After a bunch of scrimping and saving, I was able to come up with enough money to buy my plane ticket, and get my passport. Each donation, no matter how small, will make the biggest impact on this adventure. 

Risks & Challenges

If I do not raise enough money to rent a car, then I will be taking a bicycle with me. I will be training for this trip to make sure I am physically able to complete a 30 day tour of Iceland. 
Of course, renting a car will enable me to see parts of Iceland I wouldnt otherwise have time for on bike. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Feel free to share my campaign with your family and friends! You can also follow me and my adventures on instagram @mrshmrart

If you cannot contribute monetarily, I will happily accept any camping or art supply donations! If you would like to donate an item for my trip, please send me an email at mjcrosetto@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

Hello and thank you for taking a look at my campaign!

I am a fine artist specializing in wildlife and contemporary realism.  Since 2004, I have displayed my work at shows, won awards, and demonstrated my techniques.  Now it's time for a true teaching studio!  I look forward to sharing my work and traditional painting techniques throughout my community, but I can't do it without your help.

I want to open a full painting studio that will teach students traditional painting techniques, to develop skills once used by the Old Masters, and bring back the knowledge that painting in a realistic style is possible.



What We Need & What You Get

To make this work, I need funding for several things:

Rent for the first few months as the studio becomes viable.

Easels, painting supplies, and other supplies needed to make a professional studio space.

If I don't reach my entire goal of setting up a studio, I will still use the funds to teach!  I will teach in various venues, and the funds will go to ongoing supply needs and renting the classroom spaces that I will be using.

I also have an Etsy store!  If you would like to purchase anything from my Etsy store, that would help greatly, plus you get a piece of art for yourself!

http://lamgallery.etsy.com/


The Impact

Traditional-style painting has become almost a lost art in many places.  I have made a point to study traditional realism and techniques of the Old Masters, and I want to share this knowledge with people in my community. 

Risks & Challenges

Depending on the ability to fund this campaign, not enough funds may be raised to open a studio.  Success also depends on how many students can be brought in on a regular basis.  I look forward to sharing this project extensively with the community, hosting Open Houses, and using other means to make this a success.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, that's ok!  Just by sharing this project with your network, you will be helping me greatly.  Use the Indiegogo share tools as well!

story:
Short Summary.

I'm a student of photography at Newcastle college with a passion for fashion photography and this year I have an exciting opportunity. The opportunity to showcase my work in the capital at the end of June.

The Free Range 2016 exhibition, held in London, has been established since 2001 and for the first time Newcastle College is giving its students the chance to attend. I think it's fairly self explanatory as to why this is important to me. The chance to get my work seen in a professional environment with the potential to get my work seen by the right people is a chance I can't miss. Contributing to this campaign would mean I get to present my work in a high quality way, by affording the prints, framing, professional models and styling.

I'm looking to raise about £200 for the exhibition but the site only allows me to put a minimum of £500 so please help me reach my goal.

Where & When.

Free Range is at the Old Truman Brewery, London E1 6QR
Dates: 30th June - 4th July 2016
Private viewing: Thursday (6pm - 10pm)
Open to the public: Friday - Sunday (10am - 7pm) and Monday (10am - 4pm)

What I Need & What You Get.

The majority of the funding will be for the photoshoot itself for the pieces exhibited. I have been quoted from a professional modelling agency in the Newcastle area for the hire of professional models for the shoot, for this I need funding. On top of the models I also need funding for a professional makeup artist. Other funding needs are as mentioned before the printing costs, framing costs and also to pay for my travel needs. I will be travelling from Newcastle, and although I have already secured accommodation I do need to find the funding to commute on the days require to be there.
 
The main perk I have is a package that includes a signed piece from the exhibition, a personalised thank you card and inclusion in the sponsored list.

The Impact.

The opportunity isn't just for myself, but because the exhibition is going to be covered by the media and professional industry visitors then contributors will have their own exposure in the form of a sponsored list which will also be exhibited along with my pieces. It is an opportunity for you or your company to be featured.

Risks & Challenges.

With this campaign I don't feel there are any risks that involve the contributors. There is always the risk of timing but because the places have already been secured, I have no option of any delays, therefore there is minimal risk in contributing.

story:
Detroit Research is a new journal of Art + Criticism. A group of artists and writers from the Alexandrine Street Seminars and College for Creative Studies alumni across the arts of ceramics / choreography / sculpture / post-studio art / social practice / music / performance / and critical theory felt the need for a new journal to capture the exciting historical and emerging arts scene and practices which Detroit has witnessed coming together these past ten years. We also wanted the journal to be a vehicle for artist research / critical studies. Most of all, we wanted the journal to represent the contemporary art scene of Detroit in a national and international setting and in turn to be a place where national and international issues in art + practice could be debated in a critical language. Vol. 1 (On Space) had Scott Hocking as the featured artist. Volume 2 (On Dance), due out in May, will see Marie T. Hermann as the featured artist; and volume 3 (On Sounds / Music) will see Kevin Beasley as the featured artist.

With help from the Knight Foundation, the College for Creative Studies, friends, and supporters Volume 1 of Detroit Research was launched at the Museum of Contemporary Art, Detroit (MOCAD) in March 2015 with resounding success. Since then Detroit Research in collaboration with the College for Creative Studies was the recipient of a Knight Arts Challenge Grant of $30,000 conditional on raising matching funds.

Many artists and writers both inside and beyond Detroit and across the arts – McArthur Binion, Michael E. Smith, Leni Sinclair, Vievee Francis, Marie T. Hermann, Tyanna Buie, Paul Kotula, just to name a few – have generously donated works to be sold through Indiegogo in a fundraiser for Detroit Research to meet the Knight Foundation matching fund goal.

We invite you to donate, to buy copies of the journal, or any of the great art work donated by artists in support of Detroit Research. 

Visit our website at www.detroitresearch.org 
Read Detroit Research Vol. 1 at www.detroitresearch.org/volume1/ ‎

story_txt:
Detroit Research is a new journal of Art + Criticism. A group of artists and writers from the Alexandrine Street Seminars and College for Creative Studies alumni across the arts of ceramics / choreography / sculpture / post-studio art / social practice / music / performance / and critical theory felt the need for a new journal to capture the exciting historical and emerging arts scene and practices which Detroit has witnessed coming together these past ten years. We also wanted the journal to be a vehicle for artist research / critical studies. Most of all, we wanted the journal to represent the contemporary art scene of Detroit in a national and international setting and in turn to be a place where national and international issues in art + practice could be debated in a critical language. Vol. 1 (On Space) had Scott Hocking as the featured artist. Volume 2 (On Dance), due out in May, will see Marie T. Hermann as the featured artist; and volume 3 (On Sounds / Music) will see Kevin Beasley as the featured artist.With help from the Knight Foundation, the College for Creative Studies, friends, and supporters Volume 1 of Detroit Research was launched at the Museum of Contemporary Art, Detroit (MOCAD) in March 2015 with resounding success. Since then Detroit Research in collaboration with the College for Creative Studies was the recipient of a Knight Arts Challenge Grant of $30,000 conditional on raising matching funds.Many artists and writers both inside and beyond Detroit and across the arts – McArthur Binion, Michael E. Smith, Leni Sinclair, Vievee Francis, Marie T. Hermann, Tyanna Buie, Paul Kotula, just to name a few – have generously donated works to be sold through Indiegogo in a fundraiser for Detroit Research to meet the Knight Foundation matching fund goal.We invite you to donate, to buy copies of the journal, or any of the great art work donated by artists in support of Detroit Research. Visit our website at www.detroitresearch.org Read Detroit Research Vol. 1 at www.detroitresearch.org/volume1/ ‎

story:
“Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.”  ~ P. Picasso

The artwork becomes interactive when there is a viewer, and the viewer becomes a participant in the scene. Some contemplate gazing at the pieces, and some simply enjoy being surrounded with artworks. Being an artist is not usually a choice; some higher drive pushes us to create whether we are appreciated or not, and we sacrifice so much in the process. Hi, I'm Ozlem Paker, in short 'Oz'... a female multimedia artist born and raised in Istanbul, matured in New York, and currently living in Los Angeles. Being a practicing artist over 20 years, I have been employing concepts such as human psyche, human journey on earth, women's and children's issues, existential issues, etc. As a female being, born in a repressed society, I had to overcome many obstacles throughout all of my education in Turkey. However, these also encouraged me express myself freely, and to be determined to follow my own path.
 

So, My Dear Art-Lover Friends and Patrons of Arts, I’d like to update you with the recent news of my studio-practice… 

Just recently, in the beginning of July, I moved from Istanbul to Los Angeles with my family. As you may be aware of the war and political situation in Turkey, as an artist, it has been unbearable to live and work in Turkey. In 2002, we had moved from New York to Istanbul hoping for better days, and they were there for a while. However in the last 8 years, with the oppressive government policies, and with an unvisible-to-naked-eye war, the situation badly escalated, and the hope for better days died. It is unlikely that they will arrive anytime soon.

We are fine, settling in slowly, looking for new projects, contacts and opportunities that life will offer us. My 10-year-old son adapted quickly to his new school and friends. Here, I am hopeful for the future, I appreciate life and I am ready to create openly and freely. In the meantime, I am establishing my new studio, working on new projects, and for that I need your supports by simply being art collectors, in other words art patrons. Because you own some of my work and/or you have expressed interest in my art, here is a great opportunity to own some more. Let's help funding my new studio practice, and feel the satisfaction and joy of being an art patron!



 

What I Need & What You Get

With your contributions, I will part with some of my existing works, and make space for the new ones. I will also be able to effort a larger studio space, a storage for existing pieces, and enough time to progress with my new projects without any distractions, and still will be able to attend my son’s needs while he is adjusting to a new life. Items I need:

• A new video camera
• Video equipment
• Studio equipment
• Canvas, wood, paint and other materials 
• Printing budget, etc.

All contributors will have the option of receiving original artworks or limited edition prints, and the pride that goes with being a patron of the arts!

Contributors will also receive email updates documenting my process, along with pictures of works in progress. 

There’s something for virtually every budget. And remember: Art makes a very unique gift! 

Please examine the several different options that I am offering you. All items here are below their original prices. Once you claim your choice, I will send you the artwork in 1-3 weeks after the campaign ends. You are always welcome for a studio visit, if you’re in or around LA. Please feel free to comment, ask questions and to share this page with friends who you think may support my cause. If you would like to be a recurring patron of my practice, please write to me privately at ozlempaker@gmail.com. If your company is looking to give away tax-deductible donations to a 501(c)3 organization, I can also direct you to another link; so, let me know please.


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!.. Whether you give financially or not, you can help further by sharing the link to this campaign with your friends on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, via email or telling someone by text or word of mouth. You can make a huge contribution to the success of the campaign by making some noise and getting the word out however you like to do it. If you can introduce me to galleries or curators that you personally know, it would be also a great help.

 

For more information about my works and biography, you may visit http://ozlempaker.com and https://www.facebook.com/ozlempakerart.
You may also follow me: http://instagram/ozpakerart
http://twitter.com/ozlempaker

 

Thanks for believing in arts and artists!

With the hope of a better year,

OZ...

 


 


 



 


 

#artistherapy #arttherapy #ozpaker #ozlempaker #ozlempakerart #ozpakerart #female #male #body #video #multimedia #mixedmedia #contemporary #art #nature #pattern #structure #architecture #humanrights #feminism #activism

story:
ABOUT THE ARTIST      

Hi, my name is Lori Shorin. I'm  a figurative sculptor working in Jersey City, New Jersey. My passion to sculpt the human form led me to study at the Florence Academy of Art in Florence, Italy from 2006-2010.  For four years, I was immersed in sculpting, drawing, and studying the anatomy of the human figure.  Countless hours of training prepared me to express my inner visions through the medium of sculpture.

WHY THE MEAM MUSEUM in BARCELONA, SPAIN?

The sculpture Spiritual Sisters participated in a three-month  exhibition called Figurativas 2015 at the Museu Europeu d’Art Modern (MEAM museum) in Barcelona, Spain.  Over 2,500 artists competed to have their artworks displayed in this beautiful venue in the Borne section of Barcelona, near the Picasso museum.  MEAM attracts thousands of international visitors each year. Having my sculpture in the permanent collection at MEAM will greatly increase the exposure of my art to a wide variety of individuals from around the world.  When I saw my sculpture in the museum for the opening ceremony of the exhibition, I realized that I had found a new and special home for Spiritual Sisters.

MEAM was created by restoring the old Gomis Palace and has been open to the public since 2006. Restoration and purchasing artworks to build a permanent art collection for the museum has been a very costly undertaking. The museum only has partial funds to purchase my sculpture, so I need your help to complete this acquisition. It's important to me that the sculpture is in a collection with other figurative artworks created by my contemporaries. The sculpture will be well maintained and available for many to appreciate now and in the future. Your contributions will help my artwork to be in a place where it can be seen by a large audience.

FUNDING GOAL

My funding goal is $43,000.  

This sculpture took about 18 months from the original conception of the idea to final casting in bronze.  I spent many a late night sculpting,  sometimes until sunrise. Beyond my creative time, there were a lot of costs involved in making this sculpture.

The costs for making the Spiritual Sisters sculpture:

 ​

$9,800 for a Silicone mold by professional mold maker.

$300 delivery of clay sculpture to the mold maker 

$12,000 for Bronze casting at the foundry.

$2,775 Shipping USA to Spain, Customs Broker fees

$500 Sculpting materials

$800 Model fees

$650 Videographers for Indiegogo campaign.

$2,500+ Fabrication of the perks. This amount will be higher depending on the quantity of artworks contributors order.

TOTAL COSTS=$29,325 USD

A total of 8% plus transactions fees will be deducted from the total amount raised.

Indiegogo’s platform fee = (5%).

Third party fees for payment processors = 3% plus 30 cents per transaction for credit card.

CREATIVE TIME AND PROCESS:  The initial stages included making drawings and small clay composition sketches until I arrived at the final design. Next, I built the stand and armature, the structure that hoods the clay. The bulk of my creative time,  represents approximately 1,600 hours, was spent sculpting the two figures in clay. I worked with live models, and from imagination. I primarily worked with professional models and periodically had pregnant women pose to better portray the unique qualities of pregnancy.  The mold making process  was done by a professional mold maker.  The next  part is called chasing the wax, which is a preparation for the bronze casting. Once the bronze is cast metal workers have a big job to weld, grind, hammer, and chase the metal in preparation for the patina. The patina is a chemical process in which oxidizes the bronze to give it the rich warm browns and light dusting of green.       

    

In total it was a truly a wonderful experience and a labor of love and I hope you will be inspired to contribute.

THE PERKS 

          

SMALL BRONZE SPIRITUAL SISTERS $6,750

This is the most special and featured perk!!!! The bronze is a small scale bronze of "Spiritual Sisters" signed by the artist. Measurements 15w" x 7.25h" x 6.5d".    This sculpture comes with a certificate of authenticity. 
In addition to owning the bronze sculpture, your name will be on a bronze plaque at the MEAM museum in Barcelona, Spain! You will also receive an additional surprise artwork signed by the artist when the funding goal is reached!!! 
Each one will be cast to order, allow 12 weeks for delivery.

 

BRONZE PORTRAIT on Black Belgian Marble base from Spiritual Sisters  $4,750. Plus, Your name on a bronze  patron plaque on display at the MEAM museum.

Bronze portrait bust from Spiritual Sisters on black marble base, signed by the artist. This bronze sculpture has a classical patina that will get more beautiful over time. Cast in Pietrasanta, Italy.  This work measures approx. 12"h x 5" w x 7"deep. This sculpture comes with a certificate of authenticity.
In addition to owning the sculpture, your name will appear on a bronze plaque at the MEAM museum in Barcelona, Spain to honor the major supporters of this project.
Currently only shipping in the United States.  Additional shipping locations coming soon.

                                

 

 

BRONZE PORTRAIT on walnut wood base from Spiritual Sisters  $4,500. Plus, Your name on a bronze  patron plaque on display at the MEAM museum.

Bronze portrait bust from Spiritual Sisters on a walnut wood base, has a slightly different composition than the portrait bust on the marble base. It's signed by the artist. This bronze sculpture has a classical patina that will gets more beautiful over time.   This work measures approx. 12"h x 5" w x 7"deep. This sculpture comes with a certificate of authenticity.
In addition to owning the sculpture, your name will appear on a bronze plaque at the MEAM museum in Barcelona, Spain to honor the major supporters of this project.
Currently only shipping in the United States.  Additional shipping locations coming soon.

                                            
Pictured in the video on the left the is bronze portrait on Belgian Marble, and on the right is the Aqua-Resin on a walnut base.  The white sculpture is a plaster cast of the full sculpture that was displayed at the Florence Academy of Art Alumni Exhibition, where it won an honorable mention.  Plaster portraits are also available and will have the same composition as the aqua-resin portrait in the above video. 
 

Portrait Bust from Spiritual Sisters in Aqua-Resin $1,000 This sculpture has a bronze metal coating on the aqua-resin cast of the portrait from "Spiritual Sister", it looks like bronze because the metal coating contains bronze particles. The metal coating is an acrylic based.  The patina is a  a classical brown bronze with hints of  light green. The portrait bust will be mounted on a wood base signed by the artist.

 

Plaster portrait bust of Spiritual Sisters on wood base.  $450The plaster portrait of Spiritual Sister is available and will have the same composition as the aqua-resin in the above video. Currently only ships in the USA.  Worldwide coming soon.

 

PRIVATE 3 DAY FIGURE OR PORTRAIT WORKSHOP IN MY STUDIO

Your choice of a Private 3 full day of a Figure or Portrait Sculpture Class in my studio at Mana Contemporary in Jersey City, NJ!!! Experience 1-on-1 instruction and demonstrations. There will be a model for 6 hours each of the 3 days!  I will also provide the armature, clay, and lunch. Suitable for all levels.Schedule can be Friday- Sunday or Wed- Friday, depending on the month you select. The hours are somewhat flexible, and I recommend 9am-4pm or 10am-5pm, 11-6 is an option as well. Housing and transportation is not included. The studio is accessible by pubic transportation and close to New York City.  Feel free to contact me with any questions about this perk.  Lshorin@gmail.com

Front of Bookmark

Back of Bookmark

PRINTABLE BOOKMARK $1

We're on the same page!  Thank you for your support! Print out and create your own bookmark with an image of "Spiritual Sisters" on the front and back. Just follow the easy instructions.  I'll be giving you a shout out on social media via Facebook!  Thank you!!!

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

There are no risks associated with the sculpture, as the bronze sculpture Spiritual Sisters has successfully been created and shipped to the museum.  

Risk with the perks apply to the delivery time.  Most of the perks will be made to order, while others have been created already and waiting for you to select them.  Feel free to email me with any questions related to your selection.  Lshorin@gmail.com.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Spread the news about this project by word of mouth, email, text, social media to 10 people you feel would most likely support this project. Sending good vibes is welcome too! : )

$800 Model fees
$650 Videographers for Indiegogo campaign.
$2,500+ Fabrication of the perks. This amount will be higher depending on the quantity of artworks contributors order.
TOTAL COSTS=$29,325 USD
A total of 8% plus transactions fees will be deducted from the total amount raised.
Indiegogo’s platform fee = (5%).
Third party fees for payment processors = 3% plus 30 cents per transaction for credit card.
CREATIVE TIME AND PROCESS:  The initial stages included making drawings and small clay composition sketches until I arrived at the final design. Next, I built the stand and armature, the structure that hoods the clay. The bulk of my creative time,  represents approximately 1,600 hours, was spent sculpting the two figures in clay. I worked with live models, and from imagination. I primarily worked with professional models and periodically had pregnant women pose to better portray the unique qualities of pregnancy.  The mold making process  was done by a professional mold maker.  The next  part is called chasing the wax, which is a preparation for the bronze casting. Once the bronze is cast metal workers have a big job to weld, grind, hammer, and chase the metal in preparation for the patina. The patina is a chemical process in which oxidizes the bronze to give it the rich warm browns and light dusting of green.       
    
In total it was a truly a wonderful experience and a labor of love and I hope you will be inspired to contribute.
THE PERKS 
          
SMALL BRONZE SPIRITUAL SISTERS $6,750
This is the most special and featured perk!!!! The bronze is a small scale bronze of "Spiritual Sisters" signed by the artist. Measurements 15w" x 7.25h" x 6.5d".    This sculpture comes with a certificate of authenticity. In addition to owning the bronze sculpture, your name will be on a bronze plaque at the MEAM museum in Barcelona, Spain! You will also receive an additional surprise artwork signed by the artist when the funding goal is reached!!! Each one will be cast to order, allow 12 weeks for delivery.
 
BRONZE PORTRAIT on Black Belgian Marble base from Spiritual Sisters  $4,750. Plus, Your name on a bronze  patron plaque on display at the MEAM museum.
Bronze portrait bust from Spiritual Sisters on black marble base, signed by the artist. This bronze sculpture has a classical patina that will get more beautiful over time. Cast in Pietrasanta, Italy.  This work measures approx. 12"h x 5" w x 7"deep. This sculpture comes with a certificate of authenticity.In addition to owning the sculpture, your name will appear on a bronze plaque at the MEAM museum in Barcelona, Spain to honor the major supporters of this project.Currently only shipping in the United States.  Additional shipping locations coming soon.
                                

 
 
BRONZE PORTRAIT on walnut wood base from Spiritual Sisters  $4,500. Plus, Your name on a bronze  patron plaque on display at the MEAM museum.
Bronze portrait bust from Spiritual Sisters on a walnut wood base, has a slightly different composition than the portrait bust on the marble base. It's signed by the artist. This bronze sculpture has a classical patina that will gets more beautiful over time.   This work measures approx. 12"h x 5" w x 7"deep. This sculpture comes with a certificate of authenticity.In addition to owning the sculpture, your name will appear on a bronze plaque at the MEAM museum in Barcelona, Spain to honor the major supporters of this project.Currently only shipping in the United States.  Additional shipping locations coming soon.
                                            

Pictured in the video on the left the is bronze portrait on Belgian Marble, and on the right is the Aqua-Resin on a walnut base.  The white sculpture is a plaster cast of the full sculpture that was displayed at the Florence Academy of Art Alumni Exhibition, where it won an honorable mention.  Plaster portraits are also available and will have the same composition as the aqua-resin portrait in the above video. 
 
Portrait Bust from Spiritual Sisters in Aqua-Resin $1,000 This sculpture has a bronze metal coating on the aqua-resin cast of the portrait from "Spiritual Sister", it looks like bronze because the metal coating contains bronze particles. The metal coating is an acrylic based.  The patina is a  a classical brown bronze with hints of  light green. The portrait bust will be mounted on a wood base signed by the artist.
 
Plaster portrait bust of Spiritual Sisters on wood base.  $450The plaster portrait of Spiritual Sister is available and will have the same composition as the aqua-resin in the above video. Currently only ships in the USA.  Worldwide coming soon.
 
PRIVATE 3 DAY FIGURE OR PORTRAIT WORKSHOP IN MY STUDIO
Your choice of a Private 3 full day of a Figure or Portrait Sculpture Class in my studio at Mana Contemporary in Jersey City, NJ!!! Experience 1-on-1 instruction and demonstrations. There will be a model for 6 hours each of the 3 days!  I will also provide the armature, clay, and lunch. Suitable for all levels.Schedule can be Friday- Sunday or Wed- Friday, depending on the month you select. The hours are somewhat flexible, and I recommend 9am-4pm or 10am-5pm, 11-6 is an option as well. Housing and transportation is not included. The studio is accessible by pubic transportation and close to New York City.  Feel free to contact me with any questions about this perk.  Lshorin@gmail.com

Front of Bookmark

Back of Bookmark
PRINTABLE BOOKMARK $1
We're on the same page!  Thank you for your support! Print out and create your own bookmark with an image of "Spiritual Sisters" on the front and back. Just follow the easy instructions.  I'll be giving you a shout out on social media via Facebook!  Thank you!!!
 
RISKS AND CHALLENGES
There are no risks associated with the sculpture, as the bronze sculpture Spiritual Sisters has successfully been created and shipped to the museum.  
Risk with the perks apply to the delivery time.  Most of the perks will be made to order, while others have been created already and waiting for you to select them.  Feel free to email me with any questions related to your selection.  Lshorin@gmail.com.
 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Spread the news about this project by word of mouth, email, text, social media to 10 people you feel would most likely support this project. Sending good vibes is welcome too! : )

story:
Short Summary

Under the helm of HELLHOUNDdesign lies Luka Riot, science fiction and fantasy obsessed artist and self-taught jeweller. Through the GALACTIC MYTHOS series, she uses acrylics to create new galaxies on canvas, elements of our own Earth to channel the stars into jewellery, and metal weaves to form pieces of wearable armour. Bringing the cosmos down to Earth, Luka is now venturing into the illustration world using elements of our world's flora and fauna to create otherworldly beings. What started as extraterrestrial doodles, quickly spiraled into a passion project rushing to reach completion in time for Christmas.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Printing books isn't cheap, and neither are the custom lapel pins we're offering, so here's an outline of where your money will be going:

  • 810$ for the initial printing of 100 books
  • 410$ for a limited run of 100 lapel pins
  • 180$ for various printing costs (art prints, pin backing, stickers, etc)
  • 100$ for the paper and pens used to draw the designs
  • 100$ for various packing and shipping materials
  • 80$ for vending space at the Frostbite edition of the Bazaar of the Bizarre in Toronto December 13th, where the book will be officially launched!

This leaves 320$ to go towards various fees, graphic design, and other last minute costs that may present themselves (and they always do).

 

The Impact

The adult colouring book trend has evolved from a simple need for stress relief among debt-ridden millenials and adults of all ages. The GALACTIC MYTHOS series will provide you with detailed alien lifeforms to bring to life as you see fit, with each design printed on its own sheet of paper to ease the framing of your final work. From one stressed millenial to the world, each detailed page will provide you with hours of calm-down time as you bring these original creations to life.

 

Risks & Challenges

Self-publishing is full of hurdles, from trying to market a new book with no knowledge of advertising, to the basic need for funding to get going in the first place. Raising credit limits is one option, but we prefer to reach out to our customers. Being a lifelong artist, meeting the print deadline for creation of new aliens is a daunting but manageable task for Luka. We hope to garner enough interest in this campaign to avoid any financial issues from tackling this project on our own.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help! Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word to your friends and family.

In an effort to gain enough funding to bring our creations to you, we have also set up a Patreon account at http://www.patreon.com/HELLHOUNDdesign where you can sign up to donate any monthly amount you choose in exchange for bonus colouring pages to print at home as many times as you'd like!

 

Thank You

Each new eye on our page brings us closer to achieving our publication costs. Whether you've pledged funds, signed up for our Patreon, or simply glossed over and shared this page with your network, we thank you for taking the time to bring life to these new beings on paper.

story:
Short Summary:

Black Fox Studios is the game studio name I am looking at to officially produce Die Nachtblume - The Night Flower RPG. That means in addition to working on the game, mapping out events and control flows, we have to register and file a business. Write up business plans. We have the game halfway draft complete (we're continually having testing rounds to improve it as we go), but now it's time to really step up. 

You can see the game trailer here: 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

This is how we reached the number for the total budget: 

  • $300 (3 months) goes to Baltimore Game Lab for use of their facilities; 
  • $500 initial marketing budget - $300 of this budget is reserved for logo creation; 
  • $500 for custom music budget;
  • $1000 for custom pixel art commissions (3 bosses, battlers and field sprites for each) 
  • $200 for business registration and initial fees/costs associated with such; 
  • $100 Steam Greenlight submission fee;
  • The remainder is padding/overflow due to IGG platform fees/percentages, any rush orders, shipping and handling of any materials like table drop cloths, etc. Basically, a built-in emergency fund. 

The Impact

 

  • A new, woman-owned game studio. Huzzah! Paperwork and all. 
  • A game. A GAME. Also: with key mapping / controller support and a chance to be on Steam!
  • Commercial games require money to start up, and unfortunately in the past I have been focused on keeping a roof over my head. Homelessness means no game work can be done. The funds I have raised in the past, though, have enabled me to get some custom assets for Chapters 1 and 2, such as several tracks (the Trumlui Cathedral theme, the battle theme, the theme for the Arcadia segment in Chapter 2...) and helped me demo the game at Playcrafting NYC in 2015.  I want this to get off the ground, with your help! 
  • Also, it's an RPG with vampires in it. 

Risks & Challenges

I have crowdfunded towards this game before. But I made the mistake of aiming too low ($800), and at the time, I was also fighting homelessness. Not a good combination to try and do creative works. The money raised did, however, go into paying artists for what I have in the game so far: custom music (such as the battle theme, cathedral music, and two forest themes), and in obtaining licenses for art packs and additional music packs used in Die Nachtblume. 

  • I am the only person working on programming/map tiling/dialogue, so there may be delays due to balancing my own survival needs (shelter, food, medicine) with game development.
  • Even if I am not fully funded, the game will still release - it will just take longer.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share this campaign!
  • If you really can't share, there are other things you can do, that are longer term than backing a campaign. Encourage a kid to get into tech, especially if they're from a marginalized community. Or volunteer at your local library. Don't dismiss someone's dreams out of hand. Stories are powerful.  Encourage them.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Peace and welcome to my campaign in assisting me in Becoming.

My name is Taeesha Muhammad, and  I am a New York-based, mixed-media collagist who is inspired by re-imagining materials to look past what was, and create something new. I transform found objects in contemporary ways to create a new conversation on a traditional piece. I have an exciting opportunity to study abroad and expand my influences internationally. As a native Brooklynite, I have been exposed to numerous cultures and ethnicities on a daily basis, but the chance to immerse myself in the culture, aesthetics, flavors, sounds, and images of another country as an artist is incredibly exciting. I have been accepted to my first  Artist Residency at the Green Olive Arts in Tetouan, Morocco. This is an important and necessary next phase of my artistic journey. My plan is to study the mosaics and the architecture of the city.  I have focused on deconstructing mosaics for some time, and in the residency, I will get to work alongside master artisans and understand the craft from each stage to completion.

The Journey: During the residency, I will learn, study, and develop a new body of work, actively engaging in the culture of Morocco and its people. I look forward to increasing my artistic vernacular though the rich colors, textures and history of the masjids, marketplaces, and unique imprint of the cities I will inhabit. I also look forward to the opportunity to engage with people in a culture that will challenge me to see the world in new terms. It is a natural progression into the beginning of What Comes Next.

Challenges: The opportunity to fully immerse myself in my artistic practice without the everyday life responsibilities, challenges and distractions is a unique blessing that few of us have. As a working mother, I am fully aware of this challenge, and I will create and produce works that honor the sacrifices made by my family to make this happen for me so that I don't have to worry about them (too much!) back home. 

Travel: God willing, I will leave for Tetouan on January 30th and spend three weeks in the city, studying, learning and creating. Then I will spend an additional week in the city of Marrakesh for the 6th annual Marrakech Biennale. There I will be mingling with artists from all over the world at the open ceremonies and going to exhibitions. I hope to spending additional time there touring studios and museums and ultimately returning to Tetuan for the flight back to the states.


The Goal: My goal is to raise $6,000 to pay for my residency at Green Olive Arts for the month of February and incidentals associated with additional travel between Madrid, Marrakesh and Tetouan.

  • Round Trip Flight     1300.

  • Residency Fees        2900.

  • Transportation            200.

  • Language Classes      200.

  • Tours                              150.

  • Artist Supplies            600.

  • Meals                             400.

  • Travel Insurance        450.

Other ways to assist me:

  •  Send me positive vibes, wish me well, and spread the word!

story:
The goal of For the Love of the Black Man is to bring back the love, and self-esteem to the Black man population. This is significant in that the Black man has been conditioned to believe he is only limited to certain life paths that come with the stereotypes of being a Black man, when in reality it is him who has created this land and the resources upon it. With the strength of the Black man's self-esteem and ego, and knowing of his responsibility within the family, it is my belief that all of his people and those surrounding him will also rise. It is time the Black man learns his true power. 

The funds collected for this project will provide the proper materials, mounting of images, travel, etc for the presentation and showing on April 4th, 2016. The goal is to raise enough money to make it a country wide showing starting in NYC, DC, New Orleans, and Los Angeles. Each city requires a venue for rent, which is what most of the money is being collected for. The financial support is also necessary in creating a coffee book and DVD that our people can be proud of.

DIRECT LINK TO 'FOR THE LOVE OF THE BLACK MAN' POETRY BOOK: http://www.blurb.com/b/6873374-for-the-love-of-...
