story:
Hello, thank you for coming to this page!

ME

My name is KiRa, I am a multidisciplinary award winning artist, and am dedicated to creating immersive and sensual artwork. I have worked with the likes of Secret Cinema, London Contemporary Orchestra and Vivienne Westwood. You can find more  about me and my work here: www.dotkira.com

TEAM - BREATHING HUMAN BEINGS

I am collaborating with designer/architect Michael Obrizkiv, who is creating the main structure of full scale Symbiosis, out of circular modules. His amazing work can be found here http://www.mikeodesigner.com/. And engineer Adrian Godwin is working on electronics and making the magic happen. 

PROJECT

The project «Symbiosis» is my first interactive installation, and our collaboration. The aim is to merge technology with art to create an experience that connects people, through bringing awareness to the primordial element of breath. I wish to make people feel empowered, like the creators of the world breathing in life to animate it!

The installation visualises the participants' breathing in LED lights, creating awareness of breath through visual feedback, and stimulating the participants to synchronise their breathing that animates the structure as a whole, creating symbiosis. The installation stimulates beneficial diaphragm breathing. Breathing with awareness engages the cerebral cortex stimulating evolved areas of the brain, and creates a calm and expanded state of mind for everyone participating.

With the technical support from Adrian Godwin, I have created the first self-funded prototype of the installation where the audience’s breathing is measured with the respiratory movement sensor belt. Two members of the audience sit opposite each other with their breath visualized in a form of multicolour spirals that move from opposite directions of the tunnel. When the spirals meet they merge into one white light. It is a new form of communication beyond inhibitions!

We have shown the first prototype at Nepal Fundraiser Exhibition in May, at Breaking Convention in Greenwich and Incloodu Festival of Deaf Arts in RichMix. There was great response, people connecting without the need for speech or sign language, people getting into tantric moods with their partners, simply meditating, or having a breathing light face off with their friends. One testimonial reads:

'Interactive work 'Symbiosis' by Kira Zhi features a light vortex controlled with your breathing, it's like a video game for the new age creating light and patterns where you can 'face off' with another partner...I can imagine this in a larger space surrounding you with more participants, it was amazing!'


FUND SYMBIOSIS

So far the prototype has been completely self funded.  I am now working on making the installation as a fully immersive amazing experience! With the aim to fulfil the original dream to create a structure that breathes and lights up with the participators breathing inside it. The dome like structure will be inspired by forms found in nature, and Michael had an idea of creating a circular modular structure, which has never been done before. 

the aim is to create a breathing space :

-where a group of people can participate (estimated about 20people)
-using wireless sensor technology                                                                                                  - in a form of an organic dome structure, mimicking a micro organism that breathes  once the participants breath syncs. 

Here is a technical drawing of what we plan:

At the moment the total cost of the project is estimated at about £9.000.
The project will be created step by step, depending on the funds we receive. One of the reasons for starting the crowdfunding was to fund travelling expenses and some of the material costs to festivals that will allow us access more funds. There are a few festivals that are interested in exhibiting the work, particularly Burning Man regionals, but they all have limited funds, and wont cover full costs.
The main costs for the structure are: 

- materials for the structure - plywood modules - CNC cutting (£2400), 

- waterproof cover - £600

- LED lights and controllers - £1500 

- wireless sensors - £1000

- power - £200

- fabrics - £900

-  fans - £400

£1.500 will give me an opportunity to

- cover costs for prototyping materials  

- cover travel costs to festivals to push the project further and raise more funds. 

- organise a special preview VIP event in London just for the backers to come to and see the installation in large scale for the first time. 

a model visualisation of how it could look:

 

I will appreciate any kind of support, and however much you give it will all go into making an incredible experience for everyone, as that is my primary intention! 


UPDATE:  We are working hard on building the structure even if we dont receive all the funding, the project will be taken at stages. So even if it wont be fully breathing it will be fully responsive. At the moment we are hoping that you could come to a special preview of the immersive LED breathing structure at a secret location on June 23, 2016, in London. 

PERKS

You can donate any amount you feel comfortable with if you dont wish to buy the perks! With any amount over £12, you will receive an invitation to the exclusive preview of the installation which will be a special catered event. And, of course, with any contribution, you will receive the invitation to the public view and a special mention on the event page!

The preview and exhibition details will be updated in the course of the development. But it will be held at a secret location around London by 2017.

And if you do wish to invest in an amazing experience and also get a unique art piece to own, here are some details about the artwork perks. I have also priced them at a fraction of a price they worth, so that its an affordable investment.

Art Work

You can choose one of the prints from 'Drawings made by the Sea' Series. The 50x70 meditative image is printed on alluminium with a shiny sandy texture that reflects lighting. Original Price for this was £400.

 

Whatever your input, thank you for seeing this campaign and 
I hope that you will come to breathe at Symbiosis !
story_txt:
Hello, thank you for coming to this page!MEMy name is KiRa, I am a multidisciplinary award winning artist, and am dedicated to creating immersive and sensual artwork. I have worked with the likes of Secret Cinema, London Contemporary Orchestra and Vivienne Westwood. You can find more  about me and my work here: www.dotkira.comTEAM - BREATHING HUMAN BEINGS
I am collaborating with designer/architect Michael Obrizkiv, who is creating the main structure of full scale Symbiosis, out of circular modules. His amazing work can be found here http://www.mikeodesigner.com/. And engineer Adrian Godwin is working on electronics and making the magic happen. PROJECTThe project «Symbiosis» is my first interactive installation, and our collaboration. The aim is to merge technology with art to create an experience that connects people, through bringing awareness to the primordial element of breath. I wish to make people feel empowered, like the creators of the world breathing in life to animate it!The installation visualises the participants' breathing in LED lights, creating awareness of breath through visual feedback, and stimulating the participants to synchronise their breathing that animates the structure as a whole, creating symbiosis. The installation stimulates beneficial diaphragm breathing. Breathing with awareness engages the cerebral cortex stimulating evolved areas of the brain, and creates a calm and expanded state of mind for everyone participating.With the technical support from Adrian Godwin, I have created the first self-funded prototype of the installation where the audience’s breathing is measured with the respiratory movement sensor belt. Two members of the audience sit opposite each other with their breath visualized in a form of multicolour spirals that move from opposite directions of the tunnel. When the spirals meet they merge into one white light. It is a new form of communication beyond inhibitions!
We have shown the first prototype at Nepal Fundraiser Exhibition in May, at Breaking Convention in Greenwich and Incloodu Festival of Deaf Arts in RichMix. There was great response, people connecting without the need for speech or sign language, people getting into tantric moods with their partners, simply meditating, or having a breathing light face off with their friends. One testimonial reads:
'Interactive work 'Symbiosis' by Kira Zhi features a light vortex controlled with your breathing, it's like a video game for the new age creating light and patterns where you can 'face off' with another partner...I can imagine this in a larger space surrounding you with more participants, it was amazing!'

FUND SYMBIOSIS
So far the prototype has been completely self funded.  I am now working on making the installation as a fully immersive amazing experience! With the aim to fulfil the original dream to create a structure that breathes and lights up with the participators breathing inside it. The dome like structure will be inspired by forms found in nature, and Michael had an idea of creating a circular modular structure, which has never been done before. 
the aim is to create a breathing space :
-where a group of people can participate (estimated about 20people)-using wireless sensor technology                                                                                                  - in a form of an organic dome structure, mimicking a micro organism that breathes  once the participants breath syncs. 
Here is a technical drawing of what we plan:


At the moment the total cost of the project is estimated at about £9.000.The project will be created step by step, depending on the funds we receive. One of the reasons for starting the crowdfunding was to fund travelling expenses and some of the material costs to festivals that will allow us access more funds. There are a few festivals that are interested in exhibiting the work, particularly Burning Man regionals, but they all have limited funds, and wont cover full costs.The main costs for the structure are: 
- materials for the structure - plywood modules - CNC cutting (£2400), 
- waterproof cover - £600
- LED lights and controllers - £1500 
- wireless sensors - £1000
- power - £200
- fabrics - £900
-  fans - £400
£1.500 will give me an opportunity to
- cover costs for prototyping materials  
- cover travel costs to festivals to push the project further and raise more funds. 
- organise a special preview VIP event in London just for the backers to come to and see the installation in large scale for the first time. 
a model visualisation of how it could look:


 
I will appreciate any kind of support, and however much you give it will all go into making an incredible experience for everyone, as that is my primary intention! 

UPDATE:  We are working hard on building the structure even if we dont receive all the funding, the project will be taken at stages. So even if it wont be fully breathing it will be fully responsive. At the moment we are hoping that you could come to a special preview of the immersive LED breathing structure at a secret location on June 23, 2016, in London. 

PERKS
You can donate any amount you feel comfortable with if you dont wish to buy the perks! With any amount over £12, you will receive an invitation to the exclusive preview of the installation which will be a special catered event. And, of course, with any contribution, you will receive the invitation to the public view and a special mention on the event page!
The preview and exhibition details will be updated in the course of the development. But it will be held at a secret location around London by 2017.
And if you do wish to invest in an amazing experience and also get a unique art piece to own, here are some details about the artwork perks. I have also priced them at a fraction of a price they worth, so that its an affordable investment.
Art Work
You can choose one of the prints from 'Drawings made by the Sea' Series. The 50x70 meditative image is printed on alluminium with a shiny sandy texture that reflects lighting. Original Price for this was £400.
 
Whatever your input, thank you for seeing this campaign and I hope that you will come to breathe at Symbiosis !

story:
About us:

Mama Earth is an LA based community organization founded in 2007 by Jaime Kailani Bayot, big sister to international superstar Bruno Mars. Our mission is to use the power of art, music and nature to make a change for the better, locally and globally. We partner with schools, universities, community centers, hospitals and more to present all ages enrichment classes & events. The Mama Earth family extends to more than 40 countries like Brazil, Chile, Germany, Indonesia and the Philippines with young people planting trees, cleaning up neighborhoods and collecting clothes and toys for shelters and orphanages.

About Coloring Mandalas:

Twice a year, we take our COLORING MANDALAS project to Loma Linda University Children's Hospital to bring coloring kits to children and families stuck in their hospital rooms and also to color along with us. 

A mandala is a spiritual symbol representing the universe. Mandalas can be found in every culture and religion. Coloring Mandalas is way to express hidden parts of yourself and explore the spiritual process as it unfolds with color and texture.

Benefits of mandalas include:
1. Relieve tension, anxiety, fear and worry
2. Relax and heal the mind, body and spirit.
3. Stimulate creative thinking and problem-solving.

It's an ancient art form for all ages!

"Art helps kids to express themselves and not focus so much on the pain", says Myra Benitez, Manager of Social Work at Loma Linda University Children's Hospital.

What We Need 

We'll be back at Loma Linda University Children's Hospital this April 2016! We take Coloring Kits to the children that include several mandala coloring sheets, coloring tools (like pencils, crayons or markers) and a postcard insert with how-to directions.

It costs about $5 for each coloring kit. If we reach our goal, we can create 100 coloring kits! 

Our plan is to bring this project to more hospitals, shelters and places there are kids in need. The more money we raise, the more coloring kits we can provide to reach more children so please help us meet and exceed our goal!

The Impact of Art Therapy

When you contribute to this campaign, you are helping children in a profound way. Art therapy for children can provide kids with an easier way to express themselves since a young child is likely to be more comfortable expressing him/herself with some crayons and markers, for example, than he/she is going to be at expressing emotions and feelings through words. Art therapy can help children dealing with:

  • mental health problems
  • grief and/or loss 
  • learning disabilities
  • emotional problems
  • abuse of any kind
  • cancer or terminal illness

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and tell your friends and family about our campaign!

We Thank You!

story:
Hello fellow art lovers. I've never done anything like this before so bear with me as I explain to you why this fund is so important to me. 

My name is Kaia Nowatzki. I grew up in an art loving household and proceeded to get my Bachelor of Fine Arts emphasizing in Ceramics. Upon graduating from college I began to think about how I was going to be able to fund my passion and begin my business. I ultimately went back to school and obtained my Massage Therapy license (which is another passion of mine) as a way to supplement my art. I currently have a job as a massage therapist, but over the last year my schedule has cut into being able to create anything as I don't have a studio space and have to travel an two hours round trip to produce any work which usually ends up unfinished due to lack of time. Anything you are willing to donate will go towards finding a space, buying equipment, as well as clay and glazes. 
I primarily work with natural firing methods where wood is used as my main fuel source. After my first wood firing experience I fell head over heels in love with the process. Four days of feeding wood into a hungry kiln... I don't think you can get any better then that. Not to mention the relationships that are built with the rest of the firing crew, the food, and fun that takes place during a firing. I have been itching to get another firing under my belt, but until I am able to produce another body of work that won't happen.
I am very passionate about getting Tempt Feight Studio up and running. I would love for you to be a part of this journey.

story:
ABOUT THE CAMPAIGN

Dear friends, colleagues and supporters,

Earlier this year I was accepted to Yale's MFA Program. I also just found out I’ve been selected to participate in Skowhegan School of Painting & Sculpture, a summer artist residency in Maine and one of the most prestigious residencies around. This has come as a pleasant surprise. However, having to relocate to New Haven has left me financially strapped, and now preparing for Skowhegan presents another challenge.

I’ve created this Indiegogo campaign to give perks in exchange for your support to help me get to Skowhegan, and make new work when I get there.

Skowhegan accepts 65 artists from a pool of 2000 applicants each year. The intensive nine-week summer session, held in Maine, provides a collaborative and rigorous environment for artistic creation, risk-taking, and mentorship. Alumni often report that the intensity of the Skowhegan experience has had a profound effect on their work and their lives. In order to allow others entry to the program, no participants are allowed to return for a second summer. It is a once-in-a-lifetime experience.

I’m excited for this opportunity because it would provide me with the time, space, and facilities to experiment and challenge my practice. As a result, I would also be able to create new work to give to contributors of this campaign.

GOAL & PERKS

I need to raise $5,700 in four weeks.

Contributors will help me with paying the fees for Skowhegan, transportation, printing materials, equipment (2 strobe lights, 2 soft boxes, 2 light stands, 1 reflector, 1 battery for camera, and a 35mm lens), and shipping costs.

In return, I’m offering:

  1. Personalized poetry
  2. Inkjet Prints ranging in size from 4” x 6”, 8” x 10”, to 16” x 20”. All prints will be printed on Canson Baryta Photographique museum grade photo paper with a quarter inch border on the top and side. All content will come signed with a personal thank you note.
  3. For a more generous donation, you will receive a 20 image portfolio of 13” x 19” prints of your choice from one of three bodies of work I’ve created, in addition to one new 13” x 19” print I will create at Skowhegan, and an 8.5” x 11” calendar created at Skowhegan.

The three bodies of work can be seen on my website:

www.jonathanchacon.com

THE IMPACT

Contributions to this campaign will have a profound effect on my personal and artistic growth. I am equally excited to share my voice, as I am to learn from the 64 other participating artists and visiting faculty. This will be an invaluable experience. 

CAN’T DONATE?

Please share this Indiegogo campaign on your social media or with others you believe will be excited about the work. Sharing this campaign with others will help me as much as any donation. Even the smallest help I get from you means so much. I appreciate your help and continued support!

THANK YOU!


GALLERY

story:
Project Summary

My name is Greg Mason Burns, and I'm a visual artist and former journalist from Maine. I am redefining Surrealism with this tax-deductible project, the latter of which was initially developed during a five-year period that I spent in Brazil. It was inspired by the process of the eventual 2016 political coup d'etat and impeachment of Brazil's president.

I was motivated to pursue this project by the biased media reports in favor of the impeachment process. There were people in favor of impeachment and those against it, and the media, particularly the network Globo, heavily reported in favor and essentially ignored those who opposed. Thus a gap was created between the media's message and the audience's understanding of what they believed to be true. Knowing that this gap exists everywhere, and can be particularly seen in this year's US elections, I decided to take the idea of this "gap" to another level.

I am asking a specific question about this gap: What would that gap look like if it were an actual place instead of just a state of mind? 

In other words, if this gap were a real place, what would its people look like? Its churches? Schools? Cars? What would it feel like to live there? Can you imagine that? Would you like to?

The name Novo-surrealism was inspired by the events in Brazil (hence the Portuguese word novo ("new" in English)) and the surreal idea that this "gap" could actually be a real place. This is how I am redefining Surrealism.

This residency, in Lisbon, Portugal called Zaratan Air, is crucial to the project's success because it will allow me to develop the idea more. 

During the residency I will

  • Create a secret work of art (shared only by those who select a perk that includes this)
  • Work on a community-fed website that will help to redefine how the audience interacts with the media (see video)
  • Finalize a plan for launching and exhibiting the website
  • Create various studies for future work for two exhibits in 2017 and for the perks for this campaign

How the funds will be used

  • Travel expenses from Maine to Portugal and back, and also around Portugal itself
  • The cost of the residency itself
  • Art supplies
  • Time away from the real world to create a solid timeline and more defined strategic steps.

The Impact

When you think about how the news portrays the candidates, how do you feel? How do you feel when one brand of cell phone company tells you that they are better than another, and then the other says the same thing about the first company? Do you feel as if you don't know who to trust or that it all may be just a big joke? This project examines that gap of faith that everyone knows exists but the media ignores.

Your contribution will help me move this project forward from the conception stage to finished product by the end of 2017. By helping in this stage, you are setting up the potential to create a piece of interactive art (the website) that will give the you a voice that tells the media you're paying attention.

I need this residency period to build the foundation for the tangible finished product, of which you can possibly be one of the first participants on the above noted community website when it goes live in September 2017.

Proof of Previous Success

  • Kickstarter
  • my Fractured Atlas page 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk is delay of the project. Without your support I'm going to need to find other funding, and at this point in time that could take months. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can share this with friends, family, or better yet someone in the art world who might see this project as something valuable. They might even see a parallel with their project and want to join forces.

Did someone say tax-deductible?

Yes, your contributions are either 100% or partially tax-deductible depending on the reward you choose. So give the money to me instead of the government. I'm going to do something better with it anyway, and you'll get something back, too.

Below is the technical language, but in layman’s terms this is possible due to this project having a 501(3)(c) organization (Fractured Atlas) as my fiscal sponsor. Any donation made to this project goes to them and then they give it to me. This relationship is necessary for many artists to receive tax-deductible donations as well as the possibility to apply for grants as an organization vs. as an individual artist. You can see more about Fractured Atlas here, and my page with them is here.

Novo-Surrealism Residency in Lisbon, Portugal is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-­profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Novo-Surrealism Residency in Lisbon, Portugal must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” only. Any contribution above the value of the goods and services received by the donor is tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

Contributions for the charitable purposes of Novo-Surrealism Residency in Lisbon, Portugal must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” only. Any contribution above the value of the goods and services received by the donor is tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
Hope and Survival is a piece of history immortalized in a work of art by Nova Scotian Laurie Swim. 

In December 2017 it will be 100 years since the largest man-made explosion before Hiroshima rocked Halifax Harbour killing 4% of the city's population!

Laurie Swim is a Nova Scotian fibre artist known for her large-scale community art projects. For the past 4 years, she has been working on a monumental memorial quilt "Hope and Survival" dedicated to those killed or injured during the explosion. The artwork consists of two elements: The Scroll of Remembrance 4' h x 36' w (1.1 m x 11m) and the Hope and Survival centrepiece 8' h x 12' w (2.4 m x 3.6 m). It will be the only memorial of the explosion listing the names of all the dead in beaded Braille — completed with the help of 400 volunteers — on a "Scroll of Remembrance," in recognition of those left with eye injuries from the blast.

"...Laurie Swim believes in her subjects. She is able to choose fabrics whose textures she understands. And with this understanding she is able to bring warmth and comfort to even the most demanding of her quilts." Mary Pratt, 2007

 

Teresa MacInnes and Kent Nason from Sea to Sea Productions are filmmakers based in Nova Scotia. They have been documenting Laurie's progress over the past 4 years. They made the short film included above, and are working on a longer piece showing the creative process and insights of the artist. It will accompany the completed quilt on display at the Halifax International Airport, at the Maritime Museum of the Atlantic, and at gallery and museum installations in the future.

Based on Laurie's research for the quilt, she has also written a children's book called "Hope and Survival: A Story of the Halifax Explosion" using elements from the quilt as illustration. She plans to publish this book in the summer of 2017.

About the Artist

Laurie Swim has been making art for 40 years. In 2013 she was awarded Nova Scotia's Portia White Prize for Cultural and Artistic Excellence. Her work is in many private and public collections, including the Art Gallery of Nova Scotia, the City of Toronto Art Collection, and the Museum of Arts and Design in New York. She has originated six monumental art projects. Completed with the help of volunteers, the resulting art is an effective means for bringing issues to public attention to institute cultural change, to raise awareness, and to celebrate the creativity of a group effort.

 

What We Need

The money raised in this campaign will be used primarily to support the artist to complete her work on the memorial quilt. It will also be used to complete a longer documentary film and with the publication of her children's book.

The completed work of art will be exhibited at the Maritime Museum of the Atlantic for the anniversary of the explosion in December 2017.

"Hope and Survival" remembers the heroic efforts made to help those in need and acknowledges a legacy of survival that continues to this day. Laurie is grateful to have received a creation grant in 2012 from Arts Nova Scotia. Let's help her finish her work and fund the final push ahead of the centennial.

We have some exciting perks for you and thank you from the bottom of our hearts for supporting the arts in Nova Scotia.

Other Ways You Can Help

Contribute what you can. We've made sure there are a range of sponsorship levels but if you can't offer a donation please spread the word through your social networks and make some noise for us! Every little bit helps. 

Thank you from Laurie Swim and her team in beautiful Lunenburg, Nova Scotia!

story:
Short Summary

  • HAUS OF started out as a conversation about our upset over the busyness of city life and a real interest in building a fun-filled creative arts community that could be accessible to everyone. We noticed that we and many of our friends were unhappy with the hum-drum monotony of daily life. We noticed that there were many vulnerable groups in London that were not properly connected to arts therapies that would deeply benefit them. HAUS OF is built on the solid belief that everyone should be able to access hands on creative time so that they can be as happy as possible. Starting HAUS OF seemed like the most obvious solution. 
  • This campaign is the first of its kind. This is our first attempt at crowdfunding, so we have set our sights high! It's incredible that our company has developed so much since it began in December 2018. We need YOU to help us put down roots in East London in summer 2019 so that we can really make an impact.
  • Funding is dwindling from the government to local charities who help the vulnerable groups that HAUS OF seeks to help. We're taking it into our own hands to give back to the community. Mental health and homelessness are now considered a crisis and populations needing assistance are forecast to grow. NHS resources aren't sufficient enough. It's time we do something to lift the strain.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need a total of £3,000 from this campaign, a realistic goal we've set for this platform. We really need a total of £16,000 to make this project work, but we know that £3,000 will give us much needed start-up resources. 
  • If you pledge, we'd like to thank you with lots of gifts! (see below)
  • We are putting these funds toward a studio, tools and cost of running our classes. 

The Impact

The contribution you will make will be FUNDAMENTAL to the success of our business. 

  • Rough sleeping and mental illness are considered a crisis in London. People in these categories deserve art therapies that are low cost or free. HAUS OF is special because we offer a myriad of art classes under one roof. 
  • We've already held successful classes and we're building partnerships with local organisations right now to help us expand our reach! 
  • We, the founders of HAUS OF, have both suffered with addiction and mental illness for many years. HAUS OF was born out of frustration that there are few places of refuge to access truly wholesome experiences in London. London is a hot spot for partying and alcohol, but when it comes to improving mental health and sticking to a healthy lifestyle, finding ways to socialise that don't involve lots of money or alcohol were hard to come by. HAUS OF is a place that focuses on building community and fun-filled experiences apart from the hustle and bustle of chaotic city life. 

Risks & Challenges

If we don't raise a total of £16,000 across all crowdfunding platforms we will not be able to move into a physical studio that we have put a down payment on. In this case, we'll have to think about ways to continue HAUS OF, whether this is continuing crowdfunding into summer 2019 or thinking up something even more adventurous. 

  • We've been working in charity, government and the arts for years. We know how to develop strong partnerships, grow membership, talk to press and market ourselves. 
  • In May 2019 this business won the creative category of the Big Idea Competition hosted by the Accelerator of London Metropolitan University. We have garnered support and have plenty of people cheering us on.
  • We're partnering with local charities who help us front the cost of our workshops too. Working with vulnerable groups is at the heart of our business concept.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!
  • Please share our project with people you know on Instagram (tag us @hau_of__), twitter and Facebook!
  • If you donate, you're awesome! Your donation is going to a great place. We can assure that people who really need our services are getting them and that the products we're making are unique and sustainable. If you message our Instagram, we'd love to do a shoutout to thank you for your donation! @haus_of__

In May 2019 this business won the creative category of the Big Idea Competition hosted by the Accelerator of London Metropolitan University. We have garnered support and have plenty of people cheering us on.

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!
Please share our project with people you know on Instagram (tag us @hau_of__), twitter and Facebook!
If you donate, you're awesome! Your donation is going to a great place. We can assure that people who really need our services are getting them and that the products we're making are unique and sustainable. If you message our Instagram, we'd love to do a shoutout to thank you for your donation! @haus_of__

story:
The Story Behind Feline Frequencies

We're Sean Ryan and Phil Vasta, creators of Soundspring Studio. We're a new music production studio, trying hard to break into the world of audio for games, film, and other forms of multimedia. While that continues to take shape, we've decided to use our resources to create an album that combines our music with something equally delightful - cats!

As cat owners, we can attest to the positives of having them in our lives. They are curious (sometimes mischievous!) little friends, sources of genuine laughter, and a soothing presence. They are, in a word, family.

Of course, one of the most beautiful aspects of cats is their semi-unique ability to purr. It is this ability that inspired us to write Feline Frequencies. By merging recorded purrs with original music, we hope to bring these wonderful sounds to those who cannot bring cats into their households. In fact, purrs may not only be pleasant to hear; studies have shown correlations to certain medical benefits.

If you value animals as we do, we'd love to have you on board as a contributor! To be clear, Feline Frequencies is finished - written, mixed, and mastered - so its release is not a question of "if" but of "when" (which we strongly anticipate to be early Summer 2018). Thus, any contributions will help Soundspring Studio to recoup the costs of creating this album, allowing us to continue to create as we cement ourselves as a credible source of talent in our industry. Last but certainly not least, 15% of all funds will be donated to a carefully selected animal shelter/organization.

The Perks

In order to successfully cover the costs of creating Feline Frequencies, making perks (we'll get to that in a second), and donating to a shelter, we've determined that we need to raise $3,000.

So what will you actually get when you contribute? We have perks ranging from digital wallpaper for your computer or phone, a downloadable copy of Feline Frequencies, and poster prints of the album art (created in part by Jaycie Mota). And for one contributor, Soundspring Studio will write a dedicated track just for your pet!

If you're unable to contribute but still want to help, please consider telling your friends and family, as well as sharing this campaign on Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter. And of course, sign up for updates on the album's release!

Help Us Help You Help Us

We truly appreciate your interest in helping Soundspring Studio in the release of our first album, Feline Frequencies. It's been a long road, but with a great collection of music and perks, we really think we have something special on our hands. Thank you!
